story:
On 12-18-20 a group of musicians from Alabama came together, supported by other musicians from around the country to help support Tuscaloosa, Alabama-based Druid City Brewing Company (DCBC).  With the challenges and limitations COVID-19 has presented this past year, the decision to make the music event virtual was a way for artists and audience to connect and interact in the safety of their own homes. Chat features provided through the live stream allowed for audience participation and sense of community that we all know and love as part of the DCBC music experience, but with the safety and social distancing allowed through being live streamed. It was a way for people to support an indie brewery that fosters original music and continues to fight hard to be a home for original music in West Alabama. The participating artists, and many others, formed a connection to a venue that works to support independent artists and a community who listened and made them feel welcome. This event helped keep DCBC above water through these challenging times while also helping artists reconnect to a loving and caring audience.

Among the artists were a group of amazingly talented musicians based in Tuscaloosa: Tom Rathe, Patrick O'Sullivan, Adam Ingram, Brantley Charles and the One Timers, Matthew Wurtele and Matt Bryant. These artists flourished and felt as much part of the DCBC family as they did performers. It felt like so much more than just a live stream or a concert, but an ode to the brewery and the community it has built. Through all the hard work by the many involved, we here at Druid City were able to see through a dark time and reconnect with all of our beloved performers and patrons through the live stream event. 

Druid City also happens to be neighbors with Oz Music, the last indie music store in Tuscaloosa. In an effort to support a sister small business that has always had such a strong foundation in the Tuscaloosa music scene, we thought it would be super cool to press these magical performances to vinyl and donate proceeds to Oz Music as well as showcase some of Tuscaloosa's finest indie musicians in one fail swoop. 

Oz will receive their normal margin on all records sold. The rest will be divided among the musicians who, through their selfless teamwork, enriched the lives of an entire community. We believe this will stand as a beautiful reminder that even during dark times there is still plenty of beauty in the world, and that through community and art we will make it through this together.

This is where y'all come in! Pre-ordering the album will help us cover the high upfront cost of set up and pressing this very small run of albums. There will be a standard cost of $20 with a limited number of 35 that will be hand signed by all the artist and hand numbered for a cost of $35. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts, from Oz's hearts and from the amazing humans that make our community what it is. Air hugs and high fives! Keep it between the mayo and mustard!

Bo

story:
About Me

I am a Nashville-based Singer/Songwriter.  This campaign will help me raise funds to record a new project which I will sell online, at live shows and house concerts (once they can happen again).

You can read my bio here: https://www.robharrisonline.com/bio

My good friend, Mike Waldron, will be producing this project. Mike is an in-demand Nashville musician, songwriter and producer. Lean more about him here: http://mike-waldron.com/

 

My Goal

  • To cover all the aspects of recording my next project, I am seeking to raise a minimum of $11,000.
  • During my successful 2013 Indiegogo campaign, I reached my goal to fund my CD "Winnebago" in only 10 days -- but only with the help of amazing folks like you! I'm hopeful and confident we can do it again.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know these are challenging days. If you can't offer financial support right now, no worries. There are still ways you can help:

  • Please help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by sharing it on your social media platforms.
  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

A special "thank you" to David Colòn with Motion Poet Productions in Nashville for producing my campaign video. Check them out: http://motionpoet.com/.  (This video was recorded safely before the 2020 pandemic began).

story:
Short Summary

My name is Matthew King, and I am  a multi-instrumentalist, producer, and the composer behind the band TapRoots.  TapRoots seeks to travel beyond the boundaries of traditional popular music, bringing the listener on a journey filled with catchy hooks, pulsing rhythms, thought provoking lyrics and intricate musical motifs, all fueled by a unique synthesis of sound, spirit and passion into a powerful listening experience.  While the music is an alchemical cauldron of rock, reggae, salsa, soul, folkloric rhythms and beyond, it taps into the roots of these traditions while imagining something refreshingly new.

In 2018, TapRoots released its debut self-titled CD. While the music and the band has been gaining momentum, performing at festivals and venues throughout the Northeastern US, the recent pandemic has had a crippling effect on our ability to perform publicly. But I have moved forward and used this time to build upon the creative momentum of the first album and write a new series of global fusion compositions that takes our original blend of Afro-Latin Folkloric Soul Fusion to new heights! I am hoping to get these new compositions into the studio this upcoming Summer, which is why I am appealing to you, my fans and fans-to-be, to help me realize this dream. The costs of studio time are beyond my humble means, but I am deeply passionate about realizing the fullness of this incredible music. It would mean everything to me if you could help me bring this music to the world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The production of a CD is no small task, as I found out the first time around. Studio time costs more money than I could have imagined, as well as editing, mixing, mastering, and printing CDs. All money collected through this process will go 100% towards the recording and releasing of this CD. From what I am led to understand, the very least I need to do this right is $15,000.

Here is a list of my current estimated expenses. 

Recording sessions- $7000-$8000 (including paying guest musicians for their time)

Mixing- $1500

Mastering- $1500

Original Artwork- $1200

CD Duplication- $2000

Promotion - $1000+ (this will be ongoing and most likely at least double)

New music to feed your body, mind and soul - Priceless !

Estimated total cost- $15,000+

If for some reason I don't meet my campaign goal, I will put all raised funds towards the recording process and do what I can to fund the rest myself, but for a poor public school teacher this will not be easy (which is why I need to ask y'all for help). I hope to make this music as affordable and accessible as possible to all, and hopefully it can continue to propel me further down this exciting musical journey that started 3 years ago.

As for perks, I will be printing up a very limited amount of T Shirts with the album cover art, seen on this fundraising page and once again designed by the amazing Martin Bridge, a limited run of posters, as well as a selection of my own home-made culinary and medicinal treats (Home Cooked Meals, Hot Sauce, Perfume oils, etc), percussion/guitar lessons and other prizes will be a part of the package as well.

With your help, I hope to get started recording this Summer, and hope for a New Year's release date.

The Impact

Anyone that knows my eclectic tastes in music will tell you that whatever I come up with will be a breath of fresh air and meaningful artistic contribution to the current state of contemporary music.  This music has something to say, and will lend its voice to the world at a time when we need more music with a message.  The themes of the songs range from the overtly political to the deeply esoteric and everything in-between. I am also an audiophile and a big fan of complex, thickly layered soundscapes; those that know my previous work will attest to my perfectionism and professionalism in the studio. For a taste of what the last CD sounded like, feel free to visit my website to stream it for free: https://www.thetaprootsmovement.com/ This one will take that blueprint and expand on it a thousandfold. In many ways, the last CD was the music that I personally wanted to hear in the world; this album is more about what the world has demanded of us all in these trying times of change.

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE do what you can to spread the word about this campaign: share it with all of your friends and family, put it out there on social media, and tell your rich uncles that this is right up their alley!

story:
A Vision into the Future

   

    A few years ago, after the death of a close relative, I had gone away from home to join a  shaman's ceremony in an attempt to erase my feelings of infinite darkness. What ended up happening was I traded one darkness for another. I experienced vivid hallucinations, or visions, of what I believe was the end of the world. Shockingly, the context that was most disturbing - was that it wasn't any big catastrophe that led to its demise. What killed the world was just normal everyday life...the apocalypse was being caused by business as usual. 

     As an artist I felt compelled to say something. 
    The storyboard for Business As Usual started in 2019, and at that time we had been waiting for the AR6 IPCC report to come out (in 2022) so that we could more accurately depict the storyline. After 'Just Wait', I was hesitant about making another animated video because they are very expensive and very difficult to make. But after reading policymaker summary, we decided there is no more time. In fact, some of the scenes had to be adjusted from the storyboard written in 2019 to instead reflect the predictions given by the IPCC, which are actually worse.

    The music is written by ManifestiV, an electronic industrial band who is currently residing in Texas, and is once again joining forces with MHR Cartoon to tell the story of our future: a future in which absolutely nothing was done, where business as usual continued, where old habits never died, where the debt of our extractions mounted until it all came painfully crashing down. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The money is used to help pay for the animator's time and effort. We (Paragraph Taylor and Eve Walding) are working on this massive project as a collaboration between MHR Cartoon and ManifestiV.  This video is a minute longer than "Just Wait" and will be much more detailed, complex, and impactful. The song in the music video can be found on ManifestiV's newest album, "Horsemen"

  • The official debut for the music video is online on October 27th 2021. All donors will get to see a sneak preview before then, on October 20th thru secret link

  • For every "survival box" perk purchased I will personally clean up one 13 gallon bag full of trash from a public place locally.

 

The Impact

    Help me help you help us. Spread the word! Every bag of trash I pick up gets posted on Instagram with a tag of your name, and/or a message you want to shout out  :-)

 

 

Risks & Challenges

This is not a physical product so theres no worry about having to mass produce a thing. Phew! Since the perks are not tied to the conclusion of the campaign, you are guaranteed to receive them.

  • This is also not our first rodeo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W-iUW6CoHSI&amp...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Join our email list to view the project before public release and to access secret perks!    - https://www.manifestiv.com/join-mailing-list.html
  • Do a trash pickup day in your area, photo it and tag us @ManifestiV !! let's do this

story:
Son of Sorrow is back! In 2021 we will be bringing you No Hope for the Fallen. A brand new studio album featuring 6 amazing new tracks.

We have finished song writing and are ready for recording. On this occasion we are parting ways with our former label and taking absolute control of the entire creative process. While there are costs that have been already assumed by the band, such as artwork and part of the production, after a year without live shows we are relying on our fans to help us reach our target and make gothic metal great again!

If you could consider backing us, not only will you be enjoying our new tracks before anyone else, you will be an integral part of this album.

Will you help us spread the sorrow?

 

ABOUT THE ALBUM

No Hope for the Fallen continues in the line of our debut album Rulers of a Dying World. You can expect some catchy gothic metal anthems and darker and more epic tracks. Sounds good? There’s more!

The new tracks will also feature the latest addition to the Son of Sorrow family, our new vocalist Yolanda Rosado, which will allow us to explore new sounds with contrasting male and female vocals, reminding diehard fans of some of the most iconic bands in the genre.

If our previous album managed to collect awards and nominations as ‘Best Gothic Metal Album of the Year’, we are confident that we are on track to once again reap awesome reviews with our new E.P.

Tracklist, including a brief description is as follows:

1. Hope is a Prelude to Sorrow. – an instrumental overture, a crescendo of crows.

2. No Hope for the Fallen – The title track: powerful and melodic Nu Goth Metal.

3. Error – an energetic track kicking off with a memorable piano melody.

4. Firebird – Gothic Rock for petrol-heads.

5. Sin King – Doomy Gothic Metal, with lyrics that will tear your heart out.

6. A Forlorn Memory – our voyage into Epic Gothic Metal.

*Following recording, the tracklist’s order may vary.

 

WHAT YOU WILL BE HELPING WITH:

We are aiming to achieve a goal of 1,200 Euros, which is only a part of the costs of putting together the new album, in order to complete this exciting project. Your contribution will help us with the following:

  • Recording Costs: We will be returning to Jotun Studio, Spain, working with producer Leo Peña. While production has commenced, we are still facing mixing and further recording sessions. Once this is complete, we will be then mastering all tracks at the amazing Finnvox studios, Finland, who have worked with heavyweights of the genre such as HIM, The 69 Eyes or Nightwish among many others.
  • Music Video Production: We will be releasing two amazing cinematographic music videos with production company Firec Multimedia. All backers will be invited to the online premiere.
  • Photo Shoot.
  • Printing CDs, featuring amazing artwork by Nekro.

 

ABOUT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS:

Every claimed perk will include a digital download of the album. Perks including physical copies include shipping costs to the EU and the UK. Please contact for information regarding international shipping costs.

If you have any questions or if you need any assistance before contributing, please contact us at contact@sonofsorrow.com or through our Facebook messenger.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

If you cannot contribute to this campaign by claiming a perk, there are still many other ways you can help us out:

  • Share this campaign: We would be very grateful if you could help us share this campaign on your social media: https://igg.me/at/sonofsorrow
  • You can download our debut album from Bandcamp free of charge or name your price, from as little as 1 euro.
  • Follow us on social media, engage with our content – Likes and reactions are cool, comments and shares are even better!

story:
Our Project

Guerilla Opera has spent the last 12 years curating a new repertoire of chamber opera in performances that have garnered major press attention and rave reviews. The next step is to send our repertoire out into the world in high-quality albums, garnering us a wider reputation as a leader of contemporary opera.

Marti Epstein, composer of Rumpelstiltskin

 

Our Mission

Guerilla Opera is more than just an opera company. We like to think of ourselves as a chamber ensemble, or even a band! This album will feature our amazing roster of musicians: Aliana de la Guardia (Rumpelstiltskin), Britt Brown (Gretchen), Emily Thorner (Miller), Brian Church (King), Lilit Hartunian (Violin), Stephen Marotto (Cello), Philipp Stäudlin (Saxophone), and Mike Williams (Percussion)!

The cast of Rumpelstiltskin in the recording studio!

 

We Need Your Help!

Working with esteemed recording engineer Joel Gordon, we have already recorded the entire opera on March 9-10 at Blue Jay Recording Studio. We have already covered the artist fees. Below are the costs associated with the recording session and subsequent album:

  • 20 hours Studio Time with engineer at $100 per hour = $2000
  • Studio Rental = $1000
  • Producers & Assistants = $500
  • 20 hours estimated editing at $90 per hour = $1800
  • Mastering = $2000
  • Label Costs, TBD, estimated = $3200

Total = $10,500

We are currently asking for a smaller amount to get us started as we shop this album to labels.

 

Joel Gordon, engineer and  Guerilla pianist Tae Kim making his producer debut in the studio!

 

Why Donate?

We work with incredible composers each season on new works, and we want our repertoire to have legs and be performed by companies across the world. Our recordings will make this repertoire more accessible and cement our reputation as an established contemporary opera ensemble. It will also earn our composers increased fame with wider audiences. 

As a thank you, we will provide perks including a digital or physical copy of the album, a shout-out on our website, programs, and CD booklets, tickets to upcoming shows, and more! All donations are tax deductible.

 

What else can you do to help?

In order for this project to be a success, we need donations - no matter how small! After you make a donation, please help us spread the word by:

  • Sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, etc.
  • Email the link to this campaign to your friends and tell them all about us!
  • Like our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter and Instagram.

 

Thank You!

This project would not be possible without your support, and we are so grateful to you for your continued generosity! We look forward to seeing you at a future show, and to celebrating the release of our next album with you!
story_txt:
Our Project
Guerilla Opera has spent the last 12 years curating a new repertoire of chamber opera in performances that have garnered major press attention and rave reviews. The next step is to send our repertoire out into the world in high-quality albums, garnering us a wider reputation as a leader of contemporary opera.

Marti Epstein, composer of Rumpelstiltskin
 
Our Mission
Guerilla Opera is more than just an opera company. We like to think of ourselves as a chamber ensemble, or even a band! This album will feature our amazing roster of musicians: Aliana de la Guardia (Rumpelstiltskin), Britt Brown (Gretchen), Emily Thorner (Miller), Brian Church (King), Lilit Hartunian (Violin), Stephen Marotto (Cello), Philipp Stäudlin (Saxophone), and Mike Williams (Percussion)!


The cast of Rumpelstiltskin in the recording studio!
 
We Need Your Help!
Working with esteemed recording engineer Joel Gordon, we have already recorded the entire opera on March 9-10 at Blue Jay Recording Studio. We have already covered the artist fees. Below are the costs associated with the recording session and subsequent album:

20 hours Studio Time with engineer at $100 per hour = $2000
Studio Rental = $1000
Producers & Assistants = $500
20 hours estimated editing at $90 per hour = $1800
Mastering = $2000
Label Costs, TBD, estimated = $3200

Total = $10,500
We are currently asking for a smaller amount to get us started as we shop this album to labels.
 


Joel Gordon, engineer and  Guerilla pianist Tae Kim making his producer debut in the studio!
 
Why Donate?
We work with incredible composers each season on new works, and we want our repertoire to have legs and be performed by companies across the world. Our recordings will make this repertoire more accessible and cement our reputation as an established contemporary opera ensemble. It will also earn our composers increased fame with wider audiences. 
As a thank you, we will provide perks including a digital or physical copy of the album, a shout-out on our website, programs, and CD booklets, tickets to upcoming shows, and more! All donations are tax deductible.

 
What else can you do to help?
In order for this project to be a success, we need donations - no matter how small! After you make a donation, please help us spread the word by:

Sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, etc.
Email the link to this campaign to your friends and tell them all about us!
Like our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter and Instagram.

 Thank You!This project would not be possible without your support, and we are so grateful to you for your continued generosity! We look forward to seeing you at a future show, and to celebrating the release of our next album with you!

story:
About the Project

I'm Zachary and I have been writing and recording music under the stage name Apres Pompeii for almost 10 years now. At the beginning of 2020 I started to record a few leftover songs that hadn't been recorded and released yet--these songs eventually grew into more songs and those songs formed what is to be my 3rd full length record: Clay. As a music lover and collector it's always been my dream to have one of my projects be released on vinyl and this feels like the perfect record to press--these songs are lush, intimate, and spacious and I really think they'd shine on wax

Why Crowdfund?

Until this project I have always funded my music 100% out of my own pocket. Clay is recorded, mastered, and ready to release but vinyl done correctly would require a remaster for the format change. Also I plan to work as local and small as possible and cutting out mass production also raises the price but would keep the money in the community and keep things as independent as we can.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know how difficult the past year has been for so many people and know that giving any amount is a lot to ask. I really believe in these songs and all I ask is that you share them as much as possible--at the end of the day my greatest dream is just for the music to be heard. Hopefully this batch of songs can bring some comfort, catharsis, or beauty into your lives

Cheers,

Zachary ❤️

 

The album artwork:

story:
Who we are and what's the plan

We are Angel Nation, a melodic metal band based in UK/Germany. We are beyond excited to finally be recording our third album called 'Antares' (album cover artwork by Sledgehammer Graphix). It’s been a while since our last release Aeon, but believe us, it’s worth the wait! This album will bring Angel Nation back with full force, showcasing 10 tracks of musical versatility and evolvement of the band. For the powerful sound these songs deserve, we’re happy to be joining forces with Alexander Krull, who will be mixing and mastering our album.

We’re asking you to join us on this journey to make this album a reality! A huge thank you in advance for your help and we can’t wait for you to hear the final result, which we think is our best work yet!

 

What We Need & What You Get

As many of you know, making an album is much more than just recording the musical parts. To get an idea, here’s a few examples:

  • Mixing & Mastering
  • Artwork
  • Photoshoots
  • Videoshoots
  • Promotion before and after release

..and of course we hope there will be touring in the future!

All this added together means costs get high, so we’re asking for your help to make it happen. Our goal won't cover everything, but all funds raised will be used towards the release of the album. In return we’ve created some unique perks that we hope you find interesting and engaging. There are some very exclusive offers and opportunities to support us.

Ultimate package: Can't wait? Video of a cover song and Elina talking about the album and why it took so long to write will be accessible right after the campaign ends! 

  **CLICK ON EACH PERK TO REVEAL MORE DETAILS**

Shhhhhhhh .....check out a SECRET Perk: https://angelnationofficial.com

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The power of social media is huge, so if you can share the campaign and spread the word about our music, we’d hugely appreciate it!

https://www.facebook.com/AngelNationMusic

https://www.instagram.com/angelnationofficial/

https://open.spotify.com/artist/6a6pLnsC3PywiBT...

story:
The New Album: This Is What I Offer You

The time has come to record my next album!  My plan was to get into the studio last summer.  Ha!  Amidst endless pivots and life adaptations I had to put the project on a year long pause and navigate the many challenges of Covid life.  During the early days of the pandemic I felt exceptionally lost.  The sudden dismantling of ritual, community and childcare left me feeling a bit unrecognizable to myself.  I slowly found my way back through new songs, a vegetable garden, and a fierce dedication to staying a float in order to be present for those that I care for.  We’ve all been through an exceptionally hard year.  My vision for this album is to provide an entry point so that we can begin to feel a renewed sense of comfort and healing. 

The Journey Here:

In 2007, I recorded my first album Zum Gali Gali.  My vision back then was to give Jewish families great music that both kids and parents would enjoy listening to.  Little did I know that my songs would come to have an impact that went far beyond entertainment.  I have been so moved to hear your stories of how my music has become a part of your life in both challenging moments and also in times of celebration.  I have been a part of your playlists and carpool sing-a-longs, dance parties and morning meditations.  Truly, this was my dream when I started recording and writing music.   To date, I am honored to report that I have close to 500,000 streams on Spotify.  But...unfortunately digital streaming barely pays, so I need your help to make this next album. 

I have been praying and singing with you for over 15 years and this collection of 12 original melodies is a reflection of that musical and spiritual evolution.  You have given me the courage to put this new music out into the world and share a more personal and intimate expression of my own prayers. 

It's GO Time!

I’m blessed to get to work in partnership again with my husband Saul Kaye who will be co-producing with me.  Yay!  Also, I couldn’t be more excited to be working with bassist Aaron Shaul and drummer David Rokeach.  They are freakin’ exceptional.  The studio is booked for early July so let’s get this fundraiser started!  

The $25,000 raised for this campaign will go directly to:

  • professional musicians
  • production / editing
  • sheet music notation 
  • studio time / engineer
  • mixing / mastering
  • product replication / digital distribution
  • graphic design/ artwork / photography
  • postage/ perks / shwag 

 

I have some great perks coming your way.  I’m most excited about custom made leather bracelets and brand new apparel.  It would mean the world to me for you to support the project.  Please forward this to your friends and family if you think they might enjoy my music. Word of mouth, referrals, “LIKES” and “SHARES.”  Repost on FB,  use Indiegogo share tools or go old skool and send an email!  It all helps this campaign flow towards financial fruition!

These songs are my offering to you.  Such gratitude for your support.  

All my heart, 

Elana

story:
Summary

Here we go again! Don't Say Love will be my fourth original single and final music video before dropping my seven song E.P. As you know with my first video, Omertà, my goal is to approach every music video more like a film. With that, comes major production logistics to keep the visuals in a cinematic world rather than typical pop videos. 

The last campaign was such a success, I decided to aim even bigger for the finale of this era. The visuals for Don't Say Love will be heavily inspired by Ridley Scott's, Blade Runner. Cinematically futuristic, cyber-punk, and dystopian.

 

What We Need 

BEFORE YOU FREAK OUT - "That sounds expensive!" - if only 400 people donate $25 we already achieve the goal! Not so impossible! Whatever you can contribute will be utilized responsibly. We understand the state of things around the world right now, so even $1 counts!  

As an actor, I have been very lucky to accumulate a wide network of incredible talents in all sorts of industries. From videographers, to visionary directors, to stylists and talented hair and makeup gurus - I want to make this project not only visually stunning, but incorporate as many of these talented artists as I can, AND PAY THEM! 

I hope this footage will elevate the song to a level that will leave a lasting impression. This will all come down to having the necessary budget to allocate to all the needs of a project on this scale.

THE MONEY WILL GO TO- Locations, permits, editing, film equipment, insurance, sound, crew members, fees, director, talent, props, styling, makeup, hair, post-production marketing, Covid safety measures, and more.

So I know its cringe to crowdfund, but I love artists, my friends and music, and I want to aim big!  We did it once, we can do it again!

 

What You'll Get

Check out the perks for donating! 

$15 - Your Name in the Credits

$25 - Personalized Video 

$40 - Twitter Follow

$50 - Digital Signed Poster

$100 - 1 on 1 Zoom Meet Up

$250 - Producer Credit

$350 - Signed Prop

 

The Impact

If we do meet our goal, I hope that you will also watch this video and feel how emotionally invested I am in the entire process and creation of this vision. The end result will be something I am doing FOR YOU GUYS. I want to keep making things for you guys with more resources available to me in the future. This video will set the bar for record labels, producers and musical business endeavors! I am also so happy to be able to provide work for artists at this time and include as many of them as I can in the making of this music film.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share this page as much as possible, or simply just send good energy to my team and I so that the process of creating this will go smoothly and be fun for everyone involved and beyond!

story:
Short Summary

The God Bombs are raising funds (via pre-order packages) to release our new concept album *SUPERNOVAS* in Fall 2021! We are writing and recording in Los Angeles and Colombia, produced by original God Bombs co-founderJabbath Roa.

This album will tell the story of two beings: the *SUPERNOVAS*, who are sent to Earth on a divine mission to save humanity...from itself. Along the way they become confused, tormented and eventually absorbed into the circus-like human society.  

This epic collection of songs spans our usual cocktail of alternative. metal, industrial, punk & trap! This time with a more melodic dimension and musical scope that is by far our most ambitious undertaking! This is the record fans have been waiting for!

What We Need & What You Get

The God Bombs is currently 100% fan and self-funded! We run our own record label with our own investment, and we require outside investment to give this project the proper promotion it needs... and DESERVES...in order to succeed! Our last EP 'Plague Songs' was a big success with our existing fan base! We busted our asses, filming, editing and releasing music videos for every single song on there in order to promote the return of the God Bombs! But with *SUPERNOVAS* we are aiming to gain NEW fans and reach beyond the core fan base with NEW methods of promotion: 

- Full Blown P.R. Campaign 

- Tour to promote the album

- Spotify playlisting 

- High quality music videos

- Physical pressings (CD & possibly Vinyl) 

- Mastering 15-20 songs?!!! (this alone is at least $2K in expenses)

In return for donating, you get awesome perks including:

- a pre-order of the new album, digitally, in CD...

- exclusive album related merch designs...

- exclusive fan experiences...

- bargain bin Justin Symbol t-shirts...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends! Share God Bombs videos and tell people our new album *SUPERNOVAS* is coming! Spread the word about our campaign on social media!

Also...For this album campaign we will be creating street teams to help spread the word! We encourage our fans to get involved! Email us at godbombsband@gmail.com with the subject: STREET TEAM

story:
Your Support Will Make It Happen! 

 

Hi, everyone! I’m Alex Hollmann, and I am so excited to officially announce the release of my new album Out with the Tide on September 3rd, 2021! Last summer, I had the pleasure of going to a professional studio to record 14 original songs, but now I need your help to finish funding the manufacturing, distribution, and launch of the album during this 20-day crowdfunding campaign. With your support, I plan to finally release my music to all of your favorite places to get music – Spotify, Apple Music, iTunes, YouTube, Amazon, and for those that still love a physical copy, a limited-edition CD. The deadline to contribute is Saturday, August 28, 2021 11:59pm PDT. The project is in the final stretch, but I need your help to bring it (into your) home! 

 

About Out with the Tide 

Out with the Tide is a collection of 14, never-before-released original songs. I have been songwriting since I was in junior high, but this is the first time I am truly putting my music out there for the world to hear. All the songs are written and performed by me – just me singing with my piano – true to how the songs were originally conceived. The album has songs about letting go, songs about yearning for connection, and songs about how sometimes those two things conflict. 
 

Click on a link below to listen to my first single "This Still Could Be Your Song" on your favorite music platform! 
Spotify
Apple Music
Amazon Music
YouTube
SoundCloud

 

The Goal

My crowdfunding goal is $2,500 based on the remaining costs to get the album fully released. The music has already been recorded, mixed, and mastered, but there are just a few more steps before it reaches you. 

Your support will help to fund:
•    Digital distribution – putting my music on Spotify, Apple Music, Amazon Music, etc. 
•    CD manufacturing & distribution – producing the physical album and getting it to YOU. 
•    Marketing – getting the word out so everyone knows where to listen. 
•    Album launch – celebrating the official release with an event/concert. 

I’ve chosen Indiegogo’s “flexible funding” option, so even if we don’t reach the goal, the album will still move forward as planned and you will receive your perks!

 

What You Get –The Perks

The whole point of this project is to get my music to YOU. When you support this crowdfunding campaign, you get perks in return – really, it’s the first opportunity to claim your copy of the music. Click on a box to the right to learn more about the different perk packages.  Some highlights:    
•    Thank yous on social media and the album website to all contributors
•    Digital downloads of the album and singles
•    Signed physical album with a personal note
•    Digital album booklet with lyrics and artist notes 
•    Exclusive, personalized video thank you and performance of a song
•    Private concert 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can, please share this campaign (and really, the album in general) with anyone you think might be interested in my music! Share it on social media, send it in an email, or even talk it up in your Zoom calls! 

Follow me on Instagram (@alexhollmannarts) and Facebook (facebook.com/alexhollmannarts). Don’t miss any important updates about the album! 

 

Mark Your Calendars

August 13th – Release of my first single “This Still Could Be Your Song”
August 20th – Release of my second single “Run With Me”
August 21st – Pre-sale of the album begins (with early-access track “Out with the Tide”)
September 3rd – OFFICIAL RELEASE DATE OF THE ALBUM  OUT WITH THE TIDE

 

Thank you so much!

Thank you, everyone, for all of your support! This album has been a long time coming, so I am thrilled to finally share my music with you all. Over the years, writing these songs has been an important way for me to work through….life, I suppose. Hopefully, they resonate with you, or at the very least, bring a little joy to you. Thank you so much! I can’t wait for you to hear it!

The deadline to contribute is Saturday, August 28, 2021 11:59pm PDT. The project is in the final stretch, but I need your help to bring it (into your) home! 
 
About Out with the Tide 
Out with the Tide is a collection of 14, never-before-released original songs. I have been songwriting since I was in junior high, but this is the first time I am truly putting my music out there for the world to hear. All the songs are written and performed by me – just me singing with my piano – true to how the songs were originally conceived. The album has songs about letting go, songs about yearning for connection, and songs about how sometimes those two things conflict.  
Click on a link below to listen to my first single "This Still Could Be Your Song" on your favorite music platform! SpotifyApple MusicAmazon MusicYouTubeSoundCloud
 
The Goal
My crowdfunding goal is $2,500 based on the remaining costs to get the album fully released. The music has already been recorded, mixed, and mastered, but there are just a few more steps before it reaches you. 
Your support will help to fund:•    Digital distribution – putting my music on Spotify, Apple Music, Amazon Music, etc. •    CD manufacturing & distribution – producing the physical album and getting it to YOU. •    Marketing – getting the word out so everyone knows where to listen. •    Album launch – celebrating the official release with an event/concert. 
I’ve chosen Indiegogo’s “flexible funding” option, so even if we don’t reach the goal, the album will still move forward as planned and you will receive your perks!
 
What You Get –The Perks
The whole point of this project is to get my music to YOU. When you support this crowdfunding campaign, you get perks in return – really, it’s the first opportunity to claim your copy of the music. Click on a box to the right to learn more about the different perk packages.  Some highlights:    •    Thank yous on social media and the album website to all contributors•    Digital downloads of the album and singles•    Signed physical album with a personal note•    Digital album booklet with lyrics and artist notes •    Exclusive, personalized video thank you and performance of a song•    Private concert 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can, please share this campaign (and really, the album in general) with anyone you think might be interested in my music! Share it on social media, send it in an email, or even talk it up in your Zoom calls! 
Follow me on Instagram (@alexhollmannarts) and Facebook (facebook.com/alexhollmannarts). Don’t miss any important updates about the album! 
 
Mark Your Calendars
August 13th – Release of my first single “This Still Could Be Your Song”August 20th – Release of my second single “Run With Me”August 21st – Pre-sale of the album begins (with early-access track “Out with the Tide”)September 3rd – OFFICIAL RELEASE DATE OF THE ALBUM  OUT WITH THE TIDE
 
Thank you so much!
Thank you, everyone, for all of your support! This album has been a long time coming, so I am thrilled to finally share my music with you all. Over the years, writing these songs has been an important way for me to work through….life, I suppose. Hopefully, they resonate with you, or at the very least, bring a little joy to you. Thank you so much! I can’t wait for you to hear it!

story:
We've been told we're not making opera in the normal way.

Well, that’s always been our intention. 

For more than four hundred years, operas have been written and performed around the world, but there’s been a common thread in the majority of these works: women suffer. Often at the hands of men who seek to control them. But what if women commanded the narrative?

Iphigenia is an opera debased on the myths by Euripides, with music by legendary 11-time Grammy Award-winning saxophonist and composer Wayne Shorter and a libretto by bassist, composer, and vocalist Esperanza Spalding, the first jazz musician to be awarded the Grammy for Best New Artist. Their subversive and daring interrogation of the tale of the sacrificial daughter of Greece represents Wayne's first foray into the classical form, and the culmination of a lifelong dream of his to compose an opera since he was a 19 year-old music student.

Iphigenia is not an adaptation of the Greek myth as much as it is an intervention into myth-making itself. Led by award-winning director Lileana Blain-Cruz, and abetted by luminary architect and scenic designer Frank Gehry, the entire creative process has led us to understand how stories have been traditionally told, and how we must disrupt existing systems and create our own alternative structures and stories.

Real Magic is artist-led development.

Artists need the right conditions to do their best work. To meet this need, Esperanza and executive creative producer Jeff Tang founded an independent company, Real Magic, to bring Iphigenia to life. Working in partnership with producer Cath Brittan and with Mara Isaacs of Octopus Theatricals, along with our co-commissioning partners, our goal has been to develop Iphigenia in an environment of radical experimentation and open collaboration, free from commercial expectations. Over the past two years we've done just that, working and rehearsing out of college classrooms, guest houses, black box theaters, and even Frank Gehry's kitchen. And now, we're ready to bring it to the world.

We need your help to make it happen.

Freedom brings responsibility, and creating an opera with world-class artists and collaborators brings costs. The COVID-19 pandemic may have thrown us off our original track, but as Wayne says, resistance is simply the force that helps planes get off the ground. By joining together and adding your voice to our growing chorus of supporters, which also includes sponsors and partners, we can realize this once in a generation collaborative vision.

Your support for the creation of Iphigenia through your tax-deductible* contribution will go directly to underwriting our incredible artists, designers, and creative team, as well as the final development workshop leading up to our premiere and tour (soon to be announced!) in Fall 2021 and beyond. In return, you'll receive unique benefits, including special access to conversations and rehearsals, limited edition merch, and of course, public recognition.

Please give what you can and spread the word!

We stand in gratitude.

All donations will be matched up to a total of $50,000, courtesy of a generous contribution from Thomas M. Neff.

Please contact us directly if you are interested in making a donation at any amount above what is already listed on this page, or if your company or foundation would like to provide support for this project. While this crowdfunding campaign is a key piece to our overall funding strategy, additional donations will be needed to meet our overall fundraising goal to bring Iphigenia to the stage.

For project updates, follow us @IphigeniaOpera on Instagram & Twitter, or Facebook!

*All backer contributions are tax-deductible in the United States, minus the cost of any non tax-deductible good(s) received (amounts and specifics are detailed with each backer level).

**Iphigenia personnel are subject to change. Project followers and backers will be notified of any changes via the website, Indiegogo campaign, and social media.

________________________________________________________________________________________

Team Iphigenia is:

Composer: Wayne Shorter

Librettist & Performer: Esperanza Spalding

Director: Lileana Blain-Cruz

Conductor: Clark Rundell

Scenic Design: Frank Gehry

Core Musicians: Brian Blade, Danilo Pérez, and John Patitucci of the Wayne Shorter Quartet

A cappella vocal arrangements: Caroline Shaw

Additional text: Ganavya Doraiswamy, Joy Harjo, Safiya Sinclair

Dramaturg: Sunder Ganglani

Music Coordinator: Phillip Golub

Executive Creative Producer: Jeff Tang & Esperanza Spalding / Real Magic

Producer: Cath Brittan

Tour Producer: Mara Isaacs / Octopus Theatricals

External Relations & Advancement: Jenna Wolf

Development & Partnerships Producer: Mika Shino

Social Media: ffflypaper

//

Co-Commissioning Partners

Cal Performances at the University of California, Berkeley

The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts

The Broad Stage

ArtsEmerson, Boston

Carolina Performing Arts

MASS MoCA

______________________________________________________________________________________

Esperanza, Wayne, and Frank

Collaborators = Co-Liberators! (photo courtesy Esperanza Spalding)

story:
GROUNDED AGAIN is as much for you as it was for me

An artist isn't much without an audience.  Though we're compelled to create for the sake of creating, we also need to influence, inspire, and touch the lives of others with the works we produce.  To that end, you are essential.

GROUNDED AGAIN tells a story that I'm certain most - if not all - of you are intimately familiar with.  Man falls in love, man gets his heart broken, man struggles to find his place in the world, man fights depression and the disillusionment from even more failed relationships.

I am confident that there's at least one song in GROUNDED AGAIN that's for you.  I wrote the album for me, but I'm sharing it for you.

What I Need (& What You Get)

I am an amateur "living room" producer, and there's a lot I can't do:

  • Mastering - Tracks must be mastered to get the best sound out of the work I've done.  This isn't something I'm skilled at, so I must turn to others.  Automated mastering is a thing now, and a 14-track album can run anywhere from $120-140.  Professional mastering is significantly more expensive but produces much higher quality results.  Professional mastering for this album would run me about $600
  • Digital Distribution - Services like Spotify, Google Play, etc... are vital to independent artists these days.  Digital distribution is required to reach the widest audience possible and to provide my fans with the most convenient access to my music.  This will cost around $50.
  • Download Cards - As much as I still love the old-school, traditional format of a physical CD, most people want digital albums.  And although streaming services are ideal in most cases, some folks would rather own a copy to ensure they always have access.  This will cost me about $50.
  • Hard copies - I know I've just spent the last two bullets talking about digital music, but I can't turn my back on the physical format.  A real, in-hand album is the true culmination of everything an artist has worked toward.  To me, an album's cover and booklet art are just as much a part of the final expression as the songs themselves.  My debut album was popular in this format, selling copies both Stateside and Internationally.  I was quite popular in Brazil, believe it or not!  100 copies of the album as currently designed will cost about $530.

What do you get for helping out??

Depending on how much you're able to help out and how much (in total) I manage to earn from my generous fans, perks could include:

  • A digital copy of GROUNDED AGAIN (hopefully with a digital booklet, if I can iron out the logistics for that)
  • A physical copy of GROUNDED AGAIN in CD format, in a full-color digipak with lyrics booklet
  • A cover of any song of your choosing
  • A "jingle" written especially for you about you (or whatever else* you request)
  • A physical and/or digital copy of my debut album
  • A shoutout in the GROUNDED AGAIN lyrics booklet

So what's the bottom line?

If I hit my goal, all perks will be deliverable on the timeline designated.  The bare minimum I can raise to meet all digital perks is $245.  Physical copies of GROUNDED AGAIN will be delayed if I don't hit my desired goal ($785).  They'll be deliverable just as soon as I can save up the rest of the necessary funds.  I'll be sure to update you in that event, but we can avoid that by sharing this campaign with friends and family and encouraging them to pledge!!

story:
I am so excited to finally release my first, self-titled, EP on Madison Line Records this summer and cannot wait to share my soulful pop worship with the world! My desire is to reach people from every walk of life, who will hear themselves in my music and be encouraged that even in our brokenness, we all have the hope of a Savior.  

With a humbled heart, I ask for your support of this EP, first through your prayers - that every motive, attitude, and decision is within the Lord's will and that I will continue to trust in his provision. Secondly, through your financial support, you will help me cover the costs involved for this release to become a reality: recording, mixing, mastering, marketing, distribution, etc.  If you choose to make a donation, please check out the perks I've offered to you as a token of my appreciation! My personal favorite?  The ice cream outing.

Thank you in advance for the prayers and donations in order to make this project possible. I am extremely grateful for your help in any capacity! Please follow me @marcicolemanmusic on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter to stay connected about my new music and shows!

story:
Pourquoi cette campagne

Jusqu'à présent, nos concerts nous ont permis de financer la venue de Guillaume DUJARDIN, ingénieur du son au studio FERBER, l'un des plus grand studio parisien, et la location du studio "PolyneJah Records" à Taravao.

Nous lançons cette campagne pour financer le Master de notre album.

Quoi qu'il arrive, l'album sortira au mois d'avril 2017. Votre participation permettra d'améliorer la qualité finale de l'album car le prix d'un Master varie entre 500$ et 5000$...

Pour faire appel à votre soutien, nous avons choisi INDIEGOGO pour la possibilité de faire une campagne "flexible", c'est à dire que tous les fonds seront collectés.

Rassurez vous, toutes les contreparties seront honorées :

- L'album Mp3 est déjà financé et sortira au mois d'avril 2017.

- Les T-shirts et les Mugs sont imprimés, après votre commande et vos choix par mail, par notre partenaire du centre Vaima : KILICORNER  http://www.kilicorner.com/fr/.

 

Why this campagne

To this days our live shows enable us to rent Tahiti's top quality studio facility "PolyneJah Records" & to invite Mr Guillaume DUJARDIN sound engineer @ studio FERBER, one of the best parisian studio, to do the recording for us.

But we need your help to get the best Mastering possible, meaning the best sound quality for the LP.

All founds will be collcted and use by the band to bring you the best sound there is !

 

Contreparties

- L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 download)

Télécharger le nouvel album.

- Une Entrée + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + ticket for live show)

Recevez une place de concert (valable pour un concert à Tahiti  du 1/01/2017 au 31/12/2017) et le téléchargement de l'album Mp3. 

- Le Mug + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + Mug)

Recevez un Mug YELLOWSTONE (au choix) et le téléchargement de l'album Mp3.

Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf le modèle désiré.

- Le T-shirt + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + T-shirt)

Recevez un des T-shirt officiel YELLOWSTONE (au choix) et le téléchargement de l'album Mp3.

Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf vos choix de modèle et taille.

Homme >> Voir Photos

            1                         2                        3

           4                         5                        6                        7

 Femme   >>  Voir Photos 

            1                         2                        3

            4                        5                        6                        7

                                                                               

- Le Mug + Une Entrée + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + Mug + Ticket)

Recevez un Mug YELLOWSTONE (au choix), une place de concert (valable pour un concert à Tahiti  du 1/01/2017 au 31/12/2017) et le téléchargement de l'album Mp3.

Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf le modèle désiré.

                                          1                                                              2                   

                                                                        

- Le T-shirt + Une Entrée + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + T-shirt + Ticket)

Recevez un des T-shirt officiel YELLOWSTONE (au choix), une place de concert (valable pour un concert à Tahiti  du 1/01/2017 au 31/12/2017). Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf vos choix de modèle et taille.

- Le T-shirt + Le Mug + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + Mug + T-shirt)

Recevez un des T-shirt officiel YELLOWSTONE (au choix), un  Mug YELLOWSTONE (au choix) et le téléchargement de sa version Mp3.

Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf vos choix de modèle et taille.

- Le T-shirt + Le Mug + Une Entrée + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + Mug + T-shirt + Ticket)

Recevez un des T-shirt officiel YELLOWSTONE (au choix), un Mug YELLOWSTONE (au choix), une place de concert (valable pour un concert à Tahiti  du 1/01/2017 au 31/12/2017) et bien sur le téléchargement de sa version Mp3.

Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf vos choix de modèle et taille.

- Concert privé : (Private Gig)

YELLOWSTONE rien que pour vous ! Nous débarquons chez vous avec son et lumières pour un concert d'environ une heure et demie...pensez à prévenir vos voisins ! Pour les îles et l'international, nous n'excluons rien mais la "livraison" sera sûrement plus chère que le concert !

 

Liens

Facebook => https://www.facebook.com/yellowstoneBfunk/

Youtube => https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIMtUdoHojDvZKJM1C1yZPg

Soundcloud => https://soundcloud.com/yellowstone-25296600

 

Biographie

Le groupe Yellowstone :

Rod : Batterie & Electronique &chant                                Thom : Guitare & Effets

                                                                

 

Manol : Basse & Chant                                                             Tox : Chant lead & Skunk

                                                                

 

L’idée était de faire une musique disco punk hédoniste & orgiaque.

A Arras,(il faut toujours commencer une histoire par le coté sordide) Manol débute la guitare en autodidacte, il passe par les platines, comme il est mauvais à la gratte et aux platines, il fait quoi ? Bin de la basse. Il émigre vers Tahiti (Eh ouais mon pote !), rencontre Tox et rejoint Nyah, groupe Ska Rock. 5 albums autoproduits et des lives pendant 4 ans.
Parallèlement Manol rencontre Rod pour quelques cours de batterie puis des jam’s sessions. Thom (Rythmique dans un big band parisien R&Blues) arrive en Polynésie en 2006 (Eh ouais mon pote !) & après avoir arrêté la guitare 2 ans, il auditionne et Rod l’embarque dans une série de live Disco funk Revival, genre Soul Sublime your life.
En 2014 le groupe Yellowstone se forme autour du concept de
B-Funk *.(on te racontera le concept quand on se connaitra mieux)
Une répète et an plus tard ! 12 morceaux sont prêts à vivre leurs vie en dehors de notre chambre rose (tu peux pas visualiser c’est un truc à nous), les lives commencent en 2015.
Suite à l’engouement sus-cité, le groupe décide d’enregistrer des maquettes et de démarcher les festivals de métropole. pour porter le mojo du B-funk * hors de son berceau Polynésien
C’est limite, mais ça reste au dessus de la ceinture si elle est bien attachée


Voilà, viens écouter c’est bien.
Manuia

* : RockandPopandDiscoFunkSkaPunk

 

About the band

4 Dudes from Tahiti,

South Pacific (homeland of the surf culture, the Tamure and the vahines on white sand beachs),

Get togeter to bring you some tropical B-Funk flavours mixed with bananas and coconut milk wrapped in LavaRock Burning Rythms & an Electro topping !

ENJOY !

Votre participation permettra d'améliorer la qualité finale de l'album car le prix d'un Master varie entre 500$ et 5000$...Pour faire appel à votre soutien, nous avons choisi INDIEGOGO pour la possibilité de faire une campagne "flexible", c'est à dire que tous les fonds seront collectés.Rassurez vous, toutes les contreparties seront honorées :- L'album Mp3 est déjà financé et sortira au mois d'avril 2017.- Les T-shirts et les Mugs sont imprimés, après votre commande et vos choix par mail, par notre partenaire du centre Vaima : KILICORNER  http://www.kilicorner.com/fr/. Why this campagneTo this days our live shows enable us to rent Tahiti's top quality studio facility "PolyneJah Records" & to invite Mr Guillaume DUJARDIN sound engineer @ studio FERBER, one of the best parisian studio, to do the recording for us.But we need your help to get the best Mastering possible, meaning the best sound quality for the LP.All founds will be collcted and use by the band to bring you the best sound there is ! Contreparties- L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 download)Télécharger le nouvel album.- Une Entrée + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + ticket for live show)Recevez une place de concert (valable pour un concert à Tahiti  du 1/01/2017 au 31/12/2017) et le téléchargement de l'album Mp3. - Le Mug + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + Mug)Recevez un Mug YELLOWSTONE (au choix) et le téléchargement de l'album Mp3.Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf le modèle désiré.- Le T-shirt + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + T-shirt)Recevez un des T-shirt officiel YELLOWSTONE (au choix) et le téléchargement de l'album Mp3.Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf vos choix de modèle et taille.Homme >> Voir Photos            1                         2                        3           4                         5                        6                        7 Femme   >>  Voir Photos             1                         2                        3            4                        5                        6                        7                                                                               - Le Mug + Une Entrée + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + Mug + Ticket)Recevez un Mug YELLOWSTONE (au choix), une place de concert (valable pour un concert à Tahiti  du 1/01/2017 au 31/12/2017) et le téléchargement de l'album Mp3.Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf le modèle désiré.                                          1                                                              2                                                                                            - Le T-shirt + Une Entrée + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + T-shirt + Ticket)Recevez un des T-shirt officiel YELLOWSTONE (au choix), une place de concert (valable pour un concert à Tahiti  du 1/01/2017 au 31/12/2017). Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf vos choix de modèle et taille.- Le T-shirt + Le Mug + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + Mug + T-shirt)Recevez un des T-shirt officiel YELLOWSTONE (au choix), un  Mug YELLOWSTONE (au choix) et le téléchargement de sa version Mp3.Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf vos choix de modèle et taille.- Le T-shirt + Le Mug + Une Entrée + L'album Mp3 : (Mp3 + Mug + T-shirt + Ticket)Recevez un des T-shirt officiel YELLOWSTONE (au choix), un Mug YELLOWSTONE (au choix), une place de concert (valable pour un concert à Tahiti  du 1/01/2017 au 31/12/2017) et bien sur le téléchargement de sa version Mp3.Après avoir obtenu cette contrepartie, précisez nous par mail yellowstone@mail.pf vos choix de modèle et taille.- Concert privé : (Private Gig)YELLOWSTONE rien que pour vous ! Nous débarquons chez vous avec son et lumières pour un concert d'environ une heure et demie...pensez à prévenir vos voisins ! Pour les îles et l'international, nous n'excluons rien mais la "livraison" sera sûrement plus chère que le concert ! LiensFacebook => https://www.facebook.com/yellowstoneBfunk/Youtube => https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIMtUdoHojDvZKJM1C1yZPgSoundcloud => https://soundcloud.com/yellowstone-25296600 BiographieLe groupe Yellowstone :Rod : Batterie & Electronique &chant                                Thom : Guitare & Effets                                                                  Manol : Basse & Chant                                                             Tox : Chant lead & Skunk                                                                  L’idée était de faire une musique disco punk hédoniste & orgiaque.A Arras,(il faut toujours commencer une histoire par le coté sordide) Manol débute la guitare en autodidacte, il passe par les platines, comme il est mauvais à la gratte et aux platines, il fait quoi ? Bin de la basse. Il émigre vers Tahiti (Eh ouais mon pote !), rencontre Tox et rejoint Nyah, groupe Ska Rock. 5 albums autoproduits et des lives pendant 4 ans.Parallèlement Manol rencontre Rod pour quelques cours de batterie puis des jam’s sessions. Thom (Rythmique dans un big band parisien R&Blues) arrive en Polynésie en 2006 (Eh ouais mon pote !) & après avoir arrêté la guitare 2 ans, il auditionne et Rod l’embarque dans une série de live Disco funk Revival, genre Soul Sublime your life.En 2014 le groupe Yellowstone se forme autour du concept deB-Funk *.(on te racontera le concept quand on se connaitra mieux)Une répète et an plus tard ! 12 morceaux sont prêts à vivre leurs vie en dehors de notre chambre rose (tu peux pas visualiser c’est un truc à nous), les lives commencent en 2015.Suite à l’engouement sus-cité, le groupe décide d’enregistrer des maquettes et de démarcher les festivals de métropole. pour porter le mojo du B-funk * hors de son berceau PolynésienC’est limite, mais ça reste au dessus de la ceinture si elle est bien attachéeVoilà, viens écouter c’est bien.Manuia* : RockandPopandDiscoFunkSkaPunk About the band4 Dudes from Tahiti,South Pacific (homeland of the surf culture, the Tamure and the vahines on white sand beachs),Get togeter to bring you some tropical B-Funk flavours mixed with bananas and coconut milk wrapped in LavaRock Burning Rythms & an Electro topping !ENJOY !

story:
We are Filth and Foul

For 15 years now we (Filth and Foul) have been a pioneering Hip-Hop act throughout the Northwestern United States. We are from the beautiful city of Bozeman, Montana, but have traveled all over the country performing and making connections with people through our music. We have shared the stage with legends on many occasions, but still remain  independent artists. That independence is why this campaign is so important to us. Gone are the days of major labels signing acts and funding their projects from start to finish. For our entire career we have had to pay for all of these expenses out of our own pockets. This has made it very hard to deliver the quality of music and the presentation that our fans expect while having to work full-time just to pay our own personal bills. Now, with the growth of social media and the creation of a site like this we are able to get the fans directly involved in our creative process and make them actual contributors to our new project!    


Your Funding Is Key

We are attempting to raise $5000 to go toward our newest effort "Nostalgia". This album will be our most star-studded project to date and will include appearances from some of the biggest legends in Hip-Hop as well as some hot new faces. Your contribution will help us cover the cost of acquiring these features as well as the actual recording, mixing, and engineering that is involved.  You will make it possible for us to have professional quality photography and artwork that will translate seamlessly into an amazing physical copy that you will receive when completed.  With the money raised we will also market and promote through music videos and more of the live touring we are known for. Everyone that gets involved will get special music and merchandise and will forever be a part of our continuing road to success! You will all be official members of our Filthy Family!!


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that they can't help! You can still get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Be sure to share our links with your friends and family and that's all there is to it!! We thank you for your continued support and we value your time greatly!!!...

Sincerely, 

Filth and Foul (Contact and Nickel B)

story:
Me, and My Music

I joined a chanter beginners class to celebrate turning 50. But my background was a Bachelor of Music Degree from Glasgow University (1978) and Postgraduate qualifications in Music Therapy and Psychoanalytical Psychotherapy. I wanted to compose bagpipe music, but I wasn't a famous piper. Would it be possible? Some thought not. I started small, and found support and encouragement at Bob Dunsire Bagpipe Forums. Making full use of this, I kept going and learned along the way. The previous six compositions have enjoyed over 13,000 hits on YouTube, and many people have written movingly about the effect the music has had on them personally. I never for a second thought that one day Willie McCallum and Jim McGillivray would record one of my compositions, but we are now on the verge of this happening, WITH YOUR HELP. This is huge, and nerve-wracking, exciting, and innovative, all at once!

 

The Music

Lacrimae is a complex piobaireachd form composition, in which the two performers, Willie McCallum and Jim McGillivray, who would normally play piobaireachd solo, are required to play the entire piece as a duet, involving split second precision timing, immense concentration, and exquisite musicality. Craig Muirhead, himself a Grade 1 piper, will be required to support the Urlar or Ground of the piece on keyboard, laying down the harmony which underlies the construction of the composition.

It will tug at your heartstrings, bring a tear to the eye, resonate with your personal lifestory, and even lift you up and have you marvelling at the possibilities of the instrument.

 

The Project

To make this happen we need in excess of £3,200, but this amount would cover the bulk of the expenses to make it happen.

This is for the pipers' and keyboard player's fees, expenses and costs, hotel accommodation, air travel, rent of recording space, food and drink for performers, Video Production, Editing and Mixing, and Administrative backup.

There are RISKS. What if one of the performers is ill on the day? A bagpipe malfunction ? A power cut that affects the whole of Glasgow? Etc etc etc. I'm ready for those. This recording WILL happen. There's always a way around a problem. I believe in the team assembled for the task, and know they will make it happen. I am not new to hurdles. I know them like the back of my hand, and so far have always jumped over them!

 

How Can You Help?

Please donate! But I know it's not always that easy. If you are unable to donate funds, please use the Indigogo tools to Share Share Share, to reach as many people as possible, with a personal message asking for them to support the campaign. From the whole Lacrimae team, we thank you for doing your bit to make this happen!

story:
Overview

I'm just about done recording two solo albums, Rad and Trad, which have been a long time in the making. This has been a solitary process, I am doing all the playing, singing and recording myself. I am now in the process of laying down the vocals and feel that it's time to properly introduce this project to the world. With that I hope that you'll join me on the last stretch of this journey (big words, I know) by partaking in the campaign or spreading the word (or why not both?)!

I've put a lot of my previous work in the perks section to the right here, so you'll have to do a bit of scrolling to see everything. If you're interested in bundling up perks but don't find an option for that just get in touch and we'll work it out! There are also lessons and performances if you scroll far enough.

Short Summary

Thanks for checking out this page, it means a lot to me! You might not know who you're on the verge of supporting, so I'll introduce myself:

  • My name is Magnus Wiik, and I've been playing music since I was a kid. I started out playing fingerstyle guitar before my age reached the double digits, and my interest took off in my early teens when I discovered hairy men who played fast guitar. I eventually gravitated toward jazz, and parallell to that I discovered bluegrass and Irish folk music. I've spent the last 20 years in the trifecta between these three, leaving occasionally for different input.
  • I've been fortunate to study at the renowned jazz conservatory in Trondheim, followed by a stint in Copenhagen and then doing a master's in jazz and improvised music at the Norwegian Academy of Music in Oslo. My formal music education and the opportunities it has provided have been important, but traveling has been just as important (if not more). My first visits to the US and Ireland were humbling, to say the least. I knew I had a lot of work cut out for me coming back, and I still do. But the thrill of exploring bluegrass and Irish trad has stayed with me and given me the chance to work with some amazing musicians.
  • I've wanted to put out a solo album for some time, and as I've gotten older the stakes have felt higher. It would have to be a solid personal statement, and pay tribute to my musical roots. The idea to make two albums as my album debut seemed to be good, so I decided to make "Rad" and "Trad", the first being my own songs and tunes and the second being my take on music that has been important to me.
  • I started working on these albums in 2018, and I'm finally about to wrap them up. My family relocated to rural Norway, and I decided it was time to give this a shot. Armed with two guitars, a banjo, dobro, fiddle, mandolin, cello, Irish flute, rhodes, piano, double bass and my voice in addition to some studio gear, I set up a space where I could work on this project at home. Touring and working on other projects as well as expanding my family (again!) has definitely prolonged the process some, but now the finish line is on the horizon.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what you're helping me paying for:

  • I've recorded the albums on my own time and dime, but it's time to get some fresh ears to finish them off. The funds I receive will go towards mixing and mastering, cover art, pressing and distribution. 
  • There are some cool perks in exchange for your support. This will be my solo debut, but I have nine other albums with groups where I've composed and been heavily creatively invested. You can order my new albums together with any of these albums. You can also buy the albums together with skype lessons or solo performances.

The Impact

By pre-ordering the albums now you'll be part of creating a positive boost for the last inning of this process for me. 

  • These albums represent a highly personal statement from me. Initially an outsider to the trad and bluegrass world, I think that there is something positive and unique about this music.
  • I have released many records on my own label, Just For The Records, and have the know how to do it and do it properly.
  • Will this album change the world? Or bluegrass music as we know it? Highly unlikely. But I will be so bold to claim that some of the music isn't like anything you've heard before.

Risks & Challenges

There are some risks to putting this campaign out now. I initially wanted to do it after doing the vocals properly, but by doing it now it will give me a good challenge to do it right and wrap it up before the end of summer.

  • I've worked hard to get the project this far, and even though the singing might be the last and biggest hurdle, I've set up a provincial vocal booth and it works well! I've started recording some vocals, and realize that the road to completion will be paved with blood, sweat, tears and curse words. But come hell or high water I'll pave it!
  • I hope to have the albums ready by fall 2020, but I don't want to set a definite date now. The most important thing for me now is to focus on quality and make sure that it gets to the place I want it to be.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this campaign, or don't have a cd player anymore, don't worry. The music will be available on streaming as well as physical editions. There are still some things you can do:

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign on social media, and I'd love it if you could write two lines about it as that helps for traction. You can also share it in groups and on pages on facebook or reddit to hopefully reach potential contributors who wouldn't have know of it otherwise.
  • Check out the Indiegogo share tools to share the campaign

Thank you so much for reading and checking this out!
