I hope to have the albums ready by fall 2020, but I don't want to set a definite date now. The most important thing for me now is to focus on quality and make sure that it gets to the place I want it to be.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute to this campaign, or don't have a cd player anymore, don't worry. The music will be available on streaming as well as physical editions. There are still some things you can do:
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Share this campaign on social media, and I'd love it if you could write two lines about it as that helps for traction. You can also share it in groups and on pages on facebook or reddit to hopefully reach potential contributors who wouldn't have know of it otherwise.
Check out the Indiegogo share tools to share the campaign

Thank you so much for reading and checking this out!

story:
WE ARE TEAM MYKEL, POSSUMS UNITE!

Mykel was born an entertainer. From a young age he loved captivating people whether in small groups or a large audience. By channeling Freddie Mercury, Selena and Justin Timberlake, Mykel knows what it takes to entertain a crowd and leave them wanting more.

Mykel discovered he had a knack for musical comedy by creating a song titled, “Skinny Chick.” After receiving very positive reviews and encouragement to create more songs, he figured, “hey, maybe I have something here.” With his new found talent, Mykel set up to begin his musical comedy career. By performing small shows around Orlando, FL and launching his music online, Mykel began to form a following in Orlando.

In order to show the world what he’s got, Mykel has to get some music videos out there. After gathering a group of dedicated artists/friends, Mykel knows it’s time to launch his videos.

Of course, videos cost money… in fact, we’re coming to realize EVERYTHING costs money. With your help, Mykel’s dream can come true. Wouldn’t it be nice to one day sit back and say, “hey, I helped Mykel start his career and look where he is at now.”

Without donors, none of this could be possible; we are working hard to bring costs down and will make sure we put your money to good use.

We are coming to you for help. Even if all you can spare is time, we greatly appreciate anything. Send this link out, tell your friends. In fact, the more traffic this page gets, the more popular it is on the site. A popular page will make front cover where millions of people will see it.

So, are you in?

 

$1650? WHAT COULD POSSIBLY COST THAT MUCH?

From Team Mykel:

We understand that $1650 sounds like a lot of money, and quite frankly, it is. See where and what your money will be funding…

Pre-Production (Started in December – May 22)

  • Perks for donors – We need to purchase the perks for you sweet possums!
  • Meetings/Planning (printing scripts, holding castings, etc.)
  • Set Design and Props

Production (May 23, 24, 25)

  • Food, Snacks, Water, etc.
  • Costumes
  • Equipment, batteries, etc.
  • Camera Rental
  • Transportation

Photography Session

  • During this time we will also be taking new pictures for Mykel's portfolio

Post-Production  (May 26th --)

  • Editing

Distribution & Release

  • Posters, flyers, etc

All of our budget is going towards the msuic videos and Mykel's portfolio. We are volunteering our time because we feel passionate about Team Mykel and would like to see Mykel's dream come true. We have all known each other for years and love more than anything to help one another achieve our goals and dreams. You can help us as well :)

HOW ELSE CAN I HELP TEAM MYKEL?

We understand, times are tough and sometimes sparing a little bit isn’t in the budget but you can still help us.

How?

  • Get the word out – tell your friends, coworkers, family members … tell a stranger. Every little bit counts.
  • Share the link – a simple tweet, pin, post, banner, or text of this link is one more person that will see our page.
  • Hit refresh – Like we said before, the more hits this page gets, the more popular it looks. Popular campaigns will get on the front page which has the potential to reach millions of people!

There are helpful buttons below our video that will help you share whichever way you’d like.

So go spread the possum love!

 

THE IMPACT

Your contribution to our project will have a huge impact. It could be the difference between our music videos looking like a cellphone quick vid to something you’d see on TV. It’ll get there one day too. We are a tenacious team with success in mind. Possums don’t let anyone stand in their way.  

Within our team we have local artists who are launching their career with a track record of successful projects, and this one will be the next. Be part of our future and we’ll be part of yours.

Our success is your success. We want you to succeed, help us do the same. We’ll work hard to show you that your investment with us was the right decision.

 

A NOTE FROM MYKEL

I appreciate any thing you can do to make our project a success, each and every last one of you monetary contributors, viewers, sharers, tweeters and the like are a big part of what we do, and why we do it! I love each and every one of my Cesarite Possums (which is a term of endearment for all my followers and fans), and I hope we can grow together to do great things!

-Mykel
story_txt:
WE ARE TEAM MYKEL, POSSUMS UNITE!
Mykel was born an entertainer. From a young age he loved captivating people whether in small groups or a large audience. By channeling Freddie Mercury, Selena and Justin Timberlake, Mykel knows what it takes to entertain a crowd and leave them wanting more.
Mykel discovered he had a knack for musical comedy by creating a song titled, “Skinny Chick.” After receiving very positive reviews and encouragement to create more songs, he figured, “hey, maybe I have something here.” With his new found talent, Mykel set up to begin his musical comedy career. By performing small shows around Orlando, FL and launching his music online, Mykel began to form a following in Orlando.
In order to show the world what he’s got, Mykel has to get some music videos out there. After gathering a group of dedicated artists/friends, Mykel knows it’s time to launch his videos.
Of course, videos cost money… in fact, we’re coming to realize EVERYTHING costs money. With your help, Mykel’s dream can come true. Wouldn’t it be nice to one day sit back and say, “hey, I helped Mykel start his career and look where he is at now.”
Without donors, none of this could be possible; we are working hard to bring costs down and will make sure we put your money to good use.
We are coming to you for help. Even if all you can spare is time, we greatly appreciate anything. Send this link out, tell your friends. In fact, the more traffic this page gets, the more popular it is on the site. A popular page will make front cover where millions of people will see it.
So, are you in?
 
$1650? WHAT COULD POSSIBLY COST THAT MUCH?
From Team Mykel:
We understand that $1650 sounds like a lot of money, and quite frankly, it is. See where and what your money will be funding…
Pre-Production (Started in December – May 22)

Perks for donors – We need to purchase the perks for you sweet possums!
Meetings/Planning (printing scripts, holding castings, etc.)
Set Design and Props
Production (May 23, 24, 25)

Food, Snacks, Water, etc.
Costumes
Equipment, batteries, etc.
Camera Rental
Transportation
Photography Session

During this time we will also be taking new pictures for Mykel's portfolio
Post-Production  (May 26th --)

Editing
Distribution & Release

Posters, flyers, etc
All of our budget is going towards the msuic videos and Mykel's portfolio. We are volunteering our time because we feel passionate about Team Mykel and would like to see Mykel's dream come true. We have all known each other for years and love more than anything to help one another achieve our goals and dreams. You can help us as well :)
HOW ELSE CAN I HELP TEAM MYKEL?
We understand, times are tough and sometimes sparing a little bit isn’t in the budget but you can still help us.
How?

Get the word out – tell your friends, coworkers, family members … tell a stranger. Every little bit counts.
Share the link – a simple tweet, pin, post, banner, or text of this link is one more person that will see our page.
Hit refresh – Like we said before, the more hits this page gets, the more popular it looks. Popular campaigns will get on the front page which has the potential to reach millions of people!
There are helpful buttons below our video that will help you share whichever way you’d like.
So go spread the possum love!
 
THE IMPACT
Your contribution to our project will have a huge impact. It could be the difference between our music videos looking like a cellphone quick vid to something you’d see on TV. It’ll get there one day too. We are a tenacious team with success in mind. Possums don’t let anyone stand in their way.  
Within our team we have local artists who are launching their career with a track record of successful projects, and this one will be the next. Be part of our future and we’ll be part of yours.
Our success is your success. We want you to succeed, help us do the same. We’ll work hard to show you that your investment with us was the right decision.

I appreciate any thing you can do to make our project a success, each and every last one of you monetary contributors, viewers, sharers, tweeters and the like are a big part of what we do, and why we do it! I love each and every one of my Cesarite Possums (which is a term of endearment for all my followers and fans), and I hope we can grow together to do great things!
-Mykel

story:
Short Summary

Hey there good people of the world! Dirty Blind has done it! We've decided to record our first full length, 6 song EP! We go into the studio in two weeks to record the basic tracks. We're going to need your help! Any contributions will be so helpful! Thanks for all of your support!

The Impact

We are going to use this EP as a launch platform for a massive wave of Retro-Rock excitement, including music videos, a full length album, and more eye, ear, and mind candy!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can donate or not, we'd love any help you can give us.  This includes sharing our campaign with anyone who might be interested in helping, liking our facebook page, or just catching some upcoming shows of ours!  Check out www.dirtyblindmusic.com for more details.

story:
How I Got Here...

My name is Marqueal Jordan (saxophonist, vocalist, composer, producer and bandleader). I have been performing professionally for nearly 30 years, most significantly since moving to Chicago in 1995. Over the last 10 years, I have toured with Brian Culbertson and performed with legendary artists such as Buddy Guy, Larry Graham, Jill Scott, KRS-One and Marcus Miller. In addition, I was co-leader and the frontman for the Chicago Funk/Rock band Fat Time and a frequent collaborator with Chicago-based artist/producer, DJ I.N.C.

In October 2013, I released my solo debut album, Catalyst. It was a well-received introduction to the Contemporary/Smooth Jazz genre and it showed fans that I was more than a sideman in a great touring band. In the following years I promoted and performed in support of my album while simultaneously touring with Culbertson. Over time, I realized that in order to have the success I desired, I needed to focus solely on my recording career, improve my artistry and build my brand. Consequently, I made plans to do that. I began recording tracks for Intention & Purpose in early 2018 and left Culbertson's band after the culmination of the Colors Of Love tour.

Intention & Purpose is scheduled for release in February 2019. It is the next progression of my artistry and I am excited to share it with you.

So, Here's The Dilly...

The recording for Intention & Purpose is nearly complete, and I learned with Catalyst that the real work for an album is what happens AFTER the last note is "put on wax". This campaign is focused completely on that.

I am raising $15,000 to help with the costs of:

  • Mixing & Mastering...to make this music sound amazing
  • CD Replication...yes there will be CDs made lol
  • PR/Marketing & Radio Promotion...to ensure that as many music lovers as possible know about, can easily access and enjoy this album

Every dollar contributed here, whether $5 or $50k, will go directly to those costs.

The Power Of Your Support

Simply put, your contribution to Intention & Purpose can determine the success level and reach of this project. A great or good record that is never heard doesn't exist. With my debut CD, even with limited knowledge of the industry and a radio promotion campaign that was launched 10 months after its initial release, Catalyst made a considerable impact and still gets current spins on Music Choice and other radio stations. Applying the positives and the hard lessons learned, I am confident that this second album will be infinitely more successful.

Also, besides the great feeling you will get from supporting an independent artist, you will receive something tangible for your investment. There are a list of perks that you can choose from based on your level of contribution. Take a look and determine what best fits your level of financial commitment, ya dig...

You can't contribute? That's cool...

However, what you can do is share this campaign with your peeps and/or on your social media campaigns. Word of mouth marketing and third party endorsements are wonderful things!

I thank you in advance for your contributions and positive energy!!! If you have any direct questions for me, please do not hesitate to hit me up.

Much Love,

Marqueal Jordan

story:
What the --? 

Who hasn't dreamed of being a rock star? Well, one rock star's dream has come true then been repeatedly swiped from him. Mike Hadge, of the Mike Hadge Trio, has led the world's most underground (see: unpopular) band through the ringer, only to see it crumble time and time again. Some consider it his own fault but no, it isn't. 

Fortunately, the good people at FringeNYC have selected The Mike Hadge Trio's 7th Reunion Concert to be part of their glorious festival. Unfortunately, the band lost all their money/equipment/staff in a rock-paper-scissors wager and need YOUR help to put up the musical concert event of the century! 

Mike Hadge (also head songwriter for off-Broadway twin variety act The Rescignos) has written over 130 original songs in his lifetime - a body of work that would make Gershwin punch a wall in frustration - and only wants to share some of them with the world. Finally, he has gotten the (7th) opportunity to do so. Won't you help spread music/happiness to the world? 

Your contributions are appreciated. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to put up a successful indie rock concert, one thing's for sure important - instruments, publicity, insurance, sound equipment and staff. Okay, that's like 7 things, but you get the point. Our budget has been worked out to the penny, and as much as we'd love to bang on some cardboard boxes and strum some rubber bands held together by rusty twine, it probably wouldn't make for a great show (Or would it? Hmmm). 

The best part? PERKS that YOU GET for contributing! EPs, Greatest Hits albums, signed band posters, even become an honorary past member of the band! It's all possible and it's all for you! 

The Impact

Okay, so no orphans will be fed, no diseases will be cured, no community centers will be saved from big corporations. There are absolutely better causes for your money to go to but...uh...actually yeah, donate your money to those causes. Do not donate any money to us! (wink) (reverse psychology)

story:
Help us bless Krista!

We would like to show our thanks to Krista for her faithful service to the Women’s Ministry by donating funds so she can record music. Krista has blessed us with her gift of singing each week and we want to bless her in return! 

The cost to record is about $1,000 per song (studio time, recording fees, post production). We would love to raise enough funds so that Krista can record 4-5 worship songs.

Please note, this is a surprise for Krista! She does not know we are doing this for her, and she has not asked us to promote this in any way. We just want to thank her for all the hard work she does to bless each of us in the Women's Ministry. Recording worship songs has been a desire of her heart for some time, but it has not been possible without the funds. So we would like to bless her with the funds and ask that you prayerfully consider how you can contribute!

story:
Whispering Waves

12 year old song-writing twins Katie and Emilie Graham have just released their first ever original track 'Whispering Waves'.  Produced by Pete Renzullo of Scudley Records, and all vocals and acoustic guitar performed by the young duo, their song has attracted massive interest online and through radio.

After just 3 days since the track was put up on YouTube, set to still images of the twins to provide a basic visual backing to the music, more than 2,000 independent views have been registered.  It has also been shared around social media extensively, with many people commenting on how impressive this first effort from the youngsters is.  Comments such as:

  • "This is a well written tune with stunning vocals."
  • "I had instant goose bumps. I was just going to listen to it and keep working.. But I had to stop and just listen..."
  • "Love it! I am no way affiliated with these girls, but I came across the song on Facebook and am in love!"

Such a positive response in such a short time has been overwhelming for the girls, and people are sharing it around to their own circle of friends.  So where to from here? 

What We Need

With this huge response in such little time, the need for an official music video has arrived.  The creation of a professionally produced music video will bring this single the attention it deserves.  If such a flood of interest so early in its release has manifested via the current 'still images' music video, imagine the response when the official music video is finally released, featuring the young song-writers in a professional visual medium

So, to make this happen we need your help.  The cost of a professional music video is very high, and WAY out of reach for the budget we have.  After sourcing a fantastic videographer, we have arrived at a figure we need to raise to make it happen: 
  • $2,500.
  • Includes all time and prep for the full video shoot
  • All necessary editing and rendering of the footage
  • Final production and release of the music video

 

The Impact

Given the response so far, we believe the creation, release and spread of an official music video for 'Whispering Waves' will bring the girls up to a professional standard for promoting themselves and their amazing music.  It also gives them the freedom to have creative control over their work and the way it is represented in their music video.

Important results to the production of this music video:

  • It will give the young song-writers a professional presentation of their work.
  • Their potential for opportunities in the music scene will be much stronger.
  • They will have full creative control over their future as song-writers and performers if we keep things independently produced. 

Conclusion

 Katie and Emilie Graham are truly talented emerging artists.  Providing people like this with help to get their talent exposed to the world will give them the confidence and encouragement to further their abilities and develop their craft in a more professional, positive way.

The song-writing ability of these girls is something to behold - truly a Producer's dream come true.  The time is ripe to give them a much needed boost to get this incredible music to the masses.  A music video is the most powerful way to do this.

story:
Servus


Ich, Bastian von Sisinga, bin Marktsackspieler aus Leidenschaft und engagiere mich für die Erhaltung mittelalterlicher Musiktradition. Des weiteren befinde ich mich im Vorstand des Vereins MAV Radolfzell-Hohenfriedingen.

Ich möchte mich und den Verein musikalisch unterstützen und weiterentwickeln.

Um dies realisieren zu können benötige ich Ihre Unterstützung, da ich an gemeinnützige Veranstaltungen teilnehme wie z.B. Benefizkonzerte zum Erhalt einer Burg oder die Erheiterung der Senioren in den Altenheimen unserer Umgebung.




Die Unterstützer helfen mir dabei einen Dudelsack zu erwerben, der in einer anderen Tonlage gebaut wurde.

Wofür Ihre Unterstützung sein wird ist ein Marktsack in der Tonlage Tief C, zweibordunig, aus Ahorn.

 Tonbeispiel

(Bild und Ton dient nur als Beispiel)

Die Kosten des Marktsackes, belaufen sich auf 1500 €

Perks


Die Perks sind natürlich auf das Thema Dudelsack ausgelegt wie z.B. der Unterricht und die Danksagung


Falls das Ziel von 1500€ nicht erreicht werden sollte, werde ich die Mittel dazu benutzen eine Anzahlung auf das Instrument zu leisten.


Ich hoffe, ich habe Ihr Interesse für das Thema geweckt und würde mich um eine Unterstützung freuen, sei es finanziell oder durch Weiterverlinkung in den sozialen Medien (Facebook,Twitter,Instagram usw.)

Das war es auch schon.

Merci

story:
DEAR FRIENDS,

My name is Neal E. Boyd and I'm the 2008 Winner of America's Got Talent.  I'm EXCITED to get the chance to record the follow up to my debut album "My American Dream!"  This new album, currently titled "My Christmas Wish," will include both traditional covers of Christmas songs such as O Holy Night, I'll Be Home For Christmas, Mary Did You Know, as well as some original songs. 

This is a CALL TO ACTION since we only get 45 DAYS to make this project a reality!  Pledged funds raised will be used to bring the music to life.  It will be dedicated to my mother, who is currently battling breast cancer.  She is doing great, but it has instilled in me a sense of urgency to get this music out this year.  Family, friends, and fans have asked for me to do a Christmas CD for three years, and I feel it's time for new music, and for it to come out this Christmas. 

THE PROCESS 101

There will be extensive Studio time lasting around 40 days.  During this time, we will have Pre-production that includes: Writing, Arranging, Charting, Planning, and Creating Scratch Tracks. This will be followed up by Production which includes: Setup, Engineering of all music and vocal tracks, and engineering of overdubs. Finally, Post-production: Editing, Mixing, and preparing the record for Mastering. 

I will be keeping a record of photos and video of the process to share with you, sort of "The Making of My Christmas Wish."  This material will be turned into an EPK for promotional purposes and shared with donors. 

I appreciate your prayers, love, generosity, and loyal support.  This album can't happen without you.  Let's make the best Christmas record EVER!!! 

 

Risks and challenges 

The biggest risk is that the project will exceed the 40 days for completion and mastering. To tackle this, I have chosen a 40 day window for production that is set to conclude in July 2013. This is a previously agreed upon timetable with the musicians and producers. This also allows three added months for mass production, marketing, and special shipping to the donors of this project.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are wanting to raise $7000 to complete the project.  In return we are offering a number of perks for donors, based on your level of donation, including autographed pictures, digital downloads, copies of the CD, credit in the liner notes, and VIP tickets to the Christmas concert in December in my hometown of Sikeston, Missouri!

The Impact

Music has a way of bringing people together, especially at Christmas!  Please watch the attached video from my first CD which had a positive influence all over the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!.

This is a CALL TO ACTION since we only get 45 DAYS to make this project a reality!  Pledged funds raised will be used to bring the music to life.  It will be dedicated to my mother, who is currently battling breast cancer.  She is doing great, but it has instilled in me a sense of urgency to get this music out this year.  Family, friends, and fans have asked for me to do a Christmas CD for three years, and I feel it's time for new music, and for it to come out this Christmas.  
THE PROCESS 101
There will be extensive Studio time lasting around 40 days.  During this time, we will have Pre-production that includes: Writing, Arranging, Charting, Planning, and Creating Scratch Tracks. This will be followed up by Production which includes: Setup, Engineering of all music and vocal tracks, and engineering of overdubs. Finally, Post-production: Editing, Mixing, and preparing the record for Mastering. 
I will be keeping a record of photos and video of the process to share with you, sort of "The Making of My Christmas Wish."  This material will be turned into an EPK for promotional purposes and shared with donors. 
I appreciate your prayers, love, generosity, and loyal support.  This album can't happen without you.  Let's make the best Christmas record EVER!!! 
 
Risks and challenges  
The biggest risk is that the project will exceed the 40 days for completion and mastering. To tackle this, I have chosen a 40 day window for production that is set to conclude in July 2013. This is a previously agreed upon timetable with the musicians and producers. This also allows three added months for mass production, marketing, and special shipping to the donors of this project.
 


What We Need & What You Get
We are wanting to raise $7000 to complete the project.  In return we are offering a number of perks for donors, based on your level of donation, including autographed pictures, digital downloads, copies of the CD, credit in the liner notes, and VIP tickets to the Christmas concert in December in my hometown of Sikeston, Missouri!


The Impact
Music has a way of bringing people together, especially at Christmas!  Please watch the attached video from my first CD which had a positive influence all over the world.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute, please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!.

story:
Short Summary

Southpaws is a volunteer radio show broadcast every Wednesday morning at 10:00 am on WPRR AM 1680 and FM 95.3 in Grand Rapids, Michigan and on WPJC FM 88.3 in Pontiac, IL.  We look at politics from a left point of view.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to expand our show into syndication.  We need funds to produce media kits to send out to radio stations and syndicaton companies.  We are also setting up websites for Southpaws.  We need funds to secure the URLs needed and to start hosting our sites.

For your donation of $20, we will send you three months worth of behind the scenes discussions after our show finishes.  This is content you'll only receive as a donor of $20 or more.

For your donation of $100, we will send you the three months of behind the scenes content and a Southpaws t-shirt.  T-shirts provided by Hojotees and Designs.

The benefits

With your help, you'll help get one more voice of the left out to the masses.  We want to reach more listeners and the only way to do that is to get on more stations.  Your donation will help get those goals set into motion.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help get the word out of Southpaws.  Southpaws is available for download on iTunes by going to the iTunes store and searching for Southpaws.

story:
I am currently in preparation of independently recording a full-length Album and could use YOUR help!

I hope to continue my musical journey I embarked upon last year during the upcoming months by recording some additional tracks that will mark the release of my new studio Album for 2013.  It is very exciting for me to see the time, energy and work that I have invested coming to fruition.  I have evolved so much personally and as a songwriter since the release of my first album in 2003.

Since last year I had the great privilege and honour to work with well established producers in the music industry, Jan Linder-Koda, Marty Rifkin, Barry Keenan and Sydney Alston to get this project off the ground. Jan has a long track record in the music industry for producing songs and working to develop artists that rise to the top.

I want nothing more than to share my story with the world through my music, inspire others especially those that have disabilities to believe in themselves and to follow their dreams.

I have a rare form of dwarfism called Kniest Dysplasia; there are less than 200 people worldwide with this condition. Growing up with Kniest can be quite challenging at times, full of various surgeries and many months in hospital throughout my life. Although something that always gives me great joy and has always served as a form of expression, ever since I can remember is my music and writing poetry which has got me through some of my darkest days to even my greatest joys in life.

I like to always live my life to the fullest and be positive, I don’t like to take no for an answer. I am very excited about what the future holds for me and how this new record will play a part in that.

*FLEX FUNDING*

My financial goal through Indiegogo is $5,000.

Money raised will go towards studio time and mastering expenses mainly.

Your support will assist me in continuing my journey by recording new tracks for my album and for my vision to come to life. Albums can be quite costly and I don’t think it’s fair to ask for too much from people so any contributions I earn will aid me along the way even if I can only record a few more songs it will at least keep my dream alive, A little help can go a long way!

If, by chance, I surpass the intended goal, this will open up other opportunities for me. For example: touring; both national & international, music videos, new merchandise, future recordings... the possibilities are endless! With a larger budget comes a larger means to fulfill my hopes and aspirations as a singer who hopes to inspire others. This also allows me to give back more to you, the listener!

Would you consider investing with me in this endeavour?  Even the smallest contribution can make a difference.  Please notice the incentives as well that are listed for each contribution level. If you are unable to contribute financially you can also help just by spreading the word and sharing my campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools.

This is only the beginning.... Look within yourself and always find the Strength Within!

story:
My Dracula Sleeps With His Mind Open

What does that mean? That's the title of a piece of artwork from local Philadelphia artist, Hannah Benfield that I absolutely fell in love with in 2015, promptly purchased, and then began writing music centralized around it's imagery and it's title's various interpretations. Agent Moosehead has been performing this material live for the past two years and we want to share it with those that can't see it live or who would rather listen to it from the comfort of their couches while they play video games. 

- Chris Dippolito     

 

Why The Heck Do Albums Cost So Much?

( A.K.A. Where Your Generous Contributions Are Going )

1. TRACKING AND OVERDUBBING - $ 1000  The performance. Hours in the studio take after take getting things just right.

2. MIXING AND EDITING - $ 1000  Finding and editing mistakes or notes that would make even Webern cry. Post production, balancing, panning, editing, EQ, and more.

3. MASTERING - $ 150  Some professional in a booth listening to random snippets of the almost finished record at random points to make sure everything is audibly leveled.

4. THE MUSICIANS - $ 500  We have some heavy hitters of Philadelphia's music community on this with us. Daniel Peterson, David Fishkin, and Larry Toft to name a few.

5. VIDEO PRODUCTION - $ 250  Sam and Ryan did a great job on the video, didn't they?

6. GRAPHIC DESIGN - $ 100  We have the very talented Eric Crawford to bring the album art to life. ( He's a pretty good hockey player too )

7. REPLICATION - $ 1500  This is a big one. "Time to make the donuts..er....units" 

*** If we raise 50% more than our goal we plan on using the overage for a vinyl release so don't hesitate to contribute even if we've hit our total! ***

 

 

What's So Special About This Project?

Sun Ra said that music is how we speak to the gods. We all love music no matter what style or genre is our favorite and it brings joy and color to our lives. We are all consumers of music but in our world it is growing increasingly harder to create it without the help of the listeners...especially music that intends to push boundaries and provide people with something new. We're very proud of and excited about this collection of tunes and we want to everyone else to experience that excitement with us! You can help us explore the far reaches of what music is capable of sounding like! Maybe you too can sleep with your mind open?

 

"Tell 'Em Large Marge Sent 'Ya"

You can also help us by passing word along to your friends and family! Got an Uncle who loves Jazz Fusion? An older brother into Prog? Tell them to check out the page. We have some great perks!

 

Sincere Thanks,

- Chris, Pete, John, and Jon

story:
Your Smile, Your Lips, Your Poison, Your Kiss. I Know Better.

Waiting, watching, hoping, always the same. Wishing that this time will be different. Maybe this time, it will be more than the short summer it always is. Maybe she can be more than minor. Or maybe, she can turn and walk away. But she sees him, he smiles, she opens the door. One day, she'll break this cycle. 

We are so excited to share our new record with you! Call it a concept album. Call it a story. Call it what you will. All we can say is that this record will be the culmination of devoting our lives to playing music. It will be unlike anything else we've done. Obviously, (since this is Indiegogo afterall) we need your help!

How about  15 more seconds of your time, for a brief introduction and super-short pitch?          

We are Surreal Nation (Paul, Nikki, Jackson, Gene, and Kevin), an indie rock band from Delaware. Paul and Nikki formed as an alt-folk duo back in 2014. The band's name is a merge of their last names (Surowiec and Nation). Jackson joined us in 2015, followed by Gene in late 2016, and Kevin in 2017. As the band grew, our sound progressed from an alt-folk duo into a full size indie rock band. This will be our third EP. 

Hey there! You're still reading this. Must mean you're ready for some details. Here they are...

What we need and why

  • We need $3000.00 USD. This money is going to recording a new record, and all of the associated costs, which we'll break down. We've raised a good deal of our budget. We need this last bit and we humbly ask for your help in getting there. 
  • For you non-musicians, here is how recording breaks down financially, and why we need the amount we do.
  • First you have to track. Which means playing your songs, and getting them recorded. 
  • This starts at $35.00/hour. 
  • After tracking, comes mixing and then mastering. (which is basically editing).  
  • After that, you're leave the studio with a .wav and mp3 files of your songs. That's it.
  • Now, you need to do two things with those files.  The first is to get them onto Itunes, Amazon, etc. (You have to pay a company to be the intermediary to do this. The second is to get the music files pressed onto CD/Vinyl/etc.
  • We're thinking that this will be another $500.00-$600.00
  • Next, you have to register the songs with the US copyright office. (It's the government so you KNOW that costs money)
  • Congratulations! You now have a garage full of CDs that need to be marketed and sold.  There are costs associated with mailing CDs to radio stations, promoters etc. Having a reputable company promote your music to radio stations has a cost of around $2000.00.
  • So as you can see, this is a lengthy and expensive process. 

The Impact

  • Helping to fund this project makes you a part of the creative process.
  • You get to take part in sharing our new music with the world.
  • Our last EP was played on both Internet and terrestrial radio. It led to us having a TV appearance and finding success regionally. That EP was funded with our own personal money, which meant that we were limited in how much we were able to spend. 
  • Imagine how much further we can take this record, if we work together to meet our financial goal!

Risks & Challenges 

This is our first crowdfunding campaign and we are very excited about it. Our biggest challenge is going to be getting casual fans to take action and contribute. (Transforming "likes" into contributions). 

Everyone that contributes financially will receive gifts based on the amount they pledged! 

How Do I Know My Money is Actually Going to Your Project?

We will release frequent updates including videos of us preparing to record (rehearsing, writing, etc).  You will get additional video-updates, and perhaps even a live feed or two, from inside the studio. This is the best way for us to show you that we are serious about this and that your money is being spent properly.

(Please visits the updates section for information on the campaign and how your contribution are being/will be spent!)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in the position to contribute. However, you can still help us achieve our goal by spreading the word about our campaign.

  • Please tell your friends (real, online, and imaginary) to check out our campaign at https://igg.me/at/surrealnation

Whether you give $5.00, $500.00, or help spread the word. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

(Please visits the updates section for information on the campaign and how your contribution are being/will be spent!)

We understand that not everyone is in the position to contribute. However, you can still help us achieve our goal by spreading the word about our campaign.
Please tell your friends (real, online, and imaginary) to check out our campaign at https://igg.me/at/surrealnation

story:
We are Spero, a blues/rock band from San Diego. We just finished up recording our first full length CD, RATIONAL PATHS! We funded the recordings ourselves and would greatly appreciate help with the cost of printing and packaging the CDs so we can share our hard work with everyone. Music is truly each member of the bands passion and we put so much time, effort and soul into making this CD the best we can. We are trying to make it as far as we can with our music and getting these CDs all done will be a big step for us to move forward. Thank you

Here's a link to hear some of our music!

https://www.facebook.com/Spero1288

story:
Help Two Tons of Steel finish “Unraveled” 

11 new songs on our 11th CD. 

First off we just want to say thank you for the years of support our great fans and friends have given us. It has been an incredible ride though clubs, states, countries and lots and lots of shows.

Your pledges are going directly to the CD. 

The funds will go to paying for the 3 mixing days @ $1,200 a day, manufacturing 1,000 Cd's @ $1,400 and the radio promotion of "Unraveled" which will run about $5,000. This important becuase without it no one will ever hear this CD outside of our fans. Every cent of the pledges are going to the CD. We truly believe this is the best recording we have ever made. It is raw, emotional and true to Two Tons. ‬

We have been so blessed to be able to make a living for our families playing music and want to continue recording not only for them but for everyone who has dreamed of being in a band. "I remember the first time I played live, it was a singer/songwriter night at Yakafritzes Coffee House in Nacodoches, Tx. I was so scared I couldn’t finish my song, and left the stage. It took 10 years before I tried again. To think that I have been on the Grand Ole Opry, tour Europe and play over 200 shows a year still makes me smile." Kevin Geil said.

“Unraveled” is a back to basics approach to recording. It’s just Geil, Brian Duarte on guitar, Paul Ward on drums and Jake “Sidecar” Marchese on upright bass they are amazingly talented players! Produced by our longtime friend Lloyd Maines and engineered by Pat Manski at The Zone in Dripping Springs. We have financed $5,000 our selfs and now asking for help to finish it up. We are needing to raise an additional $10,000. We hope to get “Unraveled” to #1 on the Americana Music Charts, our last release hit #4.

If there is anyway you can helps us financially and by turning your friends and family on to us we would be forever grateful. 

 

Thanks Again - Kevin, Brian, Paul and Jake

story:
Here it is, Commodore Cosmos' very first album!

As Lansing's premiere Garage Thought-Pop band, we feel that it is our responsibility to play loud music and have microphones somewhere around so that someone can maybe record it and we can give it to people later. As such, we've been working on our album and it's just about ready to be released! Here's the thing though...

Rock and roll ain't cheap.

After all is said and done, we will need $700 to really get this thing ready. We need to pay for recording itself, mastering, replication of the CDs, t-shirts, posters, stickers, and buttons. Believe us folks, it'll be worth it.

Your help will not go unrewarded!

We're rewarding contributors with a bunch of cool stuff, including a special exclusive companion EP and the opportunity to have your name on t-shirts the band will wear at the release show as an extra special thank-you. Check out the tiers for the stuff you can earn by being our bestest buds ever forever!

It's been a long time coming, and now we just need your help to make it happen.

Thanks for taking the time to check this page out, we sincerely appreciate it. You're the best, every one of you. Toodles <3

Thanks for taking the time to check this page out, we sincerely appreciate it. You're the best, every one of you. Toodles <3

story:
Update!!!!!

Platinum Package => $1500 (dropped from $2k)

Bandmates: 2 now available!

Personalized Meme's:  Less expensive than ever

The Hope

On May 25, 2013, our EP release show is coming to the Pagoda, in downtown San Jose, and when that date arrives, we want to have physical EP’s to give out to you. This campaign is here to deliver our music to you, and the people who have been behind us, and asking for physical music (festivals, radio stations, promoters, and infinity!). 



First, for you: You are already incredible, you hang out at our shows, dance to our music, listen to our tracks, and share our passion for this sound; you’re just awesome in general.

This campaign is a big ask that you continue being your awesome self, and help us with our big goal of establishing our band by sharing our music with the rest of the nation. We have already been getting support from the local community, through online shows like At the End of Radio and Paper Clip Society, press in Metro, Content, The Santa Clara, and Santa Clara Weekly, some big festivals like San Jose Jazz Summer Fest, and other outlets. People are listening!


Then, the world: If we close our eyes and squint a little, we can hear our music being played on the airwaves around the world, and this campaign will help us reach that goal. Any of our donation levels—from as fun as a “thank you” meme, to as extensive as a lifetime membership in The JurassiC club—will help us take one step closer to this goal.

 

The Breakdown

So, why are we asking for $4000? Well, here it goes: 

Recording: $1000+

Mixing: $200+

Mastering: $200+

EP Design: $500+

CD Duplication + Printing: $1300+

Case Design + Printing: $400+

We’ll be shipping our EP’s to festivals and venues around the state, and things always come up (like when Jackie was having a bad voice day and needed to reschedule voice tracking).

 

Why We’re Here

Our band has been working with some of the brightest young minds on the music scene; Maestro Bennett Roth-Newell, vocal vixen Jackie Gage, beat-dropper Michael Henning, bass man Will Bohrer, and guitar-slinger Chris Main, and even though we work our butts off for our music, we are really young, and can use your helping hand!

We’re a baby band in this modern world, and the best way we can define ourselves is through music. That, of course, takes a lot of time, from the beginning process of recording our tracks, to the end design work and mastering.


So, thank you for being here, reading all this text, and supporting us with your eyes, ears, clicks, and shares.

We can’t wait to share our music with you.

story:
If you'd like to support this campaign in a larger way, please email joshmccabe00@gmail.com

 

History

When we recorded the first Caves album, we didn't have a budget or any idea how we would finish the project. There were several times where we almost bailed, even after it was finished. I wasn't sure how God would use it, or even if it would resonate with the people listening. What God did with the album blew myself, and everyone involved away. Here are some of the ways God used the album:

  • The lead single, My God (Featuring Amanda Cook), has reached over 3 Million streams world-wide.
  • We have had the opportunity to play several events with Franklin Graham, Kari Jobe, Martin Smith (Delirious?), For King&Country, and several others.
  • We played events in Yonge-Dundas Square, Times Square, Air Canada Centre, and many other incredible venues.

We cannot imagine what God has in store for us next!

What We Need & What You Get

Let me breakdown the project for you:

  • In order to finish this record, it takes not only countless hours, but finances.
  • We have begun work already, in faith that God will provide the means to finish it. Though we can give of our time, there are still other costs involved to honour those who will give time and resources to the project.
  • Though a project like this should cost well over $10,000, we are asking for much less, as we are willing to make sacrifices personally to see this come through.
  • Through contributing to this project, you'll receive a wide variety of perks, and items as our thank you to you! Think of it as purchasing the album in advance!

The Impact

We believe so strongly that God is going to use this project to influence even more people than we have already. Here's some of our prayers for this record:

  • It would bring hope to those walking through a "Hidden Season".
  • It would speak prophetically, God's heart for the listener in a unique way.
  • It would facilitate an atmosphere of worship, where darkness would flee, and the presence of God would be tangible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Quite plainly, this is not just about money. I've see prayers shift situations. I've even see God cover someone's debt COMPLETELY (there's a song on the album about that!). Prayer changes things. If you can't support this project financially, please pray, and SHARE this project on your social media platforms. 

It would mean the world to us if you'd tell a friend.

 

If you'd like to support in a larger way not listed here, please email joshmccabe00@gmail.com

story:
Vitala Festival is a self-funded independent festival, hosting musicians, singers, performers, visual artists, concerts and events in the setting of a theatre, Teatro San Genesio in Rome, Italy.

The Festival has been running for seven years, we hosted over 150 national and international artists with 20 concerts per season.

Every new edition of the Festival is a production and funding challenge and so we are reaching out!

Support the forthcoming edition of the Vitala Festival!

Thank you!

(Please note: Currency is easily converted by clicking on the settings)

https://www.facebook.com/vitalafestival/

https://www.instagram.com/vitala_festival/

http://www.teatrosangenesio.it/concerti.html

(Perk images are indicative)

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Il Vitala Festival è una rassegna indipendente e auto-sostenuta che ospita musicisti, cantanti, artisti, concerti ed eventi, in un contesto teatrale, il Teatro San Genesio di Roma, Italia.

In sette edizioni abbiamo ospitato oltre 150 artisti nazionali e internazionali con 20 concerti a stagione.

Ogni nuova edizione del Festival rappresenta una sfida sia di produzione che di sostenibilità economica e per questa ragione stiamo lanciando una campagna di crowdfunding.

Sostieni la prossima edizione del Vitala Festival!

Grazie!

(N.B. La valuta riportata è facilmente convertibile con un clic sui settaggi)

https://www.facebook.com/vitalafestival/

https://www.instagram.com/vitala_festival/

http://www.teatrosangenesio.it/concerti.html

 

(Le immagini dei gadget sono indicative)

story:
My name is Karen Tucker and I've been a committed and passionate opera singer and voice instructor for more than 20 years. Having discovered Opera at age 13, I can say it’s been a long, strange trip with many twists and turns. Now, through a wonderful series of events, my train is getting ready to leave the station!

In July of 2014, I was chosen to sing in a local concert, which opened the door to the opportunity of a lifetime. In September (Less than a month away!), I will fly to New York City for an audition to sing a role I am truly BORN TO SING: the delightfully comedic Lady Billows in the Bronx Opera's production of Britten's Albert Herring. (Performance will be in January, 2015).

What happens if I am not cast in this role in NYC? I KNOW there will be many other opportunities to audition and perform in New York City and I have also been invited to perform a Recital Tour of Scotland in September 2015! I also plan to sing an Audition Tour of Germany and Austria October through December 2015, so your contribution WILL GO TOWARD MY DREAM, promise!

CALL FOR SUPPORT:

Here’s where I very much need your help: I need to have the means to live in New York City from late October, 2014, through late January, 2015.  Fulfillment of this dream is dependent upon my ability to raise a nominal but very necessary amount of money for expenses, so I am reaching out to everyone I know for support.

Donations (no amount is too small!) will help me get to NYC and live there for 3 months. While this role doesn't pay much, it offers enormous exposure and will take my career to an entirely new level. The synchronicity of this recent  series of events is now giving me the opportunity to fulfill my lifelong dream and my true purpose in life and is nothing short of a miracle! 
How often do you get the chance to be a part of something like that?


WHAT I NEED MONEY FOR:

Round Trip Airfare from Denver to NYC in September for the Audition; Denver to New York in October (Returning end of January 2015); December from NYC to Denver RT for the Holidays: Will cost a minimum total of $3200

Hotel room in October until my lease starts = $1500

Funds for a modest studio apartment on the Upper West Side or Bronx for three months = $4500

Food and Transportation averaging $1,500 per month for three months =  $4500

Studio space to practice and rehearse in, costing approximately $25 per day (x 100 days) = $2500

Private coaching sessions and lessons for 12 weeks x $250 per session x 2 per week  = $6000

Total Goal = $22,200

If you choose to make a contribution (Thank You AGAIN!) please pay via PayPal, if possible, as they will release the funds to me as soon as the campaign is over, but if you pay with a credit card or bank draft NOT through PayPal, it could take me 3-4 weeks after the end of the campaign to receive the funds and that would be cutting it too close!

What YOU will get for contributing your hard-earned dollars and your vote of confidence (THANK YOU!) Are the following perks you can see on the side bar!

story:
Rising from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, KUZA fills listeners with chilling sound and words of frightening truth. KUZA is the talent of vocalist Michael Kuza and his unseen vision that stands alone and above the fresh and upcoming. Joined by the vixenish Franccesca DeStruct on bass, Matt "Bats" Patlan on drums, Luke Slaughter on rhythm guitar, and Kyle Skellington on lead guitar, the band is unstoppable as they continue to shock and sanctify their newly reigning stance.

Official music Video for "Bound By Oath".

Download "Venom & Sorrow" and "From Hell And Hate" here!
iTunes - Venom & Sorrow EP / From Hell And Hate EP
Amazon - Venom & Sorrow EP / From Hell And Hate EP

story:
Thank you to our supporters! We can still use additional funds toward our next production, Alice in Operaland, so please keep donating!

Short Summary

The Great Lakes Light Opera needs YOUR help to file for nonprofit status. 

Why is filing so important? Without officially filing the paperwork to incorporate and for 501(c)(3) status, we're just a bunch of musicians on the loose. We need to form a company in order to file for grants and collaborate with established venues to present fun, innovative programming around Northeastern Ohio. 

What kind of programming, you ask? GLLO produces original operas, comic operas, adult lecture recitals, podcasts, and educational outreach programs for children. Right now, GLLO is run solely by volunteers, but this is not a sustainable business model. In order to pay our administration, GLLO must have the ability to file for administrative grants. Our performers must receive paychecks in order to continue delivering high-quality opera. Those developing our educational programs need money to fund their projects. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $125 to file the paperwork for incorporation.
  • We need $400 to file the paperwork for 501(c)(3) status, AKA, nonprofit status
  • Indiegogo takes 4% of our funds, but the campaign is ALL OR NOTHING! If we don't hit our goal, we don't get anything. Our supporters will all receive refunds, and we'll be left out in the cold.
  • We also need funding to mount our next production, Alice in Operaland. All funds above the $550 will go straight to costumes, props, set, and a venue for Alice.

The Impact

We need YOU to help fund us!

  • Opera needs a fresh face, and we're here to give it one. In order to do so, we need nonprofit status to apply for grants and funding.
  • This year, we have many projects running--productions, podcasts, adult lecture series, educational outreach, and monthly non-traditional performances.

Risks & Challenges

While artistic endeavors always bring a host of trials, we believe we have a well-rounded team who can achieve our mission. 

Megan Thompson, Executive Director/Artistic Director, holds a  Master of Music degree in Opera Performance from the Cleveland Institute of Music and her Bachelor of Music degree from Stetson University, with an emphasis in Vocal Performance and Psychology. In addition to her musical background, Ms. Thompson works as a Special Events Coordinator and holds an Associate of Arts degree in Drama with emphasis in Technical Theatre. After holding many leadership positions throughout college and her early professional career, Ms. Thompson was hired to start a girls’ choir for Fuchs Mizrachi School in Beachwood. Her teaching experience does not end there. In addition to teaching private voice lessons at Motter’s Music, she has also served as a drama instructor for the Ocala Civic Theatre and was hired to begin a drama/musical theatre program for the two of the Cleveland Boys’ and Girls’ Clubs. With her background in education, management and event coordination, Ms. Thompson was recently appointed Executive Director/Artistic Director of the Great Lakes Light Opera with the intent of developing a company focused on education and outreach in Northeast Ohio.

Rocky Encalada, Technical Director/Costume Designer, holds a Master of Fine Arts degree in Acting from Kent State University, as well as a Bachelor of Arts in Theatre Performance and a Bachelor of Arts in Technical Theatre and Design. Not only does Ms. Encalada have extensive experience onstage and behind the scenes, but she also has a dozen directing credits to her name. In addition, Rocky Encalada has experience in education and workshop development for ages 6-adult.

Alejandra Martinez, Director of Community Outreach and In-School Learning, holds a Professional Studies Certificate from the Cleveland Institute of Music, a Master of Music from the University of Miami, and a Bachelor of Arts from Stanford University. While at Stanford she served as President and Fundraising Officer on the board of the Stanford Savoyards, a student-run light opera company dedicated to the works of Gilbert and Sullivan. She has extensively studied music abroad; under the guidance of Michael Burden, Dean of New College, Oxford University, she authored a collection of musicological essays on Handel’s operas. Later, she would focus on performance and interpretation of German Lieder at the American Institute of Musical Studies in Graz, Austria. Ms. Martinez was recently honored with the Elly Ameling Award for Excellence in Recital Performance, for a program of music from Spain and Latin America. Her latest performance credit is Nora, from Vaughan Williams’ Riders to the Sea, produced at the Cleveland Institute of Music. She is also the soprano soloist at Disciples Christian Church, whose choir placed first at WCLV’s 2014 Jubiliation Choir Festival. Dedicated to furthering opera outreach, Ms. Martinez intends to get Cleveland excited about opera with smart, fun, and unique programming through GLLO.

 Lyndsay Moy, Director of Development holds a Master of Music degree in Voice from The Cleveland Institute of Music, as well as a Bachelor of Music in Voice and a Bachelor of Arts in Painting from DePauw University. While at CIM, she received the Frederick B. Prentice Award for Excellence in Voice, and at DePauw, she received the prestigious Performer’s Certificate. In 2008 and 2009, Ms. Moy earned four first place awards in the NATS Great Lakes Region competition. Her roles on the operatic stage have included Maurya (Vaughn-Williams’ Riders to the Sea), Marcellina (Mozart’s Le nozze di Figaro), Fidalma (Cimarosa’s Il matrimonio segreto), Mère Marie (Poulenc’s Dialogues of the Carmelites), Zita (Puccini’s Gianni Schicchi), L’Architecture (Charpentier’s Les Arts Florissants), L’écureuil (Ravel’s L’enfant et les sortilèges), and La Badessa (Puccini’s Suor Angelica), among others.  Ms. Moy is a featured alto soloist with the Fairmount Presbyterian Church choir and has performed recently with Opera Night Cleveland.  Ms. Moy also teaches voice at Celebrity School of Music, where she aims to develop the fundamentals of healthy vocal technique, focusing on breathing, alignment, and resonance in styles ranging from classical singing to Broadway.  She currently studies with tenor Clifford Billions and work as CIM’s Opera Administrator.

Reid Taylor (Lecturer in Residence) is a senior studying with Clifford Billions at the Cleveland Institute of Music. Last season he sang the role of the 1st Commissioner inDialogues of the Carmelites, the Sailor in Dido and Aeneas and the Armored Man/Priest in Die Zauberflöte. With the Junior Mendelssohn Choir of Pittsburgh, he soloed inKodaly’s Missa Brevis.  Mr. Taylor attended Carnegie Mellon’s Pre-College Program, Boston University Tanglewood Institute, and AIMS in Graz in 2013. An accomplished pianist as well, Mr. Taylor was hired as a staff accompanist at the Tyrolean Opera Program during the summer of 2014. He has also served as assistant to the conductor for Pittsburgh Opera’s 2009/2010 season. An avid linguist as well as a musician, Mr. Taylor is completing degrees in German and French literature as well as an Italian minor from Case Western Reserve University.

Lisa Yanofsky (Director of Education) holds her Ed.M. in Art in Education from the Harvard Graduate School of Education. Prior to completing her graduate work, Ms. Yanofsky received her B.A. in Art History and Dance from Oberlin College and a B.M. in Vocal Performance and Embodying Performance from Oberlin Conservatory of Music. She is currently the Resident Teaching Artist Team Leader at the Center for Arts-Inspired Learning where she designs and teaches music, dance and interdisciplinary performance programs for students ages 3-18. Ober the past decade, Ms. Yanofsky has developed arts programming for schools, community centers, camps, conservatories and libraries in Ohio and Massachusetts. As a dancer and singer, Ms. Yanofsky has performed throughout the United States and in Italy, Austria, Germany, and the Czech Republic.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools!

GLLO can use your help in other ways, too:

  • Donate any costumes and props you have that you don't need
  • Donate your time and talents to help better the company
  • Introduce us to your network of friends and business partners
  • Support our productions

Her teaching experience does not end there. In addition to teaching private voice lessons at Motter’s Music, she has also served as a drama instructor for the Ocala Civic Theatre and was hired to begin a drama/musical theatre program for the two of the Cleveland Boys’ and Girls’ Clubs. With her background in education, management and event coordination, Ms. Thompson was recently appointed Executive Director/Artistic Director of the Great Lakes Light Opera with the intent of developing a company focused on education and outreach in Northeast Ohio.
Rocky Encalada, Technical Director/Costume Designer, holds a Master of Fine Arts degree in Acting from Kent State University, as well as a Bachelor of Arts in Theatre Performance and a Bachelor of Arts in Technical Theatre and Design. Not only does Ms. Encalada have extensive experience onstage and behind the scenes, but she also has a dozen directing credits to her name. In addition, Rocky Encalada has experience in education and workshop development for ages 6-adult.
Alejandra Martinez, Director of Community Outreach and In-School Learning, holds a Professional Studies Certificate from the Cleveland Institute of Music, a Master of Music from the University of Miami, and a Bachelor of Arts from Stanford University. While at Stanford she served as President and Fundraising Officer on the board of the Stanford Savoyards, a student-run light opera company dedicated to the works of Gilbert and Sullivan. She has extensively studied music abroad; under the guidance of Michael Burden, Dean of New College, Oxford University, she authored a collection of musicological essays on Handel’s operas. Later, she would focus on performance and interpretation of German Lieder at the American Institute of Musical Studies in Graz, Austria. Ms. Martinez was recently honored with the Elly Ameling Award for Excellence in Recital Performance, for a program of music from Spain and Latin America. Her latest performance credit is Nora, from Vaughan Williams’ Riders to the Sea, produced at the Cleveland Institute of Music. She is also the soprano soloist at Disciples Christian Church, whose choir placed first at WCLV’s 2014 Jubiliation Choir Festival. Dedicated to furthering opera outreach, Ms. Martinez intends to get Cleveland excited about opera with smart, fun, and unique programming through GLLO.
 Lyndsay Moy, Director of Development holds a Master of Music degree in Voice from The Cleveland Institute of Music, as well as a Bachelor of Music in Voice and a Bachelor of Arts in Painting from DePauw University. While at CIM, she received the Frederick B. Prentice Award for Excellence in Voice, and at DePauw, she received the prestigious Performer’s Certificate. In 2008 and 2009, Ms. Moy earned four first place awards in the NATS Great Lakes Region competition. Her roles on the operatic stage have included Maurya (Vaughn-Williams’ Riders to the Sea), Marcellina (Mozart’s Le nozze di Figaro), Fidalma (Cimarosa’s Il matrimonio segreto), Mère Marie (Poulenc’s Dialogues of the Carmelites), Zita (Puccini’s Gianni Schicchi), L’Architecture (Charpentier’s Les Arts Florissants), L’écureuil (Ravel’s L’enfant et les sortilèges), and La Badessa (Puccini’s Suor Angelica), among others.  Ms. Moy is a featured alto soloist with the Fairmount Presbyterian Church choir and has performed recently with Opera Night Cleveland.  Ms. Moy also teaches voice at Celebrity School of Music, where she aims to develop the fundamentals of healthy vocal technique, focusing on breathing, alignment, and resonance in styles ranging from classical singing to Broadway.  She currently studies with tenor Clifford Billions and work as CIM’s Opera Administrator.
Reid Taylor (Lecturer in Residence) is a senior studying with Clifford Billions at the Cleveland Institute of Music. Last season he sang the role of the 1st Commissioner inDialogues of the Carmelites, the Sailor in Dido and Aeneas and the Armored Man/Priest in Die Zauberflöte. With the Junior Mendelssohn Choir of Pittsburgh, he soloed inKodaly’s Missa Brevis.  Mr. Taylor attended Carnegie Mellon’s Pre-College Program, Boston University Tanglewood Institute, and AIMS in Graz in 2013. An accomplished pianist as well, Mr. Taylor was hired as a staff accompanist at the Tyrolean Opera Program during the summer of 2014. He has also served as assistant to the conductor for Pittsburgh Opera’s 2009/2010 season. An avid linguist as well as a musician, Mr. Taylor is completing degrees in German and French literature as well as an Italian minor from Case Western Reserve University.
Lisa Yanofsky (Director of Education) holds her Ed.M. in Art in Education from the Harvard Graduate School of Education. Prior to completing her graduate work, Ms. Yanofsky received her B.A. in Art History and Dance from Oberlin College and a B.M. in Vocal Performance and Embodying Performance from Oberlin Conservatory of Music. She is currently the Resident Teaching Artist Team Leader at the Center for Arts-Inspired Learning where she designs and teaches music, dance and interdisciplinary performance programs for students ages 3-18. Ober the past decade, Ms. Yanofsky has developed arts programming for schools, community centers, camps, conservatories and libraries in Ohio and Massachusetts. As a dancer and singer, Ms. Yanofsky has performed throughout the United States and in Italy, Austria, Germany, and the Czech Republic.   Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this campaign with your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools!
GLLO can use your help in other ways, too:
 Donate any costumes and props you have that you don't need
Donate your time and talents to help better the company
Introduce us to your network of friends and business partners
Support our productions

story:
Haujobb – Upcoming North American Tour „The Alliance Of Sound“

Hello Friends!

We have never thought about launching a crowdfunding campaign before as for our past projects, albums, productions, etc. we could always count on your support so far. But this time we really need additional help. As many of you already know, we are booked for The Alliance Of Sound-Tour in North America (see details below). After (too) many years this is now a great opportunity for us to play an extensive tour on the other side of the world again. Unfortunately, due to altered circumstances our initial plan for transportation on this tour failed. We are working now on plan B and C, which are both significantly more expensive. Regardless if this campaign reaches its goal or not, we will still do this tour (unless other unexpected hurdles cross our way to North America). This campaign is only made to help us cover, at least partly, the now increased costs of travelling and accommodation. Financial support is not the only way to help. Show this campaign to your friends or family or whoever might be interested.  Thank you for your continued support, not only in this campaign, but over the past years!

story:
The Long Dark Bright

Too many songs to mention, and some far too dark for The Broken Broadcast, JP Riggall took it upon himself to write and record and album in the space of a month.

And 'The Long Dark Bright' was born. Taking the name from the pilot episode of 'True Detective'.

The Process

In order to process the album quickly and get it produced, mastered and duplicated in a short space of time we need a little bit of your help.

By pre-ordering the album 6-8 weeks in advance, you are able to grab yourself a little bit of history and hopefully, a little bit of a gem.

JP Riggall

Listen to JP Riggall's first single and join his facebook page for updates;
http://JPRiggall.bandcamp.com
http://facebook.com/j.p.riggall

story:
Hi There!

 Thank you for stopping by.

I am releasing my first album of original music that has been my focus for almost two years.  It has been a long journey to get to this point but now, thanks to the hard work of my producer and co-songwriter, T.L. Brown, the engineers and musicians, as well as some fantastic support from the City of El Paso MCAD and the Texas Commission on the Arts as well as Tate Music Group, I have a splendid new CD of original music that is being nationally released on August 14, 2012.

I have a Release Party all set for August 23rd at Ardovino's Desert Crossing in Sunland Park, New Mexico.  It will be a wonderful party that I hope you will attend.

 The money I raise will cover the following expenses:

  • Pay for the hardworking musicians who will perform with me at the Release Party
  • Stage to perform on, incl. setup and tear-down
  • Sound and lighting for the performance
  • An Internet Connection stick to allow album producer and co-songwriter T.L. Brown to talk to the party attendees 
  • 100 Commemorative T-shirts for all donors in attendance; after that, we will hand them out until they are gone...
  • A banner displaying the donors' names

The songs that my songwriting partner and producer, T.L. Brown, have written are a reflection of deeper inquiries about life and our individual soul journey.  By supporting this campaign, you are also helping to support our vision of bringing uplfting music with high production values into the marketplace.

I hope you will take a listen to the music and decide for yourself what you think.

I hope to see you at the Release Party!  If you are out of town, please let me know you'd like to attend.  We are considering broadcasting the concert online.

If we exceed our goal, we will set aside that money for our next music video, which is slated for Fall 2012.  We will be flying in T.L. Brown to help film the video, which we are doing by ourselves to keep costs down.

story:
Short Summary

In late 2016 I was thinking about my time in doublethink while hanging out with my four-year old son. I had the thought that my son would not really know about what it was like for me being in a band like doublethink and going on the adventures that we did. I wished, at that time, that I could hand him something concise yet comprehensive that covered the band's career.

The thought stayed with me and I envisioned making him a mix CD when he became old enough to appreciate it. But come on, a mix CD?! That's hardly good enough to encapsulate the entire history of doublethink and what it means to me.

And you!

That's why I'm starting this campaign to produce an anthology of doublethink's music, including a 20-page booklet filled with pictures and personal accounts from the band members themselves.

The anthology will be called "Keep The Wolves At Bay", which is the name of an unreleased track that will be included in the anthology.

The design of the booklet, the tracklist, and the personal accounts from the band members themselves are all totally complete. I simply need the funds to mass produce the physical copies!

What You Get & What We Need

This 2-disc collection features music from doublethink's entire career and includes songs played by all the various lineups. The first disc is made up of the best of the songs that were commercially released in one way or another, while the second disc is made up of unreleased songs, demos, live tracks, acoustic versions, etc. To see the full track list, click here!

I am not intending to make any profit from this campaign. The $700.00 I am looking to raise will go to the following:

  • Duplication of 100 physical copies of the 2-disc set
  • Shipping costs of getting the copies to the buyers (that's you!)

I am anticipating that 100 copies will suffice, but if more are needed I can always increase that number. Basically, the more money raised the more copies there will be!

However, if more money is raised than needed to buy the copies that have been ordered, the surplus funds will go to other future doublethink projects that the band and myself have been considering.

The Impact

Ultimately, I am in this for three people:

  1. Myself
  2. My son
  3. All the doublethink fans

This is (and has been!) an absolute labor of love. I am only looking to capture the moments and memories of doublethink's history. That includes my time with the group as well as the time after I left. This will truly be the best way I can think of to honor what I think, in my humble opinion, is a terrific rock and roll band.

Risks & Challenges

I'll be honest with you: even if I don't raise the $700.00 I'm looking for, I am still going to make this happen. Any money raised will go straight into defraying the costs of the project from my own personal finances. So really, there are no risks at all with this campaign. If you contribute your $12.00 you will get a copy of the anthology, guaranteed. All copies will be mailed out via USPS as soon as they are ready to be shipped.

NOTE: If you are not living in the continental United States, please anticipate delays in getting your order. You may also have to contribute a little extra to cover higher shipping costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are a doublethink fan but for some reason are not interested in this anthology set, the best thing you can do is spread the word to other doublethink fans you know to make sure they have the opportunity to get their hands on this awesome collection!

story:
THE BENSONIANS

Since 2010, we have been Fairfield University’s premier all male A cappella group. Our sound has transformed from simple barbershop doo-wop to a compelling fusion of classic technique and exciting innovation. Each new generation of Bensonians has poured their passion into creating the best musical experience for our fans, whose support has been the greatest gift we could ever receive. Our goal has always been to entertain and use our talents to give back to the community, volunteering our voices to local causes in Southern Connecticut such as Relay for Life, the Special Olympics, or health rehabilitation centers.

Now, we are asking for your help to broaden the impact of our music. Last year, we released our debut album, and we are grateful to the incredible circle of listeners that supported us. With our sophomore album, Brother II Brother, we aim to capture the excitement and camaraderie of our live performances, while achieving a sound worthy of modern A Cappella’s industry standard. This is our first crowd-funding campaign, and any contribution is incredibly appreciated. We are excited to share this experience with our fans and reach a new audience.

THE ALBUM

Brother II Brother is dedicated to the community of people that allow us to cultivate our passion. The track list is a collection of modern and classic songs (no spoilers) that maintain the intimacy and excitement of our live performances; elevated by modern production to produce the most beautiful and powerful recordings we can give to you. Featuring soloists from both veteran to first year members, as well as arrangements from many different professionals, this album will allow our group to shine.

OUR GOAL IS TO RAISE $8,500

We want to deliver the best possible quality recording to our fans, reaching a new degree of professionalism, and that means studio costs of $8,150, with the remaining money going toward licensing and distribution. Our fans deserve music that captures the thrill and intimacy that only A Cappella music evokes. Even if we don’t reach our target, we will use the money to do everything we can to put together an album that we can be proud to give to our supporters.

PERKS & REWARDS!

To show our gratitude, we want to offer many exciting perks to our supporters, such as digital downloads of both our albums, live performances, a Bensonians calendar, and even a date with Ben Bayers! (He’s quite the gentleman)

These are just a few of the ways we wish to show our thanks for all the love and support of our friends, family, and fans, because you are the reason that we pursue our love of music and performing.

YOUR HELP

We are forever grateful to anyone who has ever supported us, and we want to give our fans an album no matter what. The Bensonians owe everything to the people who encourage our passion, and we are thankful for such a supportive community. Any amount goes a long way, and we want the album to reflect the love we have for the music we make; however, we college students understand more than anyone that times are tough, so just simply sharing this campaign on social media is a huge help. The larger the outreach, the greater opportunity we have to give our fans a meaningful creation. Thank you so much, we look forward to this exciting journey!

2-3-6-9
