story:
Ollie Sloan - Debut Album

My names Ollie Sloan. I'm a self-taught musician playing piano and guitar who's been interested in music from a very young age. I grew up with music around me, with my dad being an incredible pianist and thus a huge influence in my life. 

Never wanting lessons, I chose to 'feel' my way, playing piano and guitar when it felt 'right'. I slowly became more and more familiar with the shapes and sounds, and drew comfort from playing, particularly after my dad moved away. It was undoubtedly comforting and reassuring. 

For the last three years I have been involved with numerous people in the music industry and have often had the impression that they wish to push and pull you in a certain direction. I've played gigs around UK, had my music on BBCs Holby City, been on the radio and most importantly have gained a hugely supportive fanbase. However, a lot of things just never go to plan.

Now that Im a lot more familiar with the pitfalls and have more of an emotional 'backbone', I'm going to record what I enjoy playing. I want the people who have listened to me for a long time to be able to have something they deserve and something that's good quality...infact...GREAT quality!

It's incredibly hard, as with many career choices, to make waves when you're battling against so many people, companies, stereotypes and finances...or a lack of. I respect anyone who's been successful in this industry no matter who they are, because it takes a lot of will power and commitment to make it work. 

So, I am finally working to record and finish my debut album! It's been a long time coming and there have been a lot of ups and downs but I'm finally ready to put everything together. 

Any contribution you can make would be incredible. I am doing everything I can currently, working with friends, artists and musicians who are helping me to keep costs down.

All contributions ensure a copy of the album when it's finished! As long as I know who you are or have your email address! :) Thank you


Where your help comes in

  • £2500 is the amount I will need to record eight tracks, hire session musicians, have the eight tracks plus any bonus tracks mastered, create and print album artwork and finally pay for the design and production of the album packaging.
  • I aim to create an impact in the Pop/Folk genre. From all the work we've done so far I would like to think that my voice stands out in today's industry and that I will be able to progress further using the album when it is finished to promote myself.
  • If I do not make my goal, any money that has been donated will still be put towards the album recordings and it may just mean the final product gets delayed for a while. However, regardless of when and where, I will finish it. 

The Impact

From a penny to a pound, it all helps.

There are people who have really helped me over the last few years. I really owe them something. I just want to be able to give them a physical copy they can enjoy to just say thank you. 

I'd like to say that I'm helping solve world peace by creating music that is honest and tells a story, but I imagine that's unlikely as the world's a little more complicated than that haha. I can say however, that I will always be true to my word and forever appreciate the help that I receive. There is no question that without people listening to your music, you will never become successful.

I aim to use this album to get my point across and provide honest music that people can relate to and understand. I will do my very best to use it to get a record deal and further progress in my music career whilst at the same time, giving back as much as I can to listeners and people who have supported me.

Other Ways You Can Help!

  • A huge way you can help me outside of this is simply by sharing my music/videos and telling people you know about it. Find my music at www.soundcloud.com/olliesloan or on youtube my channel is sloanoliver
  • Also add me on twitter and say hi :) olliesloan
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you

Ol

:)

x

I just want to be able to give them a physical copy they can enjoy to just say thank you. I'd like to say that I'm helping solve world peace by creating music that is honest and tells a story, but I imagine that's unlikely as the world's a little more complicated than that haha. I can say however, that I will always be true to my word and forever appreciate the help that I receive. There is no question that without people listening to your music, you will never become successful.I aim to use this album to get my point across and provide honest music that people can relate to and understand. I will do my very best to use it to get a record deal and further progress in my music career whilst at the same time, giving back as much as I can to listeners and people who have supported me.Other Ways You Can Help!
A huge way you can help me outside of this is simply by sharing my music/videos and telling people you know about it. Find my music at www.soundcloud.com/olliesloan or on youtube my channel is sloanoliver
Also add me on twitter and say hi :) olliesloan
Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thank youOl:)x

story:
… WITH LIBERTY AND JUSTICE FOR ALL?

PLEASE GO TO www.igg.ma/at/jlsf2 later this summer to view my second try at this IndieGoGo fundraising.  Seems as if some massaging is in order to obtain visibility!!!   I may try again in July or August. 

This is a “Pay It Forward” inspired and styled campaign… Read on and see why. Video above... an inspiration to me.  A child that gives to the world since she was 10!

A Voice for Justice:  Born from personal experience, I now have a long term vision; one that you may want to share. The problem:  Everyone may know a friend, family member, co-worker or neighbor who has a need to seek justice in the court system but just cannot afford the burden of cost or do so themselves because of the complexity of the rules and laws.  This causes worry and anxiety with them and is a detriment not only to one’s rights, but to one’s health and soul.  Capitulation is a bad feeling to ones liberty, freedom and peace of mind.  I am currently without resources to seek justice and feel that stress. The solution?  After you read my personal situation and campaign here to alleviate my current problem, I will strive to solve that problem for many others in the future.  The solution or VISION follows my next plea for your compassion and contribution (Scroll Down).

My Current Situation and Need – The PLEA for Help

I used to be an engineer and visionary entrepreneur working on some big projects to bring to life to provide society with some good living choices and recreation, I used to be working on some novels too, I used to be a catamaran sailor, bicyclist and mountain hiker.  I used to be engaged with life and living and loving it.  That is, until I suffered a personal injury due to other’s negligence which changed my life forever: A blunt force closed head injury which, although it left my intelligence intact for the most part, it diminished many other aspects of my life:  Things such as rock solid memory and recall, focus, energy, balance, coordination, organization, etc.  The kind of things one needs to successfully navigate a fulfilling life and a sustaining career or job.  After recovery from post concussion syndrome, knowing that I had not returned to my “old self”, I still tried to make it work as the doctors said “get used to the new you”.  I have become the proverbial Absent-Minded-Professor!  I tried for five years to work in a career which normally should have been easy for me to do but could not handle the work load needed to succeed.  Memory, focus, disorganization and other deficits due to my injury prevented it.  After going broke and being “technically homeless”, save for the support from family for shelter, I had to apply for and obtained Social Security Disability status.  I can tell everyone that this stipend, although appreciated at this time, is not enough for one to live on for the long term without other help.  I hope to get off of that system as soon as I can someway, someday, somehow.  I am sure that if you help me with this funding drive, I can and will once I have my day in Court.

My way to do so is to seek JUSTICE for the injury due to other’s negligence.  I had an attorney for that purpose but in my opinion (and that of others) he mishandled the entire situation, did not act properly as my fiduciary, did not properly serve the principle defendant, failed to follow my directives regarding the secondary defendant and failed to use due diligence:  All the while telling me to not worry and that all was under control.  He even failed to impeach a witness, upon my directive, who perjured herself where direct evidence is available to definitively prove that.  His presentations are still unknown to me as I was not informed or present at hearings or strategy meetings and he is still holding back my full case file, which is my right to have according to other attorneys.  Once I obtain these files by Court Order, I feel that I will learn of even more malpractice.  To cut to the point, he failed to bring the case to a rightful trial for a rightful resolution and award for loss.  I did not get a dime due to the negligence-caused-injury.  Malpractice of law, breach of contract, breach of fiduciary duty and other issues will be enumerated in the complaint against him and his law firm.  This law firm is insured for such malpractice and may choose to settle but even if their insurance company suggests this, they have an overriding right to go to trial so I need to be prepared and need representation to do so. 

Here is another interesting point of contention with him.  Although the attorney here enjoys a good reputation and standing, he failed on multiple levels with my case as is evident in my opinion and that of others.  Another attorney I asked to represent me for the legal malpractice case had contacted him and asked ‘why he did not serve and summon the primary defendant into court.’  I was told by that attorney that my attorney, as my fiduciary and an officer of the Court, had stated the defendant(s) were deceased!  They are alive and well in South Carolina!!!  This is deception in my opinion and just not right.  Is he trying to sabotage my effort to bring my rightful case to Court?  I broke past my anxiety somewhat and, just in the nick-of-time, I have purchased a Court Index Number in March and will be serving Summons with Notice into Court next month against the defendants.  I have “bought some time” now and once I feel that my legal funding campaign is moving forward with the help of many, I will be retaining an attorney to represent me on an hourly basis.  A few attorneys told me that the budget for this case will be high.  They all say that the legal malpractice is very evident and not a large hurdle to show or prove, but that I must then also re-present the original injury case and show that it could have led to a successful award for loss.  It will, but it takes expensive expert witnesses to do so, and a contingency based representation is not possible unless some attorney steps forward with some altruism: therefore, I NEED YOUR HELP.  Also, it is not easy to find an attorney willing to go after another attorney for such a Just Cause.  Many know each other and that creates a conflict.  I do have a couple in mind but their budget figures are high:  Between $55,000 and $80,000 USD.  Attorney representation is vital now.  I have no chance to self-represent in a trial.  My verbal expression skills are diminished and along with focus, organization deficits and the resulting anxiety, I would probably “short circuit” if I tried to do this myself even though I know the facts.  I would fail. 

Although I do hope to encourage donors to help me reach a goal of about $75,000 just in case, I am going to start this campaign with a goal of $40,000 and hope and pray for more or that I can find some less expensive experts or work out arrangements with some such that expense would be paid in part with remainder upon collection of an award. Note:  any funds in excess of those needed to pursue this access to the courts will be used toward the formation of the JUSTICE LEAGUE SUPPORT FUND charity fund (my VISION, see below). I will form this charity fund once I can breathe with some ease after hiring an attorney for the above situation and then have time to do all the acrobatics one has to do to start such a fund in the State and Federal levels.  I will need help with that too and will be seeking like-minded concerned citizens to join me in that adventure.  I have already started to compile knowledge and advice regarding its setup and have developed a draft of the model it will operate on.  If for an unforeseen reason I cannot move forward with that worthy VISION, then I will PAY THE EXCESS FUNDS FORWARD to others in need or donate to a worthy charity.

Oh… and it is my BIRTHDAY on May 5th, so I will consider all contributions to the campaign in May to also be a sentimental or gracious Birthday Wish too!!! PLEASE celebrate with me.

Contributions will be used for expenses such as court filings, depositions, transcripts, attorney hourly fees, economist fee, expert witness fees, and travel costs for any witnesses, including that of the original primary defendant who is out of State. excess funds will be used for charity.  That is, used to fund and start my long term VISION… the JUSTICE LEAGUE SUPPORT FUND (JLSF) so others may be aided.

As a final plea, HELP ME to HELP MYSELF with this Just Cause.  Donations of any size are appreciated.  Help also by spreading the word by sharing this page with others who you feel may be charitable in nature and can hold passion for the larger future plan as well. Remember, someday, someone you know or love may need help as I do now.  Keep the JLSF plan in mind and LIKE and FOLLOW it on Facebook or here as it grows for someday you may help someone else by informing them of it. You are at an advantage since you are already now informed!

The VISION

Now, the long term vision:  To form a charity fund as a 501(c)(3) and have it administered to seek contributions through Indiegogo.com and through the normal campaigns and outreach to fortunate people, foundations and companies for the purpose of giving so that the JLSF can then give to needy persons who have Just Causes to rightfully seek access to the Justice System for non-criminal causes for action, that is Civil Court action so that they can believe that Justice also applies to them and that they may seek some PEACE OF MIND by at least having the chance to be heard or defended in issues that affect their rights.

To this end, I have also started an Indiegogo campaign to solicit needed start-up funds to create this Charity Fund.  It is called the JUSTICE LEAGUE SUPPORT FUND and as the founder, I will develop it with help and advice of others to make it a reality.  Please go to that site if you wish to explore it further as it coincides with my goal here.  Please donate here and if you wish, donate now or later with the JLSF as it develops.  

GO HERE TO LEARN MORE OR DONATE for JLSF:   

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/justice-league-support-fund/x/7295388#home

Questions?  Message here or email at   JLSupportFund@aol.com

story:
** THANK YOU to everyone who helped make this campaign a success! We are excited for this concert series and look forward to seeing everyone each month at the show! Don't forget to follow us on social media to receive updates when we've released the show videos and interviews.**

**Update: We'll be updating all concert information on opbmusic.org from here on out. You can also subscribe to our YouTube channel for a notification each time a Stagepass video is posted.

Welcome to opbmusic Stagepass – a unique opportunity for you to celebrate and support the vibrancy of Portland’s thriving music scene by getting up close to your favorite Northwest bands.

Stagepass is a new concert series that not only gives you an immersive experience in the Portland music community, but your support and participation will help amazing local bands gain exposure to a worldwide audience through highly produced post-concert videos. 


The Stagepass Experience

Each month, Stagepass tickets holders will enjoy a special, intimate concert from Portland-area artists and bands. All concerts will be filmed by talented videographers and edited together with a behind-the-scenes band interview. The resulting high-energy video will be available online to enjoy and share with friends.

Stagepass Details:

  • Tickets are sold as a series package - individual show tickets will not be available.
  • There will be one concert per month.
  • The Stagepass series will last for nine months.
  • Concerts will be held at Mississippi Studios.
  • At least one band will perform per show. Many shows will also feature an opening band.
  • All shows will be filmed with HD video.

Stagepass Roster:

  • May 10: Modern Kin, withJust Lions
  • June 11: Black Prairie, with St. Even (NOTE: Tickets to this concert will be sold through Indiegogo only - there are no tickets sales at the door. If you purchase your ticket after 5pm on 6/11, your Indiegogo confirmation will be your entrance to the show.)
  • July 12: Run On Sentence with a special guest, TBA
  • August 15: Mimicking Birds, with The Verner Pantons
  • September 13: Laura Gibson
  • November 8: TBA

We’ll be adding more bands to the Stagepass roster throughout the Indiegogo campaign. Be sure to check back often*!


Our Goal:

Over the years, opbmusic has laid a strong foundation for a successful concert series. With more than 200 successful opbmusic sessions under our belt, we are excited about the opportunity to grow the sessions into a series and to place a greater spotlight on Portland’s incredibly talented local artist community. We cannot do this without your support.

opbmusic has received a grant from PBS Digital Studios to produce the Stagepass concert and video series. PBS will match up to $20,000 of the total amount raised during this campaign; a total that we feel is necessary to make this production shine. 100 percent of funds raised during this campaign will be dedicated to helping cover the bands’ costs and producing high quality videos. No money from this campaign will go to OPB, opbmusic or PBS Digital Studios. Additionally, this campaign is funded independently of OPB’s member contributions.


Three Ways to Support:

Buy tickets: The most beneficial way you can support Stagepass, and this project, is to buy tickets. We are offering tickets in a nine-concert package starting for a mere $75.

You will also notice in our perks list to the right that we have additional tickets options in larger packages: a signed instrument from a participating band, dinner before a concert and an overnight hotel stay.

Contribute: If you can’t attend the shows, but would still like to support this project, we would love a donation. To contribute financially only, click the large “contribute now’” button on the top right of the page and follow the  “no perk, I just want to contribute” link. We also have a fantastic graphic t-shirt (see artwork and description below) you can order for only $20.

Tell your friends: The success of our Indiegogo campaign depends on you! And there are a number of ways to tell your concert and music-loving friends about our campaign - please give us a shout out on your Facebook, Twitter or Google+ pages.

To show our appreciation for helping our campaign, you'll have the chance to win a guitar signed by Modern Kin. To enter, simply tag your social media posts with the hashtag #opbstagepass or send a screen shot that shows how/where you shared to stagepass@opb.org. Every share is one entry and there is no limit to the number of entries. All shares must be submitted by 5pm on May 9, 2014. 


About opbmusic:

OPB’s musical arm, opbmusic, covers the thriving music scene in Oregon, the Northwest and beyond, with an online and HD2 audio stream. Since 2008, we have partnered with artists on more than 250 studio and soundcheck sessions, which can be viewed at opbmusic.org and on YouTube. Many of the Northwest’s biggest musical acts have been featured in our sessions, including The Shins, The Dandy Warhols and M. Ward. In addition to these sessions, each year at MusicFest NW, we host an annual free day party, PDX/Rx. An estimated 900 people attended the party in 2013.


The Perks, In Details:

$25 - SUMMER SERIES PACK - NEW!
You'll receive ONE ticket to all the three summer shows in the series: Black Prairie on June 11, Mimicking Birds on July 12 and a band to be announced on August 15. Tickets will be handled through Eventbrite. You'll receive the first ticket by June 11.  Please be sure to check your spam filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem your ticket before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite links for each of the two remaining concerts.

This level does not include a t-shirt.

$20 - ROADIE

You'll receive one of our graphic Stagepass t-shirts, in the size of your choice, to show your support when you aren't at the concerts. All t-shirts are unisex, short-sleeved, and made from a 100% super-soft cotton. We will follow up with you to get your specific size. This is a great way to support the series, even if you cannot attend the concerts.

$75 - GROUPIE
At our entry level for tickets, you'll receive ONE ticket to all nine Stagepass concerts. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your ticket by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem your ticket before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite links each month for the duration of the series.

This level does not include a t-shirt.

$90 - PRODUCER
At this level, you'll receive ONE ticket to all nine Stagepass concerts and ONE t-shirt, in the size of your choice, see above for details. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your ticket by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem your ticket before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite links each month for the duration of the series.

$150 - PROMOTER
Want to bring a friend to the shows? At this level, you'll receive TWO tickets to all nine Stagepass concerts and TWO t-shirts in the sizes of your choice. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your tickets by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem your tickets before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite links each month for the duration of the series.

This is also our best deal for tickets.

$200 - WITH THE BAND

Dinner's on us! For one show of your choice, you'll receive $100 towards dinner at Lincoln PDX. Lincoln, located near Mississippi Studios on N. Williams, prides itself on old-school simplicity mixed with comfort and pleasure. The menu features seasonal fare, focusing on food that's produced in the Northwest.

At this level you'll also receive TWO tickets to all nine shows and TWO t-shirts, sizes of your choice. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your tickets by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem your tickets before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite links each month for the duration of the series.

$500 BUSINESS PARTNER
At this level, Business Partners will receive one banner placement onsite at each concert (must provide banner) and an onstage thank you before the show.  Business partners will also receive TWO tickets to all remaining eight shows. You will be contacted separately with tickets and to arrange banners.

$500 - TOUR MANAGER

Enjoy a night on the town with this level. A pedicab will pick you up from the Ace Hotel, where you will be spending one night after the show of your choice, and return you after the show. The Ace, located in downtown Portland, is centrally located a block from the Pearl District and easy walking distances to most other West Side hot spots. All rooms stays will be based upon availability. Only a short 2.5 miles from Mississippi Studios makes for an enjoyable pedicab experience.

You'll receive VIP first access to ALL the shows, TWO tickets to all nine concerts and TWO t-shirts, sizes of your choice. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your tickets by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem your tickets before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite links each month for the duration of the series.

$700 - VIP
At this level you'll receive a Portland Music Company Fender Standard Telecaster signed by the band of your choice.

You'll also receive VIP first access to ALL the shows, TWO tickets to all nine concerts and TWO t-shirts, sizes of your choice. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your tickets by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem your tickets before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite links each month for the duration of the series.

$1,000 - STAGE MANAGER

Enjoy a night on the town with this level. A limo will pick you up from the Hotel Lucia, where you will be spending the night for the show of your choice, and return you after the show. Hotel Lucia, located in downtown Portland, is a gorgeous and chic space that has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since 2003.

You'll receive VIP first access to ALL the shows, TWO tickets to all nine concerts and TWO t-shirts, sizes of your choice. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your tickets by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem your tickets before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite links each month for the duration of the series.


* Bands may be subject to change in the case of an emergency or unforeseen circumstances.
story_txt:
** THANK YOU to everyone who helped make 
this campaign a success! We are excited for this concert series and look forward to seeing everyone each month at the show! Don't forget to follow us on social media to receive updates when we've released the show videos and interviews.****Update: We'll be updating all concert information on opbmusic.org from here on out. You can also subscribe to our YouTube channel for a notification each time a Stagepass video is posted.Welcome to opbmusic Stagepass – a unique opportunity for you
to celebrate and support the vibrancy of Portland’s thriving music scene by
getting up close to your favorite Northwest bands.
Stagepass is a new concert series that not only gives you an
immersive experience in the Portland music community, but your support and participation
will help amazing local bands gain exposure to a worldwide audience through
highly produced post-concert videos. 
The Stagepass Experience
Each month, Stagepass tickets holders will enjoy a special,
intimate concert from Portland-area artists and bands. All concerts will be
filmed by talented videographers and edited together with a behind-the-scenes
band interview. The resulting high-energy video will be available online to
enjoy and share with friends. 
Stagepass Details:

Tickets are sold as a series package - individual show tickets will not be available.

There will be one concert per month.
The Stagepass series will last for nine months.
Concerts will be held at Mississippi Studios.
At least one band will perform
per show. Many shows will also feature an opening band.

All shows will be filmed with HD video. 

Stagepass Roster:


May 10: Modern Kin, withJust Lions 


June 11: Black Prairie, with St. Even (NOTE: Tickets to this concert will be sold through Indiegogo only - there are no tickets sales at the door. If you purchase your ticket after 5pm on 6/11, your Indiegogo confirmation will be your entrance to the show.)


July 12: Run On Sentence with a special guest, TBA


August 15: Mimicking Birds, with The Verner Pantons


September 13: Laura Gibson


November 8: TBA

We’ll be adding more bands to the Stagepass roster
throughout the Indiegogo campaign. Be sure to check back often*!
Our Goal:
Over the years, opbmusic has laid a strong foundation for a
successful concert series. With more than 200 successful opbmusic sessions
under our belt, we are excited about the opportunity to grow the sessions into
a series and to place a greater spotlight on Portland’s incredibly talented
local artist community. We cannot do this without your support. opbmusic has
received a grant from PBS Digital Studios to produce the Stagepass concert and
video series. PBS will match up to $20,000 of the total amount raised during
this campaign; a total that we feel is necessary to make this production shine.
100 percent of funds raised during this campaign will be dedicated to helping
cover the bands’ costs and producing high quality videos.
No money from this campaign will go to OPB, opbmusic or PBS Digital Studios.
Additionally, this campaign is funded independently of OPB’s member
contributions.
Three Ways to
Support:
Buy tickets: The most
beneficial way you can support Stagepass, and this project, is
to buy tickets. We are offering tickets in a nine-concert package starting for a mere $75.

You will also notice in our perks list to the right that we
have additional tickets options in larger packages: a signed instrument from a
participating band, dinner before a concert and an overnight hotel stay. 
Contribute: If
you can’t attend the shows, but would still like to support this project, we would love a donation. To contribute financially only, click
the large “contribute now’” button on
the top right of the page and follow the 
“no perk, I just want to
contribute” link. We also have a fantastic graphic
t-shirt (see artwork and description below) you can order for only $20.
Tell your friends:
The success of our Indiegogo campaign depends on you! And there are a number of ways to tell your concert and music-loving friends about our campaign - please give us a shout out on your Facebook, Twitter or Google+ pages. 
To show
our appreciation for helping our campaign, you'll have the chance to win a guitar signed by Modern Kin. To enter, simply tag your social media posts with the hashtag #opbstagepass or send a
screen shot that shows how/where you shared to stagepass@opb.org. Every share is one entry and there is no limit to the number of entries. All shares must be submitted by 5pm on May 9, 2014. About opbmusic:
OPB’s musical arm, opbmusic, covers the thriving music scene
in Oregon, the Northwest and beyond, with an online and HD2 audio stream. Since 2008, we have partnered with artists on more than 250 studio and soundcheck sessions, which can be viewed at opbmusic.org and on YouTube. Many of
the Northwest’s biggest musical acts have been featured in our sessions,
including The Shins, The Dandy Warhols and M. Ward. In addition to these sessions, each
year at MusicFest NW, we host an annual free day party, PDX/Rx. An estimated
900 people attended the party in 2013. The Perks, In Details:$25 - SUMMER SERIES PACK - NEW! You'll receive ONE ticket to all the three summer shows in the series: Black Prairie on June 11, Mimicking Birds on July 12 and a band to be announced on August 15. Tickets will be handled through Eventbrite. You'll receive the first ticket by June 11.  Please be sure to check your spam filter if 
you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem your ticket 
before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite links for each of the two remaining concerts.This level does not include a t-shirt.$20 - ROADIEYou'll receive one of our graphic Stagepass t-shirts, in the size of your choice, to show your support when you aren't at the concerts. All t-shirts are unisex, short-sleeved, and made from a 100% super-soft cotton. We will follow up with you to get your specific size. This is a great way to support the series, even if you cannot attend the concerts.$75 - GROUPIEAt our entry level for tickets, you'll receive ONE ticket to all nine Stagepass concerts. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your ticket by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem your ticket before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite links each month for the duration of the series.This level does not include a t-shirt.$90 - PRODUCERAt this level, you'll receive ONE ticket to all nine Stagepass concerts and ONE t-shirt, in the size of your choice, see above for details. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your ticket by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam 
filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem 
your ticket before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite 
links each month for the duration of the series.$150 - PROMOTERWant to bring a friend to the shows? At this level, you'll receive TWO tickets to all nine Stagepass concerts and TWO t-shirts in the sizes of your choice. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your tickets by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam 
filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem 
your tickets before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite 
links each month for the duration of the series.This is also our best deal for tickets.$200 - WITH THE BANDDinner's on us! For one show of your choice, you'll receive $100 towards dinner at Lincoln PDX. Lincoln, located near Mississippi Studios on N. Williams, prides itself on old-school simplicity mixed with comfort and pleasure. The menu features seasonal fare, focusing on food that's produced in the Northwest.At this level you'll also receive TWO tickets to all nine shows and TWO t-shirts, sizes of your choice. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your tickets by 
May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam 
filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem 
your tickets before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite 
links each month for the duration of the series.$500 BUSINESS PARTNERAt this level, Business Partners will receive one banner placement onsite at each concert (must provide banner) and an onstage thank you before the show.  Business partners will also receive TWO tickets to all remaining eight shows. You will be contacted separately with tickets and to arrange banners.$500 - TOUR MANAGEREnjoy a night on the town with this level. A pedicab will pick you up from the Ace Hotel, where you will be spending one night after the show of your choice, and return you after the show. The Ace, located in downtown Portland, is centrally located a block from the Pearl District and easy walking distances to most other West Side hot spots. All rooms stays will be based upon availability. Only a short 2.5 miles from Mississippi Studios makes for an enjoyable pedicab experience.You'll receive VIP first access to ALL the shows, TWO tickets to all nine concerts and TWO t-shirts, sizes of your choice. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your tickets by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam 
filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem 
your tickets before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite 
links each month for the duration of the series.$700 - VIPAt this level you'll receive a Portland Music Company Fender Standard Telecaster signed by the band of your choice. You'll also receive VIP first access to ALL the shows, TWO tickets to all nine concerts and TWO t-shirts, sizes of your choice. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your tickets by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam 
filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem 
your tickets before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite 
links each month for the duration of the series.$1,000 - STAGE MANAGEREnjoy a night on the town with this level. A limo will pick you up from the Hotel Lucia, where you will be spending the night for the show of your choice, and return you after the show. Hotel Lucia, located in downtown Portland, is a gorgeous and chic space that has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since 2003. You'll receive VIP first access to ALL the shows, TWO tickets to all nine concerts and TWO t-shirts, sizes of your choice. Stagepass concert tickets will be managed through Eventbrite. You will receive an email with the Eventbrite link to your tickets by May 9 from stagepass@opb.org. Please be sure to check your spam 
filter if you don't see your email. You'll follow the link to redeem 
your tickets before the show. We'll continue emailing you Eventbrite 
links each month for the duration of the series.* Bands may be subject to change in the case of an emergency or unforeseen circumstances.

story:
Short Summary

One thing has always been clear – ever since we first started making music together:

WE WANT TO PLAY IN THE UK!!!

Travelling around, playing on hundreds of German countryside stages, we never lost sight of that dream. We played our first bunch of England shows last October in London, Manchester and Newcastle. We were absolutely amazed by the warm welcome and the great feedback of the British audience. And we really, really want to come back as soon as possible and play many, many more shows!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £1100 in order to stay in the UK for 1-2 weeks in 2014. When you live in the UK we will hopefully see you on tour, on top of that we have thought of a few perks for you.

Would you like to receive a personal postcard from tour or even have us play an intimate gig for you and your friends in your living room?? Then this is your chance to make us and yourselves very happy! Of course we also have CDs and merch on offer.

The Impact

It can be very hard to get gigs for a band that’s new to the UK market. Most of the slots we are being offered are unpaid. We do want to play as many gigs as possible. Unfortunately the travelling doesn’t come cheap and we have to cover those costs somehow. With your support we will be able to stay over for longer and play more shows. In the longrun this means we can start building a fanbase and it will get easier to get (paid) gigs. So your support with this campaign means a lot!!!!  

Other Ways You Can Help 

You can also help us a great deal if you tell your friends about our campaign. Please share the link to this site on facebook / twitter etc.

Spread the word and make it happen! BRING BACK LOIFIOR!!! 

Budget

500€ Petrol+200€ Ferry+400€ 

Accommodation = 1100€ 


Thanks a million, 

Adrian, Julius, Dennis and Raphael

story:
On January 5, 2014, I went into my studio, and was greeted with the smell of burning circuits and the sound of screeching speakers. My soundboard and the computer that ran it was dead and my studio speakers were blown out. My livelihood had burnt up over the night. I’ve been working hard to keep this place going, and this blow really happened at the worst possible moment. We need a good computer, software, monitors, and some cables to keep our future possible. There's just too much work still to do.

Since 2007 I've been running this studio with my awesome friend George Hochbrueckner. I can't put into words how much this place means to me. This studio has provided for my family, it's produced music that has reached people locally and across the world, we've hosted amazing concerts, and even tea parties. No matter what it is, I believe we're helping people achieve goals and live out their dreams......... the dreams that really mean something. And no matter how long I've been doing this, each project we finish is a new and sincere joy. It's always a wondrous thing to help someone in their quest of creating art through music. I really love it. And I hope that we can keep making this studio a better place.  Thank you.

story:
Please, let me introduce myself, my name is Missy and I am single mother of a toddler, living in Northern Kentucky. After the birth of my son,  I found myself in a situation of uncertainty, disappointment and fear. I had to make some changes in my life if I wanted to be happy and fulfilled.  After struggling and searching for answers, I decided to turn to God like never before.  From that moment my journey with the Lord began. I opened my mind and heart and let his words of wisdom guide me through the many challenges and decisions I had to face.  Every day in the face of my son, I see one of his truly remarkable miracles.  I feel his strength when I find myself faced with adversity and sadness.  I also feel his strength and pride when I accomplish something I set out to do.  I cannot put into words the peace I now feel within me and the strength and desire I now have to not only continue on with my journey, but also to help others find their pathway to God.  It is because of this desire to reach out and help spread the joy and love of God, that I have answered a calling and a need to make a trip to Johannesburg, South Africa.   On this mission my goal is to reach out and help as many who need and want it. I want to spread the peaceful word of God as far as I can and to do this I need some help.  I am reaching out to you, my family, friends, coworkers and others, asking for some financial assistance in helping me reach my desire to help others in a country that so badly needs it.  Every little bit will help and will be so appreciated.  I assure you your monies will be well spent and I hope that you find some peace in knowing that you also took part in reaching out and helping so many others find their inner peace and strength.  I want the ones I can reach to feel as complete as I do, because  giving my life to God, was the most important and best decision I have ever made. It did not make my life perfect or problem free, but it did change who I am forever. I could not imagine facing life’s challenges on my own without God in my life.  This is my hope and dream for others.  

This trip is organized through my church, Crossroads Community Church, Cincinnati, OH.  

www.crossroads.net

If you can't contribute finacially you can still help!  Please share this and help me get to South Africa.  THANK YOU SO MUCH!

Fell free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Millennial Music Festival

On the heels of successful projects in 2012 and 2014, The Millennials chamber music series takes the leap into producing a mini-festival in 2015, featuring two world premieres, and exciting music by some of today's best young composers.

Fjóla Evans has composed a stunning new work for electric guitar and string quartet entitled "Orbital", which will be premiered on April 10, with an outstanding group of some of New York's top contemporary musicians. Reena Esmail's Hindi song cycle "Chuti Hui Jagah" (The Space Between) will also be presented in its premiere performance, on April 11, with mezzo-soprano Annie Rosen and guitarist Colin Davin. Hear Reena's music in the video above!

The remainder of the programs is a cross-section of the most exquisite chamber music of the 20th and 21st centuries. From John Luther Adams' evocation of the Alaskan wilderness, to Olivier Messiaen's powerful mysticism, the festival covers a wide spectrum of musical possibilities.

See: https://www.facebook.com/events/801151376644062/
https://www.facebook.com/events/513823245424422/

Where You Come In

We need your help to fund this festival! Generous support from the Augustine Foundation has given us a great opportunity to be more ambitious with our goals for the festival, and provides basic funding for the performer fees. That leaves us with the following costs:

  • Venue Rental: $1,200
  • Commissioning Fees: $700
  • Equipment, Transportation: $300
  • Printing, Marketing, Hospitality, and other Material Expenses: $700

There are some great perks on offer, including private performances, exclusive access to dress rehearsals before the concert, musical scores autographed by the composers and performers, and VIP reserved seating to one or both nights of the festival.

The Impact

The Millennial Music Festival is a grassroots operation, and we rely on every bit of support we can get from fellow artists, patrons of music and the arts, friends, and family. Your contribution, no matter the amount, goes directly toward the production of the festival and the creation of exciting, beautiful new music.

Beyond the need for financial support, we appreciate every effort you can make to share this campaign and news of our festival with your circles, so that we can have as many people involved. To have a community of support not only directly benefits our project, but creates a circle of creativity and artistic energy and a spirit of collaborative possibility.

Our past concerts have produced stunning world premieres and other new pieces, and reached sold-out audiences at our home venue, the Tenri Cultural Institute in Greenwich Village, NYC. We hope to expand that success with this year's festival, and bring even more music to the New York scene.

The Millennials are a fiscally-sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, which means that your contributions are legally tax-deductible as donation to a non-profit organization.

story:
icky romantic is raising money to fund her second EP, Decoded.

She started writing songs in college, and released Naked (her first EP) in 2011. After taking a hiatus to do life stuff, she's back in Cincinnati writing (and recording) music. 

Decoded is a big step up from icky romantic's debut.

Naked was a stripped down, bare bones project -- just icky romantic playing piano and singing her heart out. But Decoded will be the electronica/pop album that she's been dreaming of for the last four years. 

Right Hand Studios is helping icky romantic make her dream a reality.

icky romantic is teaming up with producer Ben Esposito at Right Hand Studios to craft the perfect sound for Decoded. 

And she's asking for $500 to help make it happen.

The total cost for the project is actually $1,099, which covers:

  • A studio deposit with Right Hand Studios
  • Two days of recording
  • Mixing and mastering
  • And Ben's production wizardry

icky romantic is halfway there, but she would really (really) appreciate any and all help her fans can give.

Also, any money raised beyond the $500 goal will fund future recording projects and production equipment. (The big dream is for icky romantic to hit the road next summer and bring Decoded and more to the people!)

Want to help, but also broke? 

No worries, you can help in other ways:

  • Share this campaign (Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, Tumblr, real-life conversations, etc.)
  • Share my music (links to my bandcamp and soundcloud)
  • Pray to the god/dess you hold dear
  • Rob a bank (but don't get caught, or be a dick about it)
  • Donate $1

THANK YOU FRIENDS <3

story:
Short Summary:

  • My name is Lana Linton, but I go by Lana Lenore when performing (Lenore is my grandmother's name). I am a twenty-four year old student and singer/songwriter based in Edmonton. Music has been my life since I was able to talk, and I am prepared to make anyone and everyone listen to me. 
  • This campaign is to help me raise money for my new EP, Misty Mountain. I will be working at the Root Cellar studios with Nich Davies as my producer. Unlike my last album, Misty Mountain will be short and sweet, feature live musicians and even collaborations with other talented musicians from the Edmonton area. Misty Mountain is a blues inspired album that will get your feet moving, and your heart thumping. 
  • If you choose the contribute to my album you will be helping me launch a potentially life changing career. I have finally found my home in blues music and I intend to push this as far as I possibly can. You will hear me on the radio, see me at live music venues and even festivals if I am so lucky. 

What I Need & What You Get:

  • I need $3000. $1300 of it will go towards the basic recording and mastering fees, $500 will go towards paying my musicians and last $1000 will go towards getting the album printed.
  • If you donate $20 or more you will get a free signed copy of Misty Mountain.
  • If I do not reach my goal of $3000, the money I do raise will go towards the recording and mastering fees first, then to my musicians. 

    Other Ways You Can Help:

    • If you can't contribute monetarily I would really appreciate it if you made some noise and shared this page with your friends! Let them know about my music and encourage them to contribute in any way they can!
story_txt:
Short Summary: 
My name is Lana Linton, but I go by Lana Lenore when performing (Lenore is my grandmother's name). I am a twenty-four year old student and singer/songwriter based in Edmonton. Music has been my life since I was able to talk, and I am prepared to make anyone and everyone listen to me.  This campaign is to help me raise money for my new EP, Misty Mountain. I will be working at the Root Cellar studios with Nich Davies as my producer. Unlike my last album, Misty Mountain will be short and sweet, feature live musicians and even collaborations with other talented musicians from the Edmonton area. Misty Mountain is a blues inspired album that will get your feet moving, and your heart thumping.  If you choose the contribute to my album you will be helping me launch a potentially life changing career. I have finally found my home in blues music and I intend to push this as far as I possibly can. You will hear me on the radio, see me at live music venues and even festivals if I am so lucky. 

  What I Need & What You Get: 
I need $3000. $1300 of it will go towards the basic recording and mastering fees, $500 will go towards paying my musicians and last $1000 will go towards getting the album printed. If you donate $20 or more you will get a free signed copy of Misty Mountain. If I do not reach my goal of $3000, the money I do raise will go towards the recording and mastering fees first, then to my musicians. 

  Other Ways You Can Help: If you can't contribute monetarily I would really appreciate it if you made some noise and shared this page with your friends! Let them know about my music and encourage them to contribute in any way they can!

story:
This campaign is for the sole purpose of  pre-ordering the new Domingo album "Sessions n Lessons". With 2015 being only a few days young we already get a taste of what the Brooklyn beatsmith and legendary producer Domingo has in store for hip hop on Feburary 17th, 2015. 

Domingo's new project "Sessions n Lessons" is actually a compilation of unreleased songs and beats he has produced over the years behind the boards from the 90's to the 2000's. The album boasts a lineup of some of hip hop's elite legends such as Kool G Rap, Krs-1, Rakim, Channel Live, and many more. 

The album will be available on Cd, Digitial USB, Digital Download.

T Shirt's and Commerative Plaques will also be available.

Here is a sneak peek at one of the songs from "Sessions n Lessons"

story:
Mesdames et monsieur 


C’est un honneur et une très grande joie de vous écrire dans le but est de réussir à vous convaincre de nous aider 


la raison dans la quelle nous avons décidée de se lancez dans indiegogo est que nous sommes une équipe d’étudient d’art constituée de deux Personne nous travaillons dans le domaine de la Bande dessinée et on a travaillé plus de trois ans jours et nuit un fanzine que nous avons essayé de le publier en vain sur internet et YouTube car personnes N’a voulu nous aider en raison que le travail n’était pas professionnel et on n’avait pas suffisamment de matériaux pour réaliser un travail professionnel. Nous avons envoyé aussi des annonces sur internet pour nous soutenir sur Facebook mais en vain 


Les pages en noir et blanc et la couverture sont bien travailler jours et nuits sans repos mais les résultats sont faibles a cause du manque de matériel et de l’absence de coin de travaille

Nos travaux étaient faits avec peu de matériel. Scannée les planches

Étaient difficile on n’avait pas de scanner pas de logiciel professionnel

On travaille tout ça chez nos maisons nos vielle maison

Nous nous travaillons dans des conditions inappropriées et nous poursuivant nos travaux jusqu’ a  2 heures ou 3 heures du soir

Supportant le froid et la fatigue même la douleur de nos bras et supportée les souffrances que le destin nous a fait subir

Nous avons travaillé avec soin tous les détails révisés les textes

Améliorée les dessins vérifier le tout et de vérifier encore.

Nous avons aussi veillé pour que les travaux soient propres et pas d’erreur. Notre but le plus chère est que notre fanzine soit publié 


Et que les jeunes gens voie et juge nos travaux si ils sont bien ou non

Nous voulions encore que notre fanzine devient un magazine professionnel franco marocain consacrée au adolescents et les jeunes

Adultes vendu au Maroc et en France.

Malheureusement cela est un peu impossible car le sou est notre seul problème on n’a pas le moindre centime et nous attentant de l’aide

  Je vous en supplie  vous êtes notre seul espoir

story:
Hello, my name is Olga Shevelevich. I am a private harp teacher, but this is not about me! It is about my student: Alisa Sadikova. She is a genius! I’m sure You will agree, by hearing these live recordings: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HwthpFLmN_8

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w444InnQT7A 

Other recordings of her, my other student and me can be found on my channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/harpvio 

Here is her shortened Artistic Biography:

Alisa Sadikova is the winner of the Award of 2012 of maestro Temirkanov, the scholar of fund of maestro Vladimir Spivakov, three times the winner of the International competitions. She was born on March 30, 2003 in St. Petersburg, Russia. Alisa is studying Harp with me.

February 2010 – the first award and the Grand Prix in the International Youthful Competition in New York, the USA.
On June 14, 2010 – participation in a concert of winners of the New York International competition in Carnegie Hall (Well Rectal Hall at Carnegie Hall), New York, the USA.
On May 8, 2011 – the first award in the International competition Musik Talente 2011 in Hahnstätten, Germany.
On May 17, 2011 – performance at the concert within the Moscow Meets Friends festival from Vladimir Spivakov's International Charity foundation, in Moscow, Russia.
On October 3, 2011 – performance on gala- concert "A gold harp" in the Big Hall of the St. Petersburg Academic Philharmonic Hall of D.D.Shostakovich, Russia.
On December 7, 2011 – performance at the stage of the Big Hall of the St. Petersburg Academic Philharmonic Hall by D.D.Shostakovich, Russia.
On December 9-14, 2011 – the first award and the Grand Prix (with delivery of "a big crystal star") at the III international festival competition "Light of a Christmas Star" in Helsinki, Finland.
On April 8, 2012 – theatrical and harp part of the Little Mermaid in A. S. Dargomyzhsky's opera "Rusalochka", Zazerkalye theater St. Petersburg (the Director: Chichilanova Olga, conductor: Honored performer of the Russian Federation A.M.Shteynlukht), Russia.
On May 20, 2012 – performance at the opening of the IX International festival "Moscow Meets Friends" in the Svetlanovsky hall of the Moscow International House of music with an orchestra " Moscow Virtuoses" (C-dur Mozart's concert for a harp and a flute with an orchestra, the conductor – V. Spivakov), Russia.
On May 25-27, 2012 – performance at the International festival in Hungary: International Harp Festival "Spring Harp Days" in Szeged, Hungary.
On November 11, 2012 – performance at the congress of Association of the European Conservatories (AEC) in the Big hall of A.G. Rubenstein of the St. Petersburg Conservatory of a named N. A. Rimsky-Korsakov, Russia.
On December 20, 2012 - performance and rewarding with the diploma of the winner of an award of maestro Yury Temirkanov at the concert of stipendiant of fund of maestro Temirkanov in the St. Petersburg Academic Philharmonic Hall of   D.D. Shostakovich, Russia.
Performance at the II festival "Days of the Russian Culture in Baden-Baden", within the Program of the Russian-German Year from April 25 to May 8, 2013.

Besides Alisa regularly has performances in Germany (Düsseldorf, Cologne, Limburg), at the Moscow festivals "Harp Art of Russia", and also on the stage of the Small Hall named of M. I. Glinka, of the St. Petersburg Academic Philharmonic Hall of D. D. Shostakovich, at the stage the St. Petersburg state conservatory (academy) named N. A. Rimsky-Korsakov, in the palace of grand duke Vladimir Aleksandrovich, at the stage of the White Hall of the St. Petersburg State Polytechnical University and others.

Now, she is invited to the 12th World Harp Congress in Sydney, Australia, which is an enormously important event in the life of any harpist. Alisa is the youngest harpist to perform solo with an orchestra in such a great event as the World Harp Congress ever. Yet, now her ability to participate in this event depends on Your help, since her parents do not have the money for it.

Here is a list of what Your money will be used for:

1. Flight tickets for Alisa and an accompanying person – Düsseldorf – Sydney:

3.000,00EUR (http://www.whcsydney2014.com/travel.html)

2. Registration Fees:

For Alisa – 410,00EUR and the accompanying person – 610,00EUR = Total 1.200,00EUR

( http://www.whcsydney2014.com/registration.html )

3. Hotel room for two persons for a week:

1.260,00EUR

( http://www.whcsydney2014.com/accommodation.html )

4. Visa for Alias and the accompanying person:

100,00EUR + 100,00EUR = 200,00EUR

( http://www.immi.gov.au/Visas/Pages/Find-a-visa.aspx?Purpose=Visit+Australia&Nationality=Russian+Federation&ApplyFrom=Germany&Age=41-45&Stay=Temporary&Length=Up+to+3+months&Family=All

5. Taxes, fees (Kickstarter and tax office)

548USD (10%) + (5480 - 548)/100*36 ≈ 2.320,00EUR

Total: 8.000EUR

Each dollar will help make her a worldwide harpist and doing so will bring the day, when she will play, in whichever part of the world You live, closer!

Thank You!

story:
My name is Linda Stroback-Hocking. For nearly 30 years, my husband, Bob Hocking and I have been the owner/manager/collectors of Zimmy’s Restaurant in Bob Dylan’s hometown of Hibbing, MN. In the course of our many years, as our collections of local Bob Dylan-related memorabilia have increased, we have become the unofficial Bob Dylan museum in our small town.

Earlier this year, Zimmy’s, like many small businesses in our area, was confronted with an unforeseen tax burden. Because our many attempts to set up a monthly payment plan were denied, we were forced to close on March 6th, 2014. With your help, we can resurrect our restaurant, and continue to serve as a home base for both our many loyal local customers and for those Dylan pilgrims around the world.

We always tried to make our restaurant more than a restaurant. In many ways, we were like a Bob Dylan welcome center. For the thousands of worldwide Dylan fans who came through our doors, we have provided a home base from which to explore the town of Hibbing, including, but not limited to, its Bob Dylan connection. We are rooted in celebrating and preserving the importance of the Iron Range and its influence on Bob’s work. Zimmy’s was a place where both locals and outsiders felt at home. We succeeded in creating an atmosphere where patrons could comfortably spend hours in conversation. We took pride in our menu, serving “exquisite local cuisine” and creating culinary events for our local patrons like special wine, beer and whiskey food pairing evenings. But, in many ways, our food and drink merely provided the means to keep people fueled for further conversation, camaraderie and connection.

For many years, our historic trolley station building on Howard Street has been the hub for the annual Dylan Days celebration in Hibbing. Hundreds of musicians, artists, and Dylan fans have performed on our stage and formed lifelong connections with both the town and the people they met at Zimmy’s. We have hosted local and touring musicians, exhibited and celebrated many local artists, and have even served as the stage for local theater productions.

Our extensive Dylan memorabilia collection, which we’d love to keep local, and our stories have been featured in countless books (including the official Bob Dylan Scrapbook), museum exhibits (including The Grammy Museum, The Experience Music Project, and the Weisman Art Museum), and films (including Martin Scorcese’s No Direction Home). We were deeply flattered when author Steven Heine called Zimmy’s “The Vatican of the church of Dylanology,”

We will need at least $200,000 to reopen Zimmy’s. This money will purchase the restaurant building and its contents, and will secure the Zimmy’s DBA name. Our perks are for both locals and those fans that want to be a part of this unique place, even if they will never make it to Hibbing. At the top end of the spectrum, they include a few historic, one-of-a-kind pieces of local, Dylan-related memorabilia.

If our goal is not reached, your contribution will go into the DylanDaysHibbing non-profit account that will support the annual Dylan Days celebration for years to come. In addition to prizes for songwriters and visual artists, we as “dylandayshibbing” non-profit are creating a B.J. Rolfzen scholarship for creative writing, in honor of Bob’s influential high school English teacher.

If we are the unofficial Bob Dylan museum of Hibbing, we are a living museum. In an increasingly fragmented society, even in small towns like ours, we need local places to connect, converse, and feel welcome. It could be said of many of our visitors that they came seeking Bob Dylan, but they ended up finding Hibbing. As a visitor in one of our many guest books put it: “So many people…so many memories, and only one place like Zimmy’s on Earth. Maybe it’s the atmosphere, the people, or a longing for days gone by, but this place feels like home.”

In 100 years, people will still be coming to Hibbing because of the Bob Dylan connection—there is no doubting that. The question is: will there be a place like Zimmy’s to welcome them? If you love Bob Dylan, Zimmy’s or Hibbing, please consider donating to our campaign.

story:
Welcome to The Whole Bolivian Army's "Siren" Campaign

By participating in our first-ever crowd-funding campaign, you can play an integral part in what for us is a momentous occasion:

Next year, 2013, will mark the 20th birthday of The Whole Bolivian Army, and “Siren” will be our tenth (!) album.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the skinny:

  • We need $2,000 to help us finish funding our album. A little over half of that ($1,100) will go toward CD duplication and digital distribution. The rest ($900) will go toward paying off part of our studio expenses (by the time we finish the album, we will have logged more than 90 studio hours at Elliott Bay Recording Co. in Seattle, WA).
  • We've put together several fun perks for anyone who wants to jump on board, including a CD delivered to your front door in time for Christmas, a DVD with videos of all nine songs, a thumb drive containing the entire TWBA catalogue (ten albums' worth of material), and VIP passes to the official "Siren" listening party in January.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we'll still allocate all raised sums to the expenses mentioned above while making good on every perk. Anything raised over our goal will go toward re-releasing “Amnesty,” our 1999 album, which is currently out of print. Other projects are in the offing, as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

If your budget is too tight to contribute at the moment, you can help in other important ways:

  • Spread the word about our campaign.
  • Share our music and videos with your friends on Facebook and elsewhere.
  • Visit us at a show in 2013.
  • Send us positive vibes.

Thank You

Thank you for listening to our music, for caring enough to get involved, and for supporting indie bands far and wide.

Cheers!

- Mary Beth, Matt, Greg, Roger, Dave, Brenda, and Dan

story:
What's up everybody! We're Megaphone Barons

Our DC-based rock band has had a lot of fun sharing our music with the world since forming in late 2009. We've played a ton of shows ranging from house parties, bars, clubs and music festivals, and we've released a CD and a music video, which have gotten us featured on international music blogs and into radio rotation. We were voted as Washington, DC/Baltimore's Artist of the month by readers of the Deli Magazine and radio station DC 101 named our song, "Soggy Ground," on their best of 2011 list. It's been non-stop and we are eternally grateful for all of your support to date! 

Immediately after independently releasing our debut album a year ago, we began writing and road-testing new music at our concerts. We now feel ready to create a second album. We're asking for your support to professionally record and release our new songs. This time in a real studio and with a professional engineer/producer. 

Help Us Escape from the Basement...And You Shall Be Rewarded

Our first album was entirely self-funded and recorded in a dark basement apartment near the National Zoo. With your assistance, our days of a sunless, subterranean existence will be numbered.

Our minimum target to be able to release the album is $3000 dollars. By helping us reach our goal, you're helping cover some of the costs of recording, mixing, mastering, duplicating, distributing and marketing our new album. However, we hope to exceed the minimum amount so we'll be able to get this release the attention it deserves by having a modest budget for marketing and touring, which will draw further attention to this release. With studio time running approximately $500 a day, it won't be cheap do it right. We have already re-invested thousands of dollars in band revenues and have funneled personal savings into equipment upgrades and vocal coaching to prepare for this moment. We need your help to close the funding gap.

Take a look at the list of cool stuff we're offering. In exchange for our artistic freedom, we'll reward you with sweet gifts and swag. Our offerings range from digital downloads of our new music to one-of-a-kind artwork by us.

Our projected release date is January 2013. But many of you who support the project will have access to downloads prior to that time. 

The Impact

After we were approached and offered unfavorable terms by an LA record label in late 2011, we realized that signing a non-artist-friendly recording contract was not our only option to receive start-up funding in today's music industry. Technology has made it possible to internationally distribute a professionally produced album as an independent artist while maintaining 100% artistic control and keeping a larger percent of revenues. YOU can contribute any amount that you're comfortable with and we will hansomely reward you for doing so. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Use your vocal cords and mutter the following words, "Megaphone Barons." Did anyone hear you? If not, repeat and increase volume until you get a response.  Please upload videos to youtube where you yell our band name during inappropriate times. Bonus points for doing it in weird contexts. Seriously, word of mouth is super important. Also, feel free to like us on facebook and share this by using Indiegogo's share tools in emails, on facebook, in twitter and other places within your sphere of influence on the interwebs.

Thanks so much for being a supporter of independent music at this very important time. 

 

Common questions:

I would LOVE to give this to a friend or family member as a gift. Can I gift an incentive?
YES! Spectacular idea. If you would like to support Megaphone Barons but want to give the reward to someone else as a gift, please go through the normal process of making a donation in your name. Then, when we reach out to you via e-mail to request additional information, please tell us who should receive the reward.

Can I increase my pledge once it has been made?
YES! Once you donate to the campaign, you may want to change your incentive reward to a different one, or simply increase your pledge amount. To do so, please sign onto Indiegogo as usual. On our campaign page, you can enter a new amount, or choose a new incentive!

Can I pledge for more than one incentive?
Absolutely! There is no limit to the amount you can pledge or number incentives you may receive ("limited" incentives excluded).

I'm too excited! How do I get started right now?
It's easy, and incredibly quick! Just click the "Contribute Now" button on this page and follow the steps. It should take you less than 2 minutes to complete the entire process.

story:
About Me

Hello! My name is Jared Richardson. I'm an emerging composer from Victoria, BC, and a recent graduate of Berklee College of Music (Boston, MA) with a Bachelor of Music degree in Electronic Production & Design. I have written over 100 pieces of music in a diverse range of genres, including pop, electronic, jazz, and works for concert band and orchestra. I am working towards establishing a dual-pronged career based in Los Angeles, both in pop songwriting/production and composing orchestral film scores.

Over the past 7 years I’ve composed many orchestral works, several of which have had performances by the Victoria Symphony and the Vancouver Symphony Orchestra. Two of my pieces have been performed at the Victoria Symphony Splash, an outdoor concert in Victoria's Inner Harbour that attracts audiences of 50,000 people annually – where I was honoured twice with the title of Victoria's only-ever "Splash Young Composer". 

After graduating from Berklee, I did an internship in Los Angeles with composer/orchestrator Timothy Williams (Guardians of the Galaxy, Watchmen, 300), assisting with the music for numerous film and television projects, and earning my first on-screen film credit as a Score Technical Engineer in the horror film Get Out (2017). Since then, I've returned home to beautiful Victoria, British Columbia for the time being, where I've been working on new music, and looking for further opportunities towards launching my career.

Please go here to listen to some of my original orchestra music: 
https://soundcloud.com/jaredrichardsonmusic/set...
 



What's Happening

I am lucky enough to be one of only 10 composers in the world invited to participate in the LA Film Conducting Intensive Summer Session in Rousse, Bulgaria from June 19-24.

This is a workshop designed for emerging film composers to refine their skills in conducting an orchestra, where I'll be studying with Conrad Pope (orchestrator for John Williams, Howard Shore, James Horner, and other great composers), and prolific LA-based conductor Angel Velez. I will be conducting the Rousse Philharmonic Orchestra each day of the workshop, culminating in a live public concert at the Rousse Opera House, where I will conduct the premiere of a new composition of my own!

This event is a very important step in my development as a musical artist. It will be an opportunity to further my skills as a conductor and gain insight from seasoned film industry professionals, and also a chance to network with fellow composers from around the world. Furthermore, I will receive with a live video recording of my original composition with the Rousse Philharmonic Orchestra that I can share with the public, which will allow me to showcase myself to the world as both a composer and conductor.
 

 

How you can help

This workshop will be an incredible and unique experience, but it is also expensive, and for this reason I am seeking financial assistance in order to make this happen. The breakdown of costs is as follows:

$1000 USD - Travel costs to and from Bulgaria.
$2000 USD - Workshop tuition, which also includes room and board.

I have many special rewards to offer to those who donate - please take a look at the list on the right-hand side of the page. Thank you for taking the time to look at my page, and I hope you will consider making a contribution towards this exciting journey! Any amount helps, even if it's small.

Sincerely,
Jared Richardson

NOTE: I am happy to accept donations to this campaign either online through Indiegogo, OR directly by cheque. (The latter is preferred if possible, as Indiegogo deducts a 5% fee from all donations that I receive.)

To find out more about me, visit my website and social media links:
Official site: http://jaredrichardsonmusic.com
Facebook: http://facebook.com/jaredrmusic
Instagram: http://instagram.com/jaredrichardsonmusic
SoundCloud: http://soundcloud.com/jaredrichardsonmusic
Twitter: http://twitter.com/jaredrmusic
YouTube: http://youtube.com/jaredrichardsonmusic

story:
~Your Support Can Help this Music Fly!~

In 2009 I released my "Roses" CD, and now all 1000 copies have found homes around the world. Since then, at concerts up and down the West Coast and in Hawaii, I have continued to receive and share more of this beautiful healing music.

I'm excited to announce that I've recorded a new CD,

and want to let you know how you can help get it out into eager hands...

The new CD has 11 previously-unrecorded songs, as well as re-makes of one or two resurrected tunes. We are very close to being done with the recording process, almost ready to begin mixing and mastering. We recently added in beautiful cello and violin tracks, crystal singing bowls, tablas, percussion, and rich harmonies. This collection of songs is really sweet and powerful.

The Significance of 432Hz~

An added dimension is that these songs have been recorded in the 432 Hz tuning, which reflects the golden mean and the Pythagorean/Fibonacci spiral (found throughout nature, including the cochlea spiral in our ear).
 
Atuning our instruments, voices & ears to the 432Hz frequency promotes positive energy and a deeper absorbtion of the music. This makes music recorded in 432Hz an exceptionally useful tool for delivering messages of peace & healing to our bodies and the world.

What the Funds are for~

I need $1600 to get through the last bit of mastering and the printing of the CD, ideally in time for my West Coast concert tour this August. Please contribute if you can! In addition to my deep gratitude and the satisfaction of giving wings to this music, you will be eligible for some sweet perks like a pre-release download, original artwork, or a signed copy of the new CD, fresh off the press. (See the sidebar for details.)
 
If I can raise more than that amount, it will go towards reprinting my "Roses" CD, now out of print. (That will take about another $1800.) At this point, every donation, of whatever amount, makes a real difference. 

Your Support Really Helps!~

You can also help in other ways, besides financial.  Please help to get the word out there to others who may be able to offer support! Consider sharing this project on your social networks. Pass it on and spread the love... <3
 
To listen to my music, visit www.alexasunshinerose.com/music. For more information, you can reach me alexa@alexasunshinerose.com.

Let's come together and get this CD of healing music out there!

E Ola! Let it live! And so it is!

In love and harmony,

          Alexa Sunshine Rose

PS. Stay tuned for special update videos with sample tunes from the new CD!

~Blessings to All!~

www.alexasunshinerose.com
