story:
??????? ???? Capital Control ??? ??????????? ??? ?????? ?????? ??? ???????. ???????? ?? ?????? ??? ????? ??? ?? ???????? ???? ??????? ???????? ??? ?? ???????? ??? email ?? ?? ???????? ??? ??? 2L8band(at)gmail.com ??? ?? ??????? ????? ??? ????? ???? ????????? ??? Indiegogo.

???????????: 5203-035021-325

Iban:GR8201722030005203035021325

BIC ???????? ????????: PIRBGRAA


Dear friends,

We are back! We are back with great news! For the world has finally ended! 

All our fears, all our worries have come true. The world we once knew is no more. You fail to see the good news in that? The good news are that we are still alive. And now it is a time of pure joy. It is time to celebrate. For we still have each other, we still have the passion, we still have the will. They destroyed the world but they failed to destroy our mutual consciousness and the thread that unites us all. It's time to rebuild. It's time to reestablish. It's time to form a new language. With new words. With new meanings.

This, friends, is our final and our one and only Answer. 

We are post human, we are calling to send this last message to YOU.

The future depends on that tiny bundle of energy you hide inside.

Join us

We are the good ones

The war is far from over

And we need you

- Introducing 2L8

Let us briefly talk about us.

2L8 have released four albums:

  • “Armed angels, frustrated youth, the art of self-deceit and music industry” (Poeta Negra / 2005), 
  • “He&She, Angry enough to keep loving in the Dark Ages” (Inner Ear / 2008), 
  • “New Battles, without honor and humanity” (No more happy music productions / 2011), 
  • "The Thread" (H Klosti) (No more happy music productions / 2013)

What is characteristic about 2L8 discography is the radical stylistic shift between albums. This is the main reason why our music is hard to place in one firm category. It is post rock, post punk, new age, pop, rock, avant garde and at the same time nothing like that. Our music can always be found in our Bandcamp page.

- Past crowdfunding experience

"New Battles, without honor and humanity" was the first crowdfunded album in Greece! Our longing for free expression, distribution of ideas, lead us to turn, for our last two albums to crowdfunding. A move that was bound to show us if our music is needed. Your feedback and the result justified us both times. Old friends and new, funded us, of course in the extent and amount each was able to offer. And we did it! We managed to retain the rights to our music, to have the final say on how to share it with the world. 

- New album / New venture

"The Answer" gives a closure to 2L8 discography and to our heroes found in all previous albums. To our couple from He & She, to all the nameless faces, to all the frustrated poets, to all the misfits and those who craved life and freedom, all those who would fight to protect their loved ones, to all those who saw a collapsing world and decided to resist. We've been singing the same album with different words for so long now. It was about time we did something different and allow ourselves and all our heroes to rest.

"The Answer"  will be digitally released on March 1st. We are raising money to have a digipak CD release that will be printed in a local manufacturer. The money will also be used in making t-shirts, printing posters, stickers, and postal expenses of promo material. As you probably realize the goal we've set won't cover all these expenses, but we had to set a realistic target. For our basic funding always has been the Greek community and now Greece lies in ruins. We are well aware of the harsh reality, this is what we sing about, and this is why we understand the importance of your help, and we thank anyone who decides to step up and answer our call.

Is the last 2L8 chapter to have a physical form?

That depends on you

- Call to action

We know that some of you would love to but are not able to contribute. Spreading this page is equally important to us. Talk to your friends about this effort, share this on your social pages.

Peace and love to all

2L8

story:
Thank Your for checking out Adir L.C.'s crowd-FUNding campaign!

Hello to all my friends and family, people I've met traveling or on tour, and fellow musicians that have inspired me along the way - I want to thank you all first and foremost for getting me here... AND hello to all of you out there who I have yet to meet - you can read about me at the bottom. 
My name is Adir and I just finished the process of recording the album I have always wanted to make. I have covered all expenses so far, I just need a bit of a push forward from all of you to get it out into the world! (LISTEN TO SAMPLES OF THE ALBUM BELOW!!!)

ANY SIZE CONTRIBUTION HELPS!!! Big or small, it will make a legitimate difference on many levels. PLUS, YOU'RE GETTING SOMETHING IN RETURN! I've thought about some really cool rewards to offer to all who contribute, so please make sure to scroll down the right side of the screen and see whats on that exciting little list of goodies! 

I want you all to be a part of the process of releasing this album with me. All the work has been done, it now just needs to be brought to life. 
***Remember, every single one of you is just as important as any musician on this record, my producer or even myself when it comes to the actualization of this project. So come join me! ***


WHERE IS THE MONEY RAISED GOING?

[BREAKDOWN OF COST in $USD]

Press the album to Vinyl and CD: ≈ $3,500

Finish paying production costs: $3,000

PR Campaign in the US, Europe & Israel: ≈ $5,000 (if not more) for three quality PR companies, or one good international campaign. 

[PR includes getting songs reviewed on blogs/magazines/other major publications, played on the radio, getting attention of labels and bringing the record to be sold at a store near you! I will focus on one PR campaign if need be, depending on how much funds are raised.]

---------------------------------------------

Here is a list of what I've paid off on my own so far, as well as current expenses related to the project: 

Producer's Salary // Studio Time // Mixing // Mastering : $6,000 
Musician's Salary - Total pay to all musicians on my album:$1,150 
Music Video (out next month)= $1200 
Stickers I got printed to tag around and start promoting: $110 
Rehearsal Space in the city to practice with my band, now starting to perform in order to promote the album: ≈ $160 a month 


photo by Mel Bergman (bergmanmel.com/photography)

REACHING MY TARGET: As you can see, I made my target goal significantly less than what I actually need for optimal conditions. That is because making this the best release possible is still MY responsibility, and I do not feel comfortable asking all of you fine people for too much. I plan to continue working my butt off to accomplish everything that needs to get done to put this out right. Your generosity is an ENORMOUS push forward, both financially and emotionally....

CLEARLY, any money raised beyond the target goal will directly fund this project - paying off remaining expenses, making sure to get the best PR, pressing in additional mediums, going on tour, etc… there is no end.

[STICKERS! This is the Buffalo Monster by Goni Sondak (see rewards)]

THIS ALBUM - "Oceanside Cities" 
Aptly named, this album describes leaving home and moving to an oceanside city (be it New York City, Los Angeles, Tel Aviv, etc), as many young adults do to find their path or pursue their dreams. I was lucky enough to find the perfect place to invest my energy, money and music to make this record come to life - right in the middle of the Florentine neighborhood, minutes from the Mediterranean sea. [see bottom, under "About Me"]

With an amazingly talented young producer and some of the best musicians around we created something beyond what I could have ever imagined. It's a fresh and interesting record, filled with dozens of different instruments and fueled by countless days and nights of hard work. 

(CHECK OUT this sample of SONGS off the album!)


BE A PART OF RELEASING "OCEANSIDE CITIES"!!! 
So far, I've been able to get along on my own - NOW, the time has come when I really need your help! Between working endlessly at various day and night jobs, I have been able to cover most of this project. Finishing it right and getting it out there is now the next step.

Over the past year I have dedicated every day to this project, investing everything I can to make it happen. And so, I need this record to be released properly! While I have been selling CDs at shows and putting free music on the internet for several years now, I need to make this particular work different. I don't want to put this music out the same way I have in the past, and limiting it to specific circles. I want to do it right. I want to press it in various mediums, fund a PR campaign to promote the songs, and enable them to reach countless more people. I want to produce awesome music videos to share with the world in correlation with the release of this album (we are about to finish one!). Most importantly - I want to do it INDEPENDENTLY.


(shooting the music video for the song 'Dinosaurs')

Risks and Challenges:

Every major project faces potential obstacles. One obstacle this project faces is time. Because these songs need to be released at the right time with the right kind of PR, release dates of singles and the album as a whole might change slightly over the course of the coming months.

Production of vinyl also takes more time than producing the rest of the rewards/merchandise (16 weeks from the time the order is put through), and so some packages may arrive later than others. 

Nonetheless, I can guarantee that all donors will be updated regularly and rewards will be received.

Other Ways To Help
SHARE THIS INDIE-GOGO CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY! SPREAD THE WORD ABOUT MY TUNES, BOTH ONLINE AND OFF!
COME SHOW YOUR SUPPORT AT A PERFORMANCE NEAR YOU!


ABOUT ME:
     I was fortunate enough to grow up in a musical household in north Jersey, in a little town blessed with a really kickass music scene and instant access to New York City. In the last ten or so years I have had the tremendous pleasure to play, record and tour with all kinds of talented and creative people, many of which have influenced me forever.
     My last full length album was released with my old band under the name Fairweather Friends. Our album, "These Years on the Boat" was recorded in New Paltz, NY during my senior year of college, in the house I shared with my drummer, Jed Kosiner. It featured many different friends on various instruments and was put out by our buddies at Salvation Recording Co., where I moved to live during the time of the release. After touring with the band I began traveling and recording a bit on my own, releasing music as Adir L.C. It was around this time I found myself spending more and more time in Israel, the land in which I was born.
     After many shows in Tel Aviv, spending time with family and making many new friends, I felt very inspired. And so I decided that it was there I would invest my time and money to record my first real studio album under my given name.
story_txt:
Thank Your for checking out Adir L.C.'s crowd-FUNding campaign!


Hello to all my friends and family, people I've met traveling or on tour, and fellow musicians that have inspired me along the way - I want to thank you all first and foremost for getting me here... AND hello to all of you out there who I have yet to meet - you can read about me at the bottom. My name is Adir and I just finished the process of recording the album I have always wanted to make. I have covered all expenses so far, I just need a bit of a push forward from all of you to get it out into the world! (LISTEN TO SAMPLES OF THE ALBUM BELOW!!!)
ANY SIZE CONTRIBUTION HELPS!!! Big or small, it will make a legitimate difference on many levels. PLUS, YOU'RE GETTING SOMETHING IN RETURN! I've thought about some really cool rewards to offer to all who contribute, so please make sure to scroll down the right side of the screen and see whats on that exciting little list of goodies! 
I want you all to be a part of the process of releasing this album with me. All the work has been done, it now just needs to be brought to life. ***Remember, every single one of you is just as important as any musician on this record, my producer or even myself when it comes to the actualization of this project. So come join me! ***


WHERE IS THE MONEY RAISED GOING?[BREAKDOWN OF COST in $USD]Press the album to Vinyl and CD: ≈ $3,500
Finish paying production costs: $3,000
PR Campaign in the US, Europe & Israel: ≈ $5,000 (if not more) for three quality PR companies, or one good international campaign. 
[PR includes getting songs reviewed on blogs/magazines/other major publications, played on the radio, getting attention of labels and bringing the record to be sold at a store near you! I will focus on one PR campaign if need be, depending on how much funds are raised.]
---------------------------------------------
Here is a list of what I've paid off on my own so far, as well as current expenses related to the project: 
Producer's Salary // Studio Time // Mixing // Mastering : $6,000 Musician's Salary - Total pay to all musicians on my album:$1,150 Music Video (out next month)= $1200 Stickers I got printed to tag around and start promoting: $110 Rehearsal Space in the city to practice with my band, now starting to perform in order to promote the album: ≈ $160 a month 
photo by Mel Bergman (bergmanmel.com/photography)

story:
Celebrating the Many Friends of Donna Summer…

Mary Gaines Bernard was born and raised in Boston, Massachusetts, where she grew up in an extremely musically talented family. At the age 20 Mary moved to Los Angeles where she joined her sister Donna Summer to begin what became her 35 year career as a background vocalist.

Performing all over the world they recorded with various artists such as Quincy Jones, Michael Omartian, Rod Stewart, Olivia Newton John, performed on many television shows, and performed for the Grammy Awards and Academy Awards.  Donna’s music is still very alive and currently featured in the box office sensation “The Martian”.

 

In celebration of Donna, the show “Donna Summer – Once Upon A Time – An Intimate Musical Journey” will launch New Year’s Eve 2015 at the Crest Theatre in Delray Beach! Mary and her band will celebrate and honor Donna on her birthday while taking you on 'An Intimate Musical Journey' of her life, her music and the joy that she left for us all.

You can dance if you want to dance, sing if you want to sing, you can dress in a tuxedo, wear your blue jeans or your best disco dress and maybe even sporting an Afro wig. So unbutton that collar and put on your dancing shoes because we’ll be singing all of your favorite songs right into the New Year!  

Come join us as we make some new memories together!

story:
About Me

Hi, I'm recording artist L. Young.  I've released 4 full length albums to date as a solo artist with a top 20 Billboard Urban AC charts single. I've performed on just about every stage and venue here in the greater Los Angeles area where I'm based, including arenas as big as Nokia Center and Hollywood Bowl, to clubs as small as the House of Blues and Key Club, but the one thing I've yet to do is .... wait for it....TOUR!


Since my several harmony videos have gone viral the demand for me to put on a national tour has skyrocketed. I can't begin to tell you how many messages and comments I receive daily via social media requesting my show in cities like  New Orleans and Dallas to countries like Brazil, Germany and the UK. But as we all know it costs money to tour. A lot of money for an Indie artist like myself with no major financial backing.

That's where you come in. You are my support, my back and my front. Real fans, family and friends. This is a new day. No longer does commercial radio, shady promoters and TV dictate the worth of an artist. Their audience does. I happen to believe I have the most supportive fans ever. My fans are everything to me. There is no me without them.


What We Need

We need money for tour support. That includes a bevy of costs like travel expenses, paying the backing band, gear transport/rental, merchandising costs, food and lodging, and targeted promotion in each city.


We've also set up a lot of perks in return for your contributions. So, you will be rewarded for your giving. 

    The Impact

    Newsflash, I don't need someone to discover me, sign me, take me on tour, etc... All I need is you and your support. Indie rock bands, and Rap artist have had major success with fan support. R&B or "urban music" is traditionally supported by big labels and/or some other form of major financial backing. It's not normally as grass roots as other genres such as Rap. This is your way to get involved directly with my career on the ground floor. This campaign could potentially change the game for not only me, but other artists who are still trying to keep R&B alive, and the fans who are ready to support good music.  Besides, the cost to tour with just a mic and an mp3 player/DJ, or a band that's an actual band and not hired musicians is a lot cheaper than your typical R&B act. And a good band can tour all year long simply off the strength of their live show and online presence despite having no songs on the radio. Well, Why can't I? I have hardcore fans who love me. I actually have records on the radio, too. What's holding me back? Clueless promoters and lack of money? With fans like mine I say nothing!

      Challenges

      Just like with any great task there will be challenges to pulling this off. But the money is the major hurdle. I have a great team working with me with over 50 years of combined experience and valued relationships in this industry to make sure this tour and album come together without a hitch. And if you've ever been to any of my shows or bought any of my music you know the level of quality and professionalism I bring. I have no doubt if we raise or exceed our goal we will be successful. And if for some reason we fall short of the goal, well... You know what? That's not gonna happen. I believe in you and I absolutely believe in me. Together we will do this.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Every penny counts! Just keep in mind if everyone does a little then no one has to do a lot. I have almost 200k fans on FB alone. If everyone gave just $1... well, you do the math. Also, you can help immensely by simply sharing this campaign and my music/videos with your friends. Someone else may be in a better position to take this opportunity at this time. SPREAD THE WORD! Use the share tools provided by IndieGoGo or share on Facebook, Twitter, email or just tell somebody. That sometimes is worth more than any single monetary contribution.

story:
============================================================ If you have trouble with, or don't want to pay with Paypal, please contact us, and we will find a solution so that you can participate too! ============================================================

Update. We started a website for the project: http://tenderbuttons.nl

Help us to perform STEIN, a show based on the work of this famous writer.

You know Gertrude Stein, the great American writer, don’t you? Not only did she write “Rose is a rose is a rose is a rose” but many more beautiful, poetic lines. What about this, written 100 years ago:

"Elephant beaten with candy and little pops and chews all bolts and reckless reckless rats, this is this."

And:

"A little monkey goes like a donkey that means to say that means to say that more sighs last goes. Leave with it. A little monkey goes like a donkey."

These texts may sound a little cryptic, and yes, they are! Those texts are meant to have no meaning. They concentrate on the beauty of the poem itself and its construction, similar to a cubist or an abstract painting. Stein composes with words.
To us, these texts demand to be sung, to be put to music. And that is exactly what we are going to do.

That is what we need your help!

Who we are

We are the POW Ensemble, a new music group from The Netherlands. We have an open-minded view regarding what contemporary music is. In our 13 years of existence we have been influenced by collaboration with performers from very different backgrounds: jazz and rock musicians, tap dancers, writers, DJ's, classical virtuosi, and experimental electronic composers.

In our new program, STEIN, we pay homage to the great writer Gertrude Stein. We play songs based on the texts from her book Tender Buttons, delicately set to music by composer Luc Houtkamp. For a first sample from the production, watch our video clip!

We are: singer/keyboard player Stephanie Pan, tap dancer Peter Kuit, tuba player Axel Schappert and Luc Houtkamp on saxes, live electronics and computer.

What do we want?

We want to raise 3000 euro for a special promotion concert of STEIN for invited guests: sponsors, crowdfunders (you!), journalists, organizers, and other invited guests. It allows us to give that performance a festive spirit and, besides the usual crowd of people loving our music, attracts a broader audience, and generate interest from organizers, concert promoters and the press – resulting in many more concerts. A thrilling promotion concert gives the program an excellent head start!

The general costs for preparations, rehearsals, acquisition and general publicity will be obtained by grants and additional subsidies. With your money we will be able to pay the musicians and technician for their work, create extra publicity for the event and festive theatre props for the concert, and provide refreshments for the guests.

The promotion concert will take place on September 10, 2015 in Studio LOOS in Den haag, The Netherlands. We start preparations and rehearsals in the beginning of next year.

What we’re going to do with the money

Here is the budget (in Euros):

Fees (musicians and technician) 1500
Travel costs  200
Rent of venue  250

Publicity material   800
Festive spirits  250 (drinks and finger food, decoration of the venue)

Total   3000 euro

What do you get from us in return?

We are deeply grateful for your support, and have something to offer each one of you, depending on the amount you donate, from digital downloads, free ticket for the show, to house concerts. To make life easy we have created several bundles to choose from, depending on the amount of money that you would like to invest in us.

Update: for 250,- you receive a unique strip drawing by Gabriel Kousbroek, signed by the artist himself. See picture above.

Other ways you can help

We acknowledge that not everyone who loves great music and literature and wishes to support this project can contribute money to it. It doesn't mean you can't help us. Regardless of your monetary contribution, please:

Show this page to your friends, colleagues, and family. Suggest people to join our mailing list at our our website

Share this page on social media or via email using the Indiegogo share tools, or simply share the link through facebook or twitter!

story:
This August 15-16, live, at Don't Tell Mama's NYC, Jake Mendes is about to put some serious soul into the atmosphere! Don't miss out!

It was a tough choice when deciding the title of this upcoming concert. There were a few top contenders:

Too Much Soul For His Own Good - An Evening with Jake Mendes

Once More, With Soul - An Evening with Jake Mendes

White Boy Who Likes To Sing Black Girl Songs - An Evening with Jake Mendes

Ultimately, we decided the simpler, the better. Not only because I didn't want to be too ridiculous or offend anybody, but I just wanted to get this plain ol' message across: I wanna sing, and I want you to enjoy it.

The concert back in 2012 with Rhianna Pfannensteil was wildly successful, so I wanted to team back up with musical genius Vince DiMura (Anna moved to LA) and put together something ridiculously enjoyable for you. So please, help me make this concert as ridiculous and full of soul/ sass/ black girl songs as it can be. No contribution is too small, and girl... no contribution is too large. I love you all beyond words and can't wait to sing for you.

Risks and challenges

As an artist, we are constantly faced with the challenge of - 'Where's the next project coming from?'

Well, I'm taking that into my own hands, and creating the opportunity myself. But it's much easier said than done. There are many responsibilities looking me in the face, as I'm acting as a producer and performer in the creative process. Things like publicity, booking performance spaces, booking rehearsal spaces, selling tickets, hiring musicians and backup singers (yes, I'm gonna have backup singers, duh)... these are all challenges that I will hit head on in order to put up a stellar concert.

But I can't do it without your help and support. So Thank you for your time and you contribution. I'm greatly looking forward to sharing this project with you, and hopefully continuing on to more venues in the future!

Don't miss out!It was a tough choice when deciding the title of this upcoming concert. There were a few top contenders:Too Much Soul For His Own Good - An Evening with Jake MendesOnce More, With Soul - An Evening with Jake MendesWhite Boy Who Likes To Sing Black Girl Songs - An Evening with Jake MendesUltimately, we decided the simpler, the better. Not only because I didn't want to be too ridiculous or offend anybody, but I just wanted to get this plain ol' message across: I wanna sing, and I want you to enjoy it.The concert back in 2012 with Rhianna Pfannensteil was wildly successful, so I wanted to team back up with musical genius Vince DiMura (Anna moved to LA) and put together something ridiculously enjoyable for you. So please, help me make this concert as ridiculous and full of soul/ sass/ black girl songs as it can be. No contribution is too small, and girl... no contribution is too large. I love you all beyond words and can't wait to sing for you.Risks and challengesAs an artist, we are constantly faced with the challenge of - 'Where's the next project coming from?'Well, I'm taking that into my own hands, and creating the opportunity myself. But it's much easier said than done. There are many responsibilities looking me in the face, as I'm acting as a producer and performer in the creative process. Things like publicity, booking performance spaces, booking rehearsal spaces, selling tickets, hiring musicians and backup singers (yes, I'm gonna have backup singers, duh)... these are all challenges that I will hit head on in order to put up a stellar concert.But I can't do it without your help and support. So Thank you for your time and you contribution. I'm greatly looking forward to sharing this project with you, and hopefully continuing on to more venues in the future!

story:
Short Summary

I’m Caleb Minter, from a small town in West Tennessee named Bolivar. After obtaining my college degree I decided to make my home Atlanta, Georgia so I could continue to pursue my music dreams. I’m an Independent R&B/Soul Artist Singer/Songwriter and I’ve been singing most of my life. Guess what, I’m actually pretty good at it lol. Singing is my PASSION and it fuels my heart. I love listening to meaningful music that soothes the soul and that is the same type of music that I have a PASSION for writing and singing.  I recently lost my older brother to gun violence. This loss has only reassured me that my voice must be heard, not just for my musical talents but to bring awareness to gun violence through my Stop The Violence "M.A.G.N.U.M." (Men.Against.Gun.violeNce.Unity.Movement).

What We Need & What You Get

As most of you know I CAN”T DO THIS ALONE!!!! I NEED YOUR HELP!!!! So please PARTNER with me and be a part of “OUR” FIRST ALBUM RELEASE and “OUR” Stop The Violence "M.A.G.N.U.M."  Movement!! With “OUR” first album release, there are A LOT OF COST!!!! You ask, What cost Caleb? I’m GLAD you asked!!! To release a “QUALITY” project you MUST have QUALITY in EVERYONE that plays a VALUABLE role in “OUR” upcoming ALBUM RELEASE and making it come to life!

That means …..

Studio Time with Pre & Post Production

Mixing & Mastering

Merchandise

Marketing & Promotions Campaign/Press Release

Music Video & Photos

Order ANY “PERK” within the FIRST 10 days of “US” launching the campaign and you will receive a “FREE” download “ of my bonus track “Stop The Violence "M.A.G.N.U.M." Movement Single on the RELEASE DATE!

The Impact

This is one of the hardest things I've ever written in my life. I wouldn't have thought in a million years at the age of 24 I would be burying my only biological brother Clarence Minter Jr. He was just weeks away from reaching his 26th birthday. My family and I are devastated at the tragedy. Clarence passed the 19th of December from a gunshot wound to the neck and chest. He was one heck of a guy; funny, respectful, and a great father to his three year old daughter who will never see "daddy" again because of the coward who pulled the trigger. Therefore, I'm stepping in to ensure that my niece's college fund and needs are met with the loss of my brother. 

Our parents only had two boys Clarence was the drawer/mechanic and I'm an upcoming Independent Artist that pushes daily to share my gift to the world! As my life changed indefinitely my platform through music unfolded right before my eyes. Hopefully this will grant me a larger stage to use my voice to bring awareness to gun violence and the need for world peace through the Stop The Violence "M.A.G.N.U.M."  Movement!

Risks & Challenges

The risk of us not reaching "our" goal will be a MAJOR setback BUT, it will not stop us from moving forward with releasing the first album at some point or pushing forward with the Stop The Violence M.A.G.N.U.M. Movement. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know everyone may not be able to give monetarily but you can help by sharing the link on your Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram and telling everyone you know to HELP spread the word and remember NO DONATION IS TO SMALL.

story:
Karianne Jean has been working hard writing & recording new music for her adored fans, "genies". Her dream is to attend CMA MUSIC FEST 2015 where she will get to perform & sign autographs for current fans while making new fans as well! CMA FEST is a unique & invaluable opportunity to showcase all she has been working so hard on & reach thousands of new fans, as well as industry heavy weights. Contribute what you can & Let's make 2015 the year that GENIES took off!

Your contribution will be put toward funding production representation which includes; passes, performance spots, guitar accompaniment, autograph signing/picture taking booth time, etc.

"CMA FEST is incredibly exclusive & finding a team willing & able to help me get my foot in the door was a dream in itself but it does require funds & that is where you come in!  It means the world to me that you would consider selflessly giving to my dream!  Thank you so much for your consideration!" --Karianne Jean

story:
Vive Le NuFunk

We’re God Made ME Funky, Canada’s premier NuFunk band and we’re making a new album called ‘Vive Le NuFunk’! We’re a culturally and musically diverse independent outfit from Toronto known for getting people moving and grooving to our funky sound. This will be our fifth and undoubtedly our best album to date! We’ve been writing Vive Le NuFunk for the last year and now we’re ready to make it come to life. We currently need to raise at least $5000 or more to complete mixing and mastering. And that’s where we could use your help!!

As an independent band we’ve always forged our own way and made the music we’ve wanted to make. We’ve been able to play for, and party with, countless people over the last decade and we want to make that party continue. By pre-ordering you can help us on our musical journey and get some pretty cool stuff for yourself too! Your contribution will help cover a portion of our costs for this album, on top of what we’ve raised ourselves. Any money raised above $5000 will go into additional album promotion.

We are really excited about this pre-ordering process and we’ve thought long and hard about the rewards we’re offering. We’ve got some really cool bundles, exclusive pre-order only custom T-shirts designed by PHATT al, some rare one of a kind GMMF memorabilia, and even a private VIP party for you and 20 of your closest friends!

So Thanks so much in advance for checking out and supporting our new project!! And please spread the word to all of your peop’s by sharing this IndieGoGo page link:

  http://www.indiegogo.com/GodMadeMeFunky1

God Made ME Funky is back in town and ready to get down! See you soon!!

story:
The Calgary Flamenco Festival Needs Your Support!

An annual festival, just in its 3rd year, the festival is the flamenco event of the year in Calgary. Unique and multi-faceted, The Flamenco festival is both a dance and music festival. Artists from across Canada, from as far as Nova Scotia and Spain join to create and collaborate and this year features the breathtaking dancer from Madrid, Olga Pericet.

We bring in the very best of Flamenco and we need your help to make it happen!

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $8,000 to defray the extensive cost of bringing in our 6 international performers for the Festival. A flight alone from Madrid costs $1,500.

  • We encourage you to help by SPONSORING AN ARTIST. $1,500 gets you linked to a specific artist as their sponsor, you will be specifically thanked in the Festival programs.

To thank you for your contribution we are offering:

Complimentary tickets, backstage passes, signed postcards, downloadable exclusive images, Special live recordings, Cd's, Flamenco Society memberships and behind the scenes activities with the artists. As well we thank you with flamenco classes, gift certificates, private concerts and more  - all redeemable within a year of the Festival.

Be a Part of the Effort

Your contribution goes towards helping this vibrant Festival be a success and specifically brings to the stage in Calgary one of the most sought after Flamenco Acts in the world. The festival is a huge undertaking. We are currently running the festival primarily on ticket sales and we need significant additional support. All contributions big or small are welcome. 

About the Festival

The 2013 Festival features the Flamenco star from Madrid, Olga Pericet and her company of guitarist Antonia Jimenez and singer Miguel Ortega. Also from Spain are guitarist Liron Man, singer Juan Murube and multi-instrumentalist Simone Mor.

A week-long celebration of Flamenco with diverse performance and learning opportunities, the festival also includes:

  • 4 total concert events including 2 main concerts with International ensembles at the beautiful 500-seat theatre facility: The Webber Academy Performing Arts Centre
  • free community events: noon-hour concert & introductory adult workshop
  • artistic collaborations: the Flamenco Showcase, where local dancers and musicians create alongside International guest artists
  • workshops in all flamenco disciplines from percussion, to dance, to guitar, to singing!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don’t have any funds to contribute, we are grateful for the many other ways you can help! Spreading the word, sharing the link for our campaign with family, friends or co-workers would be very much appreciated.Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN!
THANK YOU FOR HELPING THE 2013 CALGARY INTERNATIONAL FLAMENCO FESTIVAL BE A SUCCESS!

story:
(french follow)

My Story 

Hi, my name is Ariane Morin, and I am a  saxophonist specialize in world music based in Montreal, Quebec. 

I have been passionate about the music of Turkey and the Balkans for many years, and have been studying and playing this music, studying with masters such as Christian Dawid, the clarinettist and saxophonist of Konsonans Retro, and members of the Other Europeans.

Over the past year, i have been working with my group, Massapan, a Balkan Jazz trio.  on interpreting songs of the region, our first album was release last June, as well as playing in a duo of Balkan and Turkish music and now hope to visit the region to perfect my playing in this style

Istanbul is a historical, modern and multicultural city between Europe and Middle-East. During the time of the Ottoman empire, the oriental music influenced the traditionnal Balkan music. By exemple: irregular rythms as 7/8, 9/8, 11/8.ect and also differents arabic scales such as Hicaz. That's why it is natural for me to go at the source in this city full of amazing musicians masters of traditionnal music. 

I have been in touch with Richard Laniepce, a player and teacher that I have admired, who has mastered the style of Turkish music on my instrument the saxophone with the well-known band Kolektif Istanbul, and as a bonus, is French!  He has agreed to teach me if only I'm able to make it to Istanbul!

And this is where I turn to you, the community for support! I plan to go two months in Istanbul as a resident to have time to learning the culture. I have been working hard to put money aside in order to go pursue my passion and learn at the feet of masters, and develop an authenticity of style, but the costs of travel, lodging and lessons including with other teachers there – are still just out of reach.

I have many great projects for my return, including developing a new repertoire with Massapan, create new creative projects with amazing musicians here on my return and recording a new full length album in the near future – and will be eternally grateful to friends, family and strangers who wish to support me in pursuing my dreams!

 

If the goal is not reach, i'm going in Turkey anyway! It's a flexible goal, with Indigogo i can collect every little or great amounts will be more than welcome to help my journey to be the best. The money will be used primarily to pay for various private lessons and travel to get there and other activities related to my learning and development in Istanbul.

Also, to show my gratitude, there some differents bonus prices depending the amount you give. Mostly connect with my band Massapan, a balkan/jazz trio, because this is a personnal project who will benefits the most from my learning when i'll come back.  But there also some other special prices like a Turkish homemade dinner... Check on the right side!

Spread the word to family and friends! Tessekur eder'im!

.======================================

À Propos

Bonjour, je m'appelle Ariane Morin, je suis une saxophoniste spécialisée en musique du monde établie à Montréal, Québec.

Je suis passionnée par la musique Turque et des Balkans depuis plusieurs années. J'ai joué et étudier ce style auprès de grand musicien tel que Christian Dawid, le clarinettiste et saxophoniste de Konsonans Retro et membre de The Others Europeans. 

Durant la dernière année, j'ai travaillé avec mon groupe Massapan, un trio Balkan Jazz en interprétant des chansons de ces régions. Notre premier album a été lancée en Juin dernier au Ghetto Shul lors du Festival de Jazz de Montréal. Je joue également dans un duo de musique traditionnelle des Balkans. Et maintenant je souhaite aller dans cette région afin de perfectionner dans ce style.

 
J'ai été en contact avec Richard Laniepce, un musicien que j'admire qui a innové la musique Turque sur mon instrument, le saxophone, avec le groupe bien connu Kolektif Istanbul. Et en plus, il est français! Il a accepté de m'apprendre si je réussi à aller à Istanbul!
 
 
Istanbul est une ville historique, moderne et multiculturelle située entre l'Europe et le Moyen-Orient. Durant la période de l'empire Ottoman, la musique orientale a été une forte influence pour la musique des Balkans. Par exemple: les rythmes irréguliers tels que 7/8, 9/8, 11/8.ect ainsi que différentes gammes arabes comme Hicaz. C'est pourquoi il est naturel pour moi d'aller à la source dans cette ville remplie d'incroyables musiciens maître en musique traditionnelle!

 

Et c'est là que je me retourne vers vous! La communauté pour me supporter! Je prévois aller deux mois à Istanbul pour bien m'impregner de la culture. J'ai travailler fort pour mettre de l'argent de côté afin de suivre ma passion et d'apprendre au pied de grands musiciens et développer mon style authentique. Mais l'argent pour le voyage, logement ainsi que des cours avec différents professeurs là bas reste encore à trouver!


 
J'ai beaucoup de grand projets pour mon retour, entre autre développer un nouveau répertoire avec Massapan, enregistrer un album complet dans le future, différentes collaborations avec les talentueux musiciens d'ici et ma gratitude éternelle pour amis, famille et étrangers qui supporter pour réaliser mes rêves!

Si l'objectif n'est pas atteint, je vais en Turquie quand même! C'est un objectif flexible, indigogo me permet de collecter les contributions petites ou grandè à la fin du délai et aideront à rendre mon séjour musical que plus profitable. L'argent sera utilisé surtout pour payer les différents cours privés ainsi que les déplacement pour s'y rendre ainsi que d'autres activités connexe à mon apprentissage et mon perfectionnement à Istanbul.

Aussi, pour démontrer ma gratitude, il y a différents prix bonus dépendament du montant que vous aller donner. Généralement liés avec mon projet Masspan puisque c'est un projet personnel qui bénéficiera le plus de mon voyage de perfectionnement à mon retour. Mais il y a aussi des prix spéciaux comme un souper Turque maison... Regarder l'onglet à droite!

Finalement, passez le mot à votre famille ou vos amis! Tessekur eder'im!

C'est un objectif flexible, indigogo me permet de collecter les contributions petites ou grandè à la fin du délai et aideront à rendre mon séjour musical que plus profitable. L'argent sera utilisé surtout pour payer les différents cours privés ainsi que les déplacement pour s'y rendre ainsi que d'autres activités connexe à mon apprentissage et mon perfectionnement à Istanbul.

Aussi, pour démontrer ma gratitude, il y a différents prix bonus dépendament du montant que vous aller donner. Généralement liés avec mon projet Masspan puisque c'est un projet personnel qui bénéficiera le plus de mon voyage de perfectionnement à mon retour. Mais il y a aussi des prix spéciaux comme un souper Turque maison... Regarder l'onglet à droite!

Finalement, passez le mot à votre famille ou vos amis! Tessekur eder'im!

story:
My Story

Hi, thanks for stopping by. I hope you will stay long enough to watch the video and see me beg. My name is Blaine Long. I am a singer/songwriter in Chandler, Arizona and make my living playing original music.  I have been writing songs and playing for live audiences since 1996. My live shows have been described as "raw" and "confessional" and my style as "storytelling improv that relys on the dynamics of my voice and guitar".  I don't know about all that. I just try to be honest. If you wanna have a listen, go here. 

My Project

I am writing a new album and need your help to raise money to record it.  A lot of things go into recording a new album. You need the right equipment and you might have to hire other musicians to play on it. There is mastering, producing, duplicating, promoting. Every album is filled with hopes, dreams, optimism...heartache. I've always wanted to record a live, acoustic album at the historic Hotel Monte Vista in Flagstaff, Arizona. I don't know why, really, and they don't seem to care one way or another. But the place has a great feel and it tells it's stories to those who listen. Besides, my friend lost his virginity there.

What's in it for you

So, won't you please help me get this album recorded by giving "Just A Little Bit". As an incentive to get you to part with your hard-earned money, I am offering a whole bunch of cool perks. I'm not going to repeat them here, they are all listed in the right sidebar. Have a look. Have a listen (here) and pick an amount you are comfortable with. If you would like to see me crazy dance in the autum moonlight, help me reach this goal by my birthday on November 12, 2011.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word on Facebook, YouTube, Twitter and anywhere else you can. Tell your friends to have their friends tell their friend's friends.  Thank you!

story:
About The Project

Hi. I’m Heather Ault, artist and founder of 4000 Years for Choice. For the past several years, I’ve been creating visual culture about the history of abortion and contraception with the goal of decreasing abortion stigma, increasing conversation about reproductive freedom, and creating healing opportunities for women who’ve had abortions.

Celebration and Events

Last year, I went to Washington D.C. for the 39th anniversary of Roe v Wade with a dozen beautiful banners carrying powerful messages about women's goodness, such as "Good women have abortions!" This year, I will be returning to the Supreme Court for the 40th anniversary with more positive slogans based on women’s personal stories, inspiring quotes, and other powerful statements from the reproductive rights community. During the next few months, I will be sharing the Roe v Wade banners and the 4000 Years for Choice project at national conferences, art exhibits, and college campuses around the country through 2013. I need your help to make this happen!

Call to Action

I need to raise $4000 to cover the costs of the design and production of about 20 new beautiful banners for the 40th anniversary and pay for my travel expenses to Washington D.C. for the week of January 22nd as well as to events around the country where I will be presenting the 4000 Years for Choice project.

So I’m turning to my strongest supporters to ask for contributions. In exchange, I’m offering original framed artwork signed by the artist, inspiring note cards to give to friends, and awesome t-shirts. Your contribution will help me continue the work of sharing the history of abortion and contraception through positive messages that heal and inspire, and further, create visual culture that beautifully celebrates Roe v Wade this year.

#1 Fund the Banners

I'm producing 20 (or more!) beautiful banners using slogans selected by the abortion rights and reproductive justice community! These vinyl banners will be 3 x 4 feet in size with adjustable handles in a hand-carrying bags. Your contribution will help with designing, printing, shipping, and my travel costs to and from Washington D.C.

Also, please take the survey here to help select the very best messages: http://www.surveymonkey.com/s/92HRWCF

 

 

#2 Fund the Events

I've been invited to make presentations about 4000 Years for Choice at a dozen events so far this year! Your contribution will help pay for travel expenses and the costs associated with shipping banners and artwork, making presentations, connecting with students, and attending conferences.

Public Events

  • January 22, 2013: Kickoff Event at the Supreme Court, 40th Anniversary of Roe v Wade, Washington, DC
  • February 1, 2013: Keynote Presentation, 40th Anniversary Emma Goldman Clinic Benefit Dinner, Iowa City, Iowa
  • February 6, 2013: Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, Massechusetts
  • February 11, 2013: Visiting Artist Talk, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign, Illinois
  • February 25, 2013: Visiting Artist Talk, University of California, Riverside, California
  • March 4, 2013: Visiting Artist Talk and Exhibition, Indiana Purdue at Fort Wayne, Fort Wayne, Indiana
  • March 7, 2013: Visiting Artist Talk, University of Michigan, Dearborn, Michigan
  • March 22-23, 2013: Art Exhibition, Feminist Majority Conference, Washington, DC
  • April 12-14, 2013: Workshop Presentation, Civil Liberties and Public Policy Conference at Hampshire College, Amherst, Massachusetts
  • May 4, 2013: Artist Talk and Exhibition, Luna Fest Film Festival, Rapid City, South Dakota
  • TBA: Art Exhibit, Nursing Students for Choice, University of California, San Francisco, California
  • TBA: Art Exhibit, Illinois Choice Action Team, NARAL, Chicago, Illinois
  • TBA: Art Exhibit, New York State Chapter, NARAL, New York City, New York

Other Events

  • Workshop Presentation, Abortion Care Network Annual Meeting
  • Panel Presentation and Exhibition, 37th Annual National Abortion Federation Conference

The Perks

Note Cards

Framed Mini Posters

T-Shirts

Framed 4000 Years for Choice Posters

 

Comments from Fans

"Heather Ault's work is not only breathtakingly beautiful, but also refreshing and inspiring. She manages to draw on the awesome power of thousands of years of reproductive health history to paint a vivid image of where the movement needs to go in the future, and what we need to do to win." – Steph Herold, iamdrtiller.com

"I have always been a proponent of choice, but the 4000 Years for Choice project has reignited my "passion" on the subject." – Supporter

"4000 Years for Choice makes my heart sing. I am so grateful. It is an opportunity to look at the big picture, the historical picture, even the spiritual picture ~ all of which unambiguously show that women's choice is inalienable and life-serving. I believe the perspective you offer here can help women and men stand up for our women's rights in a healing way. Which will be far more effective than way of hatred and blame, since that is the way of domination and dividing-and-conquering. Blessings on the work you are doing on behalf of all of us." – Journey of Young Women

"We love love love love the 4000 Years for Choice campaign! It's inspiring to see artists creating bold, beautiful statements to celebrate choice, not to mention that the posters are just gorgeous." – Megan Smith, Repeal Hyde Art Project

"The Abortion Care Network was very fortunate to have Heather Ault present 4000 Years for Choice at our 2010 Annual Meeting. Using incisive research and personal experience, Heather brilliantly reinvented our understanding of birth control, abortion, and all things reproductive. Everyone who saw the presentation was changed. This is art at its best and most powerful." – Charlotte Taft, President, Abortion Care Network

"Heather Ault is the most creative artist working today on behalf of the abortion rights movement... her work deserves widespread distribution." – Carole Joffe, PhD, University of California, Berkeley

About Heather Ault

Heather Ault is an award-winning artist, researcher, and activist for abortion rights and reproductive justice. As founder of 4000 Years for Choice, she created a dynamic visual art series devoted to re-visioning the historical and cultural narrative of abortion and contraception. Since the project’s initial launch in 2009, Heather has presented her artwork and research at art galleries, national conferences, university campuses, and reproductive health clinics across the country. Her work has been written about in the Huffington Post, New York Daily News, Bust Magazine, and many other blogs. Heather is a board member of the Abortion Conversation Project and also serves as Social Media Coordinator for the Abortion Care Network. She holds a Bachelors of Fine Arts in Graphic Design and Master of Fine Arts in New Media and is based in Urbana, Illinois.

Thank you again!

Heather Ault
Artist/Founder
4000 Years for Choice
www.4000yearsforchoice.com

story:
INDEPENDENT MUSIC Knocking at Your Door

There are many challenges facing independent artists, today. Competing with the manpower and marketing dollars of a major music label is probably the greatest of these challenges. And, because of that imbalance, it's often difficult to breakout from the digital realm, to become a "known" name, to get placement on radio playlists or reviews in various trade periodicals. Even the simple act of hiring a booking agent to secure A-List gigs or festival dates can seem an all too distant dream.

Yet, being an independent artist can be the most rewarding experience any songwriter could ever hope for because we have a real opportunity to get to know the audience beyond just a fan-base; we get to build lasting friendships while sharing our music in the most intimate way, performing in small venues and in-home concerts.

Hello, my name is Peter. Please Accept My Personal Invitation to Join me in a New Musical Adventure. Over the next 60 days, I truly hope you will find my brand of Americana to be a welcome friend, a music that resonates within you and with your life's experience.

The Project is Named: ‘a complicated MAN’

The project is based upon Mountain Influenced Acoustic Guitar with Celtic, Blues or Alternative Country injected to complete the musical journey. The lyrics are story driven, the direct product of my collaboration with Starburst Music. We've already tackled the time and expense of recording 11 songs including the title track: ‘Complicated Man’.

CD Baby has been designated as primary distributor, both domestically and abroad, which includes Amazon.com, iTunes, and Spotify among many other online retailers and digital stores. We have 100 High Def CDs printed by Disc Makers for promotional purposes. Dedicated websites are up and running, ready for exploration as well as individual song, album, MP3 or CD purchases.

It’s a decent start for an independent artist because we now have the most basic of tools, and most importantly, the confidence to offer this exclusive invitation.

We Want You To Join Us!

More directly, I want you to be an important part in this independent artist's story. I want this to become your success story, as well as mine. So, here’s what’s up.

We need to market ‘a complicated MAN’ just like the major labels do. But, we don’t need major label expense accounts. We just need to be smart. That’s why we did our homework and selected one of the top PR organizations in the music industry to partner with this project. At $5,000 (five-thousand dollars – which is our first crowd-sourcing goal), their fee is extremely reasonable for the job they promise and will accomplish.

Here’s a snapshot of what they offer: International Firm with Support Staff of 7 assisting in the Performance of a 90-Day Intensive PR/Release Support Campaign, inclusive of the following.

Radio Airplay Promo

  • Target 7500 National & International radio stations that air our genre of music. They will be a combination of: mainstream, Internet, college, satellite, independent, pod cast & community radio.

Film/TV Song Placement Promo

  • Introduce our music to 1100 film & TV supervisors, production studios, ad agencies & filmmakers.

National & International Press promo 

  • Target 5,000 Music industry contacts to garner CD music reviews & write ups from both published & unpublished prominent industry professionals. 

Booking Agent & Festival Organizer promo

  • Target 150 US & Canadian music festival directors & 100 International booking agents seeking new talent for their venues, festivals and events.

Local Buzz Media promo  

  • Target approximately 100 local & regional radio stations, television programs, journalists & magazines to introduce the CD release.

6 Social Media promos

  • Draw attention to the artist website, videos, CD and upcoming performance schedule, by targeting 25,000 International entertainment industry personnel through the PR firm’s Twitter, Facebook & LinkedIn accounts.   

Proposed Reach:

  • Countries covered under the PR Campaign:  USA, Canada, England, Scotland, The Netherlands, Ireland, Australia, Germany, Spain, Greece, France, Italy, Denmark, Austria, Luxembourg, Slovenia, Poland, Ukraine, Switzerland, New Zealand, Israel, Turkey, United Arab Emirates, Russia, Japan, China, India, South Africa, Portugal, Argentina, Mexico, Brazil, Venezuela, Bahamas, Jamaica.

 

So, That is Goal Number One 

Launch a Major Publicity Campaign

Build Meaningful Exposure & Momentum

Now, On to Goal Number Two - It's SHOWTIME

 

Next, we have a CD Release Event & Live Concert scheduled for Saturday, June 22nd, at Latitude 35, located in the heart of Knoxville, TN (concert room w/stage, sound system and 250 patron capacity). Oh, and by the way, You Are INVITED!

Proposed support activity for the event includes a TV interview with the Knoxville CBS Affiliate Station which serves numerous tourist destinations, trafficked artisan enclaves and major university campuses located throughout the Great Smoky and Blue Ridge Mountain regions. 

Should we gain enough backer support and surpass our initial goal, we can then tackle the necessary travel expenses associated with performances and marketing activities, the replication of additional CDs and MP3 download cards to be offered for sale at concerts, festivals, cultural events, at retail, or thru our website store and that is our $10,000 (ten-thousand dollar) goal.

 

Our Stretch Goal: The Follow-Up Album

 

Now, if we do our job exceptionally well; and, together we advance this campaign to the $50,000 level or more, we will proceed with producing a follow-up CD/Digital Download Collection, featuring studio time with a string quartet, a keyboardist extraordinaire and a world music percussionist. This project will be recorded in the Fall of 2013 for wide release during the 2013 Christmas Holiday Selling Season.

RISK & REWARD: With any entertainment project there is always a certain level of risk but we have jumped the hurdle of 'will a CD/Digital Release be completed'? Complicated Man is already in the can and ready for wide distribution.

As you read thru the various funding levels, we hope you will agree that we have worked diligently to match each level with rewards that are either already available or deliverable with that level of involvement.

 

We Want This Introduction To Become

A Lifelong Friendship Between Us

And, Thank You For Any Level 

Of Consideration You Pledge

 

As Always,

Your Friend in Music

Peter Olach - PGO

 

NOTICE: Backers outside of North America, Please ADD $15.00 to Your Pledge to Cover Currency Exchange Rates and Any Additional Shipping Charges. THANK YOU!

 

2013 REVIEW: ‘a complicated MAN’

"This is a recording from one of our great storytellers sharing complex life experiences in song-form. Peter’s voice  is distinctive, inimitable, forceful, subtle and true to life.  But more importantly, his inner voice is powerful and obvious in this collection, and that's what makes it so truly special.

Upon listening, one might find the vocal phrasing similar to Willie Nelson or Bob Dylan, with a slight Celtic feel and supported by equally unique acoustic guitar work. Thought provoking lyrics are the norm throughout this album, like "our baby girl, she only wants to die” from the song ‘Mistress of the Vein’.

And, my favorite is the title track, ‘Complicated Man’, the perfect name for this project - because Peter Olach bares his soul and throughout shows just how complex he is, as great songwriters do. My Recommendation: You have to add this  CD to your music collection!"

– Roy Elkins, CEO/Founder, www.Broadjam.com

 

2013 REVIEW: ‘a complicated MAN’

"Beginning with the early 70's, award-winning songwriter/artist Peter Olach (PGO) toured extensively throughout the USA & Canada. Now, residing in the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Peter's newest release 'Complicated MAN' demonstrates, with exquisite clarity, the full breadth and maturity of a master singer/songwriter.

The CDs title song dives head first into the complexity and dichotomies of living within the human condition. The impactive ‘Far from Home’ has brought many a listener to tears as it paints a picture of societal alienation. And, then there is the incredibly upbeat ‘Wedding Dress’ which teases us with its surprise ending.

Peter's expert blending of the very best elements of Alternative Folk, Celtic, Country and Americana forge a whole new genre of quiet elegance. These latest original songs represent the result of collaboration with Starburst Music and are sure to provoke thoughtful reflection in even the most astute listener."

– Gary Vandy, Producer, Studio Center, Miami

 

 

YOU Really Do Make. . .

All The Difference in the WORLD 

So, Please, Share This Campaign with Family, Friends and Co-Workers; Spread the Word at Church and across the Campus; Share Our IGG Link on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and Your Favorite Blogs.

Again, THANK YOU!

Your Friend in Music 
Peter Olach - PGO
 
NOTICE: Backers outside of North America, Please ADD $15.00 to Your Pledge to Cover Currency Exchange Rates and Any Additional Shipping Charges. THANK YOU!
 

2013 REVIEW: ‘a complicated MAN’

"This is a recording from one of our great storytellers sharing complex life experiences in song-form. Peter’s voice  is distinctive, inimitable, forceful, subtle and true to life.  But more importantly, his inner voice is powerful and obvious in this collection, and that's what makes it so truly special.
Upon listening, one might find the vocal phrasing similar to Willie Nelson or Bob Dylan, with a slight Celtic feel and supported by equally unique acoustic guitar work. Thought provoking lyrics are the norm throughout this album, like "our baby girl, she only wants to die” from the song ‘Mistress of the Vein’.
And, my favorite is the title track, ‘Complicated Man’, the perfect name for this project - because Peter Olach bares his soul and throughout shows just how complex he is, as great songwriters do. My Recommendation: You have to add this  CD to your music collection!"
– Roy Elkins, CEO/Founder, www.Broadjam.com
 

2013 REVIEW: ‘a complicated MAN’

"Beginning with the early 70's, award-winning songwriter/artist Peter Olach (PGO) toured extensively throughout the USA & Canada. Now, residing in the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Peter's newest release 'Complicated MAN' demonstrates, with exquisite clarity, the full breadth and maturity of a master singer/songwriter.
The CDs title song dives head first into the complexity and dichotomies of living within the human condition. The impactive ‘Far from Home’ has brought many a listener to tears as it paints a picture of societal alienation. And, then there is the incredibly upbeat ‘Wedding Dress’ which teases us with its surprise ending.
Peter's expert blending of the very best elements of Alternative Folk, Celtic, Country and Americana forge a whole new genre of quiet elegance. These latest original songs represent the result of collaboration with Starburst Music and are sure to provoke thoughtful reflection in even the most astute listener."
– Gary Vandy, Producer, Studio Center, Miami
 
 
YOU Really Do Make. . .

All The Difference in the WORLD 

So, Please, Share This Campaign with Family, Friends and Co-Workers; Spread the Word at Church and across the Campus; Share Our IGG Link on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and Your Favorite Blogs. 
Again, THANK YOU!

story:
Update!

Every dollar we go over our goal will go directly to the incredible cast of this production. Show your support for young opera singers by donating!

And now you can get a gorgeous Helios tote bag when you donate just $25!

Short Summary

We founded Helios Early Opera last year because we believe there can't be enough good opera in the world, especially Baroque opera. Opera can seem stuffy, it can seem elitist, it can seem to require lots of knowledge and familiarity to fully appreciate. We disagree. Helios' goal is to do away with all that pretension. Early period opera is the least pretentious of all, we believe. We want first-time opera-goers to be thrilled and moved and entertained because we believe opera is relevant and valuable. We're doing this because we love opera. Help give us a chance to persuade you to love it too! In the words of Franco Zeffirelli: “I have always believed that opera is a planet where the muses work together, join hands and celebrate all the arts.”

We've chosen Cavalli's Artemisia for our winter show because it's both beautiful and fun. The music is delightful and full of energy; the plot engaging and humorous. Director Aria Umezawa is setting the show in modern Hollywood where internationally renowned actress Artemisia navigates fame and scandal as she struggles to find love after the death of her husband. We have a supremely talented cast of singers and an orchestra of remarkable early music specialists. It's going to be an enthralling show and we hope you'll help make it possible!

What We Need & What You Get

As Molière put it, "Of all the noises known to man, opera is the most expensive." Opera requires all the costs of an orchestral concert plus all the expenses of a theatrical spectacle. Helios spends the majority of our budget on our artists (all our administrative work is unpaid) which means your donation goes straight to young musicians. We make only 20% of our yearly budget from ticket sales (a large percentage for an opera company) which means we have to make up the rest with grants and donations. We choose to keep our ticket prices low because we want our performances to be affordable to most people.

We're trying to achieve $5,700 from this campaign. If we reach this goal, an anonymous donor will match your contributions doubling this total. This amount plus the funds we've already raised this year and projected ticket sales will cover the total cost of putting on Artemisia (about $20K). If we don't make our goal, we'll be forced to make budget cuts leading to: a smaller orchestra, a minimal set, minimal costumes and props. We will have to forgo recording the production and we may be forced to increase ticket prices. Please help us avoid this!

We have some great perks to thank you for your donation. Each person who donates will be named in the Artemisia program! We have unreleased video clips from last year's thrilling production of Charpentier's David et Jonathas and sneak preview photographs from the recent Artemisia photoshoot. We have a handsome tote bag with the Helios logo; a full DVD of David et Jonathas (unavailable for purchase); VIP tickets to the show. We have an exclusive soiree with the Artemisia cast and directors in January where you can meet the artists while enjoying wine and hors d'oevres! We are even offering a private house concert showcasing our talented cast and orchestra members.

The Impact

Your support not only helps Helios put on this show, it reaffirms that opera is a vital and important art form that still has relevance in the 21st-century. We are committed to demonstrating that this is so. Our first two productions garnered much critical acclaim:

Pulitzer prize-winning critic Lloyd Schwartz said of David et Jonathas, "I thoroughly enjoyed [Helios'] first major production, and I hope people will be on the lookout for their next."

Of our recent performance of Telemann's Pimpinone, which took place in a nightclub, the Boston Musical Intelligencer enthused, "Being up close and personal with the music, with plenty of laughs and maybe a drink in hand made for some smart entertainment."

We are also committed to expanding the audience for opera. Last year, we donated tickets to a group of home-schoolers who traveled all the way from Eastern New York to see their first opera. As one teenager put it: "Seeing this opera made me think of art as a whole."

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to help us besides donating money:
  • Host an out-of-town artist! Many of our singers and instrumentalists travel from far away to be part of our production. Meet a new friend and support opera at the same time!
  • Spread the word. We're a new group and we're trying to introduce opera to more people. Tell a friend about our show. Share this campaign on your blog or Facebook.
  • Volunteer. Opera requires a lot of time and a lot of people. Tell us about your skills and interests, we always need more help!

story:
Art, Music, & Fun Perks for you

can help send Carissa to

the ASCAP "I Create Music" Expo - ooh - ooh - ooh

Hi, I'm Carissa, a 30 year-old aspiring singer-songwriter and artist living in Seattle.  I've had dreams of being a rock star since I was a kid goofing around with my mom's acoustic guitar; dressed up in black shades, a button up shirt, tie, and slicked back hair.   That dream had been just that until recently.   I had been teaching myself guitar off and on and writing songs since I was in my early twenties, but I didn't get serious about it until a year and a half ago when I finally got the courage up to take guitar lessons and play at open mics.  

I have the opportunity to attend a three day workshop, The ASCAP "I Create Music" Expo, in Los Angeles that has the potential to significantly change the course of my life and musical career.  My difficulty is being able to afford the pricey registration fee & flight.  If you'd like to help me, please check out the perks and purchase orginal works by me.  In exchange for some art/music, I will be able to afford to fly to LA, immerse myself in workshops, network, and have my music critiqued by leading industry big shots.  I will come back to Seattle energized about my music, knowledgable and more confident to continue working on one of my main passions in life.  

 

To hear a work in progress go here: https://soundcloud.com/carissa-meier/give-a-damn

To see more of my visual art, please visit: http://carissameier.tumblr.com/

 

This project is a trade. Through this Indiegogo campaign I will be selling my original encaustic paintings, hand made comfort creatures, my tunes,and even a very special cooking experience   - see the perks section for more details. All proceeds will go towards my music. 

 

Registration for the expo costs $390 until March 31st and then the cost goes up to $450!  Yowza!  I will be staying for FREE with my guitar teacher and composer Catherine Grealish, who will also be attending the expo.

 
ASCAP's "I Create Music" Expo is a workshop for all people in the music industry: singer-songwriters, composers for film, media and games, and producers. My guitar teacher who is also a film composer went to this conference after deciding to pursue film composing full time. She said this about the expo: "I Create Music changed my life. I not only got to meet with people in the industry that were successfully doing what I wanted to do, and had so much advice to offer on the subject, but also meet my peers who were at the same stage as me. I learned from the experts and experienced support and camaraderie from my community, which continued long after the Expo finished. I will be going for my third year this year. My career has benefited so much from the input I received at I Create Music."

For more info about the expo please visit: http://www.ascap.com/eventsawards/events/expo.aspx

 

THANK YOU!! 

 
 Julia Child Visit Perk!           Carissa painting              Encaustic Painting

story:
I’m Bernadette Quattrone, the director and head teacher of Skyline Preschool in Oakland, California.

Sharing music with children is one of the best parts of my job as a preschool teacher, and now I’m very excited to record my first album of children’s music!

My album will be full of my handpicked favorite cover songs to share with kids; they’re story-driven, fun and whimsical, participatory, and educational.  It will also include one original song of mine about Kindness that the children at my school really seem to connect to. My goal is that this album will encourage people of every age to sing along and play.

It’s partially a fundraiser!

I’m going to call the album Songs from Skyline and I will be donating all of the sales of the CD at Skyline Preschool’s Spring fundraiser, the Spring Fling, to the school playground and scholarship fund. This fund helps keep our playground safe and looking good and is also a scholarship fund for Skyline Families that need some financial support. I plan to sell the CD at the Spring Fling for years to come, and if it does well, this could lead to more recordings! 

I’m very excited to work with a couple of friends on the album-yay for friends! Linda Hamilton, Mom to former Skyline Preschoolers Ben and Max will be playing guitar and singing as well as contributing her own song "pick",  and Kele Nitolo will be playing drums and lots of fun percussion.

I have a budget of $5000. Most of the money will go to studio time and musicians. Other costs include reproduction, mixing, mastering, graphic design, and distribution.  I met with my producer at his studio in Emeryville last week-he’s great and already has wonderful ideas for the album. If I raise more money than my goal, it will most likely be spent on more studio time!

I get so much joy from diving into creative projects and expressing myself artistically.It is my sincere intention to inspire the children I work with to take on their own creative dreams and enjoy whatever form of artistic expression that calls to them. It is my hope that this album will be inspiring to the children I work with, and to all the children that enjoy it.

Please consider donating what you can, this project will not be possible without your help! 

I hope you can benefit from my perks-check them out!

Another HUGE help I would appreciate is to pass this on to friends and family you think might be connected to the project or interested in a CD, thanks for spreading the word!

story:
From us to you.

      We are First & Thorne an alternative indie rock band from Massillon, Ohio.

For two solid years now we've been steadily chasing our dreams, and at the same time teaching and showing others that they should chase theirs. Our whole    entire mission in our careers is to help others be happy. 

We've developed a solid trusting fan base, and a solid brand and label. It has taken a lot of passion and drive to get to the point we are at now, and we don't want to slow down anytime soon.

If you follow our band then you already know we plan on hitting the road and getting farther out there. No we're not moving away, just taking off for a week here and there.

After undergoing management early in 2013 things have taken a business perspective and we have developed a fearce edge with our brand and label.

Needless to say, we've become extremely serious about what we're doing.

This is a career path, we're not messing around.

We already have our budget for the spring, and it isn't going to allow enough money for a van, and we are just trying to get a van, it can even need work, so we can deck it out First & Thorne style and go Regional this summer and National in the winter. We have high hopes that we can make this happen.

We know there are people out there who believe in our music as much as we do, some even more. That's what we're all about. Meaning something. We hope you know that all of you mean a ton to us!

We were extremely reluctant to ask people personally for money. We only want positive vibes in your life, so only help if your able and willing. We love everyone of you either way, and this was the path layed for us and we'll make it regardless of what lfie throws at us.

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down for you guys in more detail:

We need about a thousand smacks, we can then buy a junk van and get the work done, or buy a good working one for around that range, and we could cover the overflow if it is more than our goal.

Gifts of five dollars recieve FREE EP THANKS TO OUR EXGIRLFRIENDS sent via email mp3, (40)qty.

Gifts of ten dollars recieve FREE EP THANKS TO OUR EXGIRLFRIENDS and LP LEFT OF CENTER sent via email mp3. (50)qty.

Gifts of twenty five or more recieve FREE EP THANKS TO OUR EXGIRLFRIENDS and LP LEFT OF CENTER And A Personal Thank You letter from us to you.(30)qty.

Gifts of fifty dollars or more recieve FREE EP THANKS TO OUR EXGIRLFRIENDS and LP LEFT OF CENTER, A Personal Thank You letter from us to you, and a limited edition Shovels Beanie (our Logo). (15)qty.

Gifts of one hundred dollars or more recieve FREE EP THANKS TO OUR EXGIRLFRIENDS and LP LEFT OF CENTER, A Personal Thank You letter from us to you, and a limited edition Shovels Beanie (our Logo)

Gifts of five hundred dollars or more recieve FREE EP THANKS TO OUR EXGIRLFRIENDS and LP LEFT OF CENTER, A Personal Thank You letter from us to you, and a limited edition Shovels Beanie (our Logo), and a personal thank you on our debut record that will always be there for you/us to remember, our demo "B-Sides From The Basement", A free Tshirt of what we have in stock, and we'll come to your house and play our set. (2)qty

The packages will be sent on may 15th to give us time to prep them and get them out to you. 

The shows have to be within 50 miles of Massillon or we'll have to spend the night somewhere.

Every single person who helps will be remembered by us forever, we don't like asking for money, but it's tough in this industry. especially when your just getting fired up.

The Impact

We have dramatically affected every person we come in contact with. Our entire purpose on earth is to help people see the truth about their surroundings. We live to teach people how to escape the horrors of our society and prosper from their dreams. You helping us get on the road to help others is amazing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Since day one, the number one way you can help First & Thorne, is by telling someone you love about us and sharing this link www,facebook.com/firstandthorne
