story:
The Gist

We are Hopeless Jack & the Handsome Devil, and for the last two years we have pressed beyond what is expected of a 'local heroes' band intentionally breaking ground where we can and in a style of our own. In this next chapter we will be traveling abroad to Europe! With your help we can ease tension of traveling expenses which is vast.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Because of recent changes in travel plans we have had to roll with the punches and raise some funds. Our goal has been set to $500 for help on air-fare and food to get out of the country. Help us get there and you will be rewarded. For the short time of this fund-raising campaign we are making available a limited supply of our HJ&HD cache of paraphernalia!

  • Handwritten Lyrics

  • Important 'Pieces' of the Band

  • Historical Contributions

  • Everything Signed!

  • ...and more!!

The Impact

Hopeless Jack & the Handsome Devil is a road-worn trademark that puts it's dollars to the test. We've been successful at raising money in the past, and rest assured every cent donated was put to use and stretched as far as this troubled economy permits. Our fans are the best of any, and it has been through their contribution and support that we have been able to show so many what we love doing. We take to heart the compliments that we receive, and the one that turns up most is, "Keep going!" We intend to honor your request.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to give financially, we completely understand. The sacrifices involved in living life can be innumerable and unimaginable at times, but there is still ways for you to help. Spread the word to all those that you can emphasizing that even the least amount is of great help. There are Indiegogo share tools available on this website, and the entirety of the vast universe of Social Network. Enjoy!
story_txt:
The Gist
We are Hopeless Jack & the Handsome Devil, and for the last two years we have pressed beyond what is expected of a 'local heroes' band intentionally breaking ground where we can and in a style of our own. In this next chapter we will be traveling abroad to Europe! With your help we can ease tension of traveling expenses which is vast.
 
What We Need & What You Get
Because of recent changes in travel plans we have had to roll with the punches and raise some funds. Our goal has been set to $500 for help on air-fare and food to get out of the country. Help us get there and you will be rewarded. For the short time of this fund-raising campaign we are making available a limited supply of our HJ&HD cache of paraphernalia!


Handwritten Lyrics


Important 'Pieces' of the Band


Historical Contributions


Everything Signed!


...and more!!

The Impact
Hopeless Jack & the Handsome Devil is a road-worn trademark that puts it's dollars to the test. We've been successful at raising money in the past, and rest assured every cent donated was put to use and stretched as far as this troubled economy permits. Our fans are the best of any, and it has been through their contribution and support that we have been able to show so many what we love doing. We take to heart the compliments that we receive, and the one that turns up most is, "Keep going!" We intend to honor your request.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you're unable to give financially, we completely understand. The sacrifices involved in living life can be innumerable and unimaginable at times, but there is still ways for you to help. Spread the word to all those that you can emphasizing that even the least amount is of great help. There are Indiegogo share tools available on this website, and the entirety of the vast universe of Social Network. Enjoy!

story:
Support our new movie musical by pre-ordering your CD soundtrack today! You'll also receive a personal invitation to the Private Cast and Crew Screening in Edmonton on Saturday, February 25, 2012 at 5pm.

The Man That Got Away will have its world premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival, February 9 - 19 2012. Details at http://dirtcityfilms.com

Our Story

The Man That Got Away is the new short film written and directed by Trevor Anderson, whose films have played at many A-list film festivals, including Sundance, Berlin and Toronto. Itâ€™s a 25-minute musical documentary that tells the true life story of Trevorâ€™s great-uncle Jimmy in six original songs. For more information on Trevor, and to see some of his earlier work, visit http://dirtcityfilms.com

This new film is a musical, with original music by Bryce Kulak. For more information on Bryce, and to hear some of his earlier work, visit http://brycekulak.com

The Impact

Your support allows us to manufacture and release the soundtrack as a CD, including the six original songs from the film produced and recorded by Doug Organ at Edmontone Studio, and featuring bonus remixes of all these songs by Canadian indie musicians Chad VanGaalen, Cadence Weapon, Bebop Cortez, Cameron Sound, Jered Stuffco (DVAS) and Lyle Bell (Shout Out Out Out Out, The Wet Secrets, Whitey Houston).


Listen 

Listen to a sampler of the original songs and remixes at http://soundcloud.com/dirtcityfilms/tmtga-sampler

What We Need & What You Get

If you would like your own beautifully packaged, professionally pressed CD soundtrack, complete with 12-page booklet of all the lyrics and behind-the-scenes photos by Fish Griwkowsky, simply place your pre-order for $20 ($15 for the CD, $5 shipping/handling). Disc packaging designed by Lyle Bell. CDs ship in March. BONUS: You'll also receive a personal invitation to the Private Cast and Crew Screening in Edmonton on Saturday, February 25, 2012 at 5pm.

If youâ€™re one of those lucky people with a little extra money to contribute, and you want to help make sure we meet our goal, weâ€™re grateful for larger pledges. To thank you for your support, weâ€™ll send you some excellent bonus "perks" described in the sidebar to the right.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word to others who'd be interested, by using the "share tools" above for Facebook or Twitter, yelling out your window, slipping hand-written notes into people's pockets in elevators, what have you.

More About The Songs

The CD will feature 14 tracks:

The six original songs from the film feature Bryce Kulak on piano, Rob Aldridge on double bass, and Fred Brenton on drums. This killer rhythm section is joined by studio musicians for that real â€œmovie musicalâ€ sound. The singers and musicians on each track are:

1. "This Place is So Gayâ€ â€“ Singers: Aryn McConnell, Mat Busby, Matthew Lindholm, Rydel McLenon, Jason Morris

2. "Itâ€™s Our Doodlyâ€ â€“ Singers: Bryce Kulak, Jason Hardwick, Eric Wigston

3. "Booze & Pillsâ€ â€“ Singers: Bryce Kulak, Matthew Akplu, Amber Borotsik, Clinton Carew, Jamie Cavanagh, Nicola Elbro, Peter Fernandes, Jesse Gervais, Kristine Nutting, Kristen Padayas, Jeff Rivet, Melissa Thingelstad; Featured Musician: Bob Tildesley (trumpet)

4. "Fresh Start / Old Bloodâ€ â€“ Singers: Connie Champagne, Bryce Kulak, Jocelyn Ahlf, Colleen Brown, Kendra Connor, Amy van Keeken, Clinton Carew, Tom Edwards, Andrew MacDonald-Smith

5. "Feelin Nothinâ€ â€“ Singers: Bryce Kulak, Connie Champagne

6. "Jailhouse Jimâ€ â€“ Singers: Bryce Kulak, Russell Bull, Fish Griwkowsky, Wilf Kozub, Dwayne Martineau, Chris Smith, Murray Utas, Jeff Woodward; Featured Musician: Teddy Borowiecki (accordion)

7. Special bonus track #1: instrumental reprise of the ballad, â€œFeelin Nothinâ€, featuring accordionist Teddy Borowiecki.

The remixes are:

8. "This Place is So Gayâ€ â€“ remixed by Lyle Bell (Shout Out Out Out Out, The Wet Secrets, Whitey Houston)

9. "Itâ€™s Our Doodlyâ€ â€“ remixed by Chad VanGaalen

10. "Booze and Pillsâ€ â€“ remixed by Cadence Weapon

11. "Fresh Start / Old Bloodâ€ â€“ remixed by Cameron Sound

12. "Feelin Nothinâ€ â€“ remixed by Jered Stuffco (DVAS)

13. "Jailhouse Jimâ€ â€“ remixed by Bebop Cortez

14. Special bonus track #2: solo piano reprise of â€œFeelin Nothinâ€ played by Bryce Kulak

Thank You

Production of the film was supported by the Canada Council for the Arts, Alberta Foundation for the Arts, Edmonton Arts Council, Bravo!FACT, National Film Board of Canada, and FAVA.

Production of the soundtrack CD is supported by... you!

Production of the soundtrack CD is supported by... you!

story:
Here's your chance to help make "History" (I love the word play in that, just for the record :)

My name is Matt, and my music act is called The Real Matt Jones. Over the course of the past 7 years, my bandmates and I have been incredibly blessed to have landed a management deal, a publishing deal, song placements in numerous movies, and the opportunity to play alongside some of our favorite major label acts all over the country (and even some in Canada!)

We're through with the writing and the recording of our 3rd full-length record, called History. This record has been almost 4 years in the making, so we're confident that it's finally good!

We're doing this Indiegogo campaign for that last "push over the cliff" (in the words of Nigel Tufnel), so that the art, mastering, and production will match the effort of the writing and the recording we've put into this record over the last 4 years.

What We Need & What You Get

All things considered, we are trying to raise a very small amount of money in relation to the project we've taken on. We've already had songs from History that major label artists have expressed interest in recording (or a "hold" on tunes for you Nashville Cats), and we couldn't be more happy with the recording and writing that you'll hear on this record.

So - here's your chance to be part of making this record finally happen! We've got all kinds of "perks" as Indiegogo calls them for contributing at each level...you can even have your name featured in the credits of this CD, or even have a house concert in your own living room anywhere in the world. We tried to make a donation level available for everybody, so make sure you check out all the perks to the right on your screen! 

The Impact

This will be the 3rd full-length studio record for The Real Matt Jones, but it will be the 9th studio recording effort from the writers and band members involved. We believe that this is the best possible way to have fans and artists help each other - absolutely directly. When you contribute to a campaign like this, you are not paying a label to tell us what to do. You are not giving money to a nameless, faceless corporation that is only concerned with the bottom line - you are giving direct support to artists that are using those resources to be as ardently creative as possible, and we love you for it.

So, all in all, this is the way that you can help make this record the best possible record we can put out. We promise to keep making music, writing stories, and recording records as long as we have something to contribute.

Thank you incredibly for your time and donations; without you, we're permanently rehearsing ;)

-TRMJ

P.S. - All proceeds from this campaign, whether we reach the goal or not will go towards the production of History. If you cannot contribute, please share this campaign with your friends, or email us and let us know if you'd like to help in some other way. We love and appreciate you guys!

story:
We are a student brass quintet from the Peabody Conservatory and we have recently been offered the chance to travel to Uganda for 3 weeks in December in collaboration with TUBA: The Uganda-Baltimore Allliance. We will be mentoring a youth brass band located in the villages of Kikajjo and Masanafu, Uganda. With this unique opportunity as ambassadors for TUBA, we will be giving private lessons, working with the band as a whole, and focusing on developing the student band leaders' leadership and teaching skills. We will be positive role models as brass players, not only working with the students but also performing at local churches and gatherings. We will help the band develop necessary performance and business skills that will enhance their marketability and employment potential.

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP.

        In order to make this once in a lifetime opportunity a reality, we need your help! There are many expenses needed to make this project successful.

Your donations would contribute to our:

        -Airfare

        -Vaccinations

        -Room and board (food, electricity)

        -Visas

        -Travel insurance

This will all total to roughly $12,000. 

Please remember that your donation is tax deductible through Fractured Atlas!

WHO ARE WE?

Almost 3 years ago, the five of us were selected to form a chamber ensemble at the Peabody Conservatory. Through hard work and many rehearsals, our sounds and personalities blended to become the Eastern Edge Brass Quintet. Since then we have received many opportunities and we have quickly become a desired performing group in the Baltimore area. The most recent opportunity offered to us was the chance to travel to Uganda to work with a youth brass band. We are extremely excited by TUBA's invtation to teach in Uganda, and cannot wait to begin this adventure.

Hopefully you can be a part of it too! 

Thanks!!

Liz, Frankie, Emily, Joe and Austin

story:
Our Story

We're a rather young band hailing from Greenville, SC.  We have a profound love of music and love to play shows.  We started this band off as just a small group that we didn't expect to go far, although we all wanted the group to go as far as it possibly could.  After a couple of months of being a complete band we lost our first member and was replaced without much effort due to the first member having already scouted out another guitarist.  We recorded our first 2 song demo in the summer of 2010 and continued playing as many shows as possible.  We started to record our 5 song EP in the beginning of 2011 and finished around the beginning of the 2011 summer.  But during those months we had no idea that they would be the hardest the band would ever face.  One night after many long hours in the studio, Drew returned home and continued inside without taking his guitar or Jesse's bass out of his car.  Upon awakening the next morning Drew had found that his guitar and Jesse's bass had been stolen.  This upset Jesse and Drew to the point of depression and not returning to school for a week.  After an investigation and no leads the police have given up on searching for the stolen instruments that were like children to Jesse and Drew. 

The Impact

The impact this campaign will make is not only helping Jesse and Drew purchase new instruments after going so long with equipment that is not the greatest but it will also go towards getting the band a van or bus.  So that the band will not have such a hard time touring.  This will help Jesse and Drew immensely and will help fill the void that was left when their instruments were stripped from them. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need two new guitars, a 5 string bass and an electric, with some new pick ups and straps.  You will get free tickets to our shows and better performance out of us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word and tell your friends!

story:
Our Story

Imagine if you will, you are seated front center, the show is about to begin, the stage lights come up and your favorite local, regional, even national band or singer is about to take the stage. You are not in a giant arena or outdoor sports complex or stadium, surrounded by thousands of loud, drunk people who don't seem interested in the music at all. No, you are seated in a beautiful theatre in the round, literally only a few feet from where the stars come out and play. It's almost like sitting in your living room at home. The music begins to play, and it's as if you're a part of the music, not merely listening to it. 

This is hi definition music. 

You are immersed in the musical experience, and  the quality of the sound is second to none. Whether it's Blues, Jazz, Country, Roots, Soul, Funk, Americana, Bluegrass, Country, or even World music, in this space, quite frankly, it all Rocks. It's right there in front of you. So close you could reach out and touch it. The heart of the artists, and their stories are the focus. Whether it is a world renowned, Grammy winning artist, or a relatively unknown up and comer, the art of the song is the star, and not merely the background noise. It's clarity. It's clean. It's hi definition.

This is "Real Music @ 166."

With a very successful nine show "Season one" under our belt, we are eagerly anticipating even better things for Season two. World renown singer/songwriter Gary Morris graced our stage for our debut performance in April. Nashville songwriting ace Gary Nicholson, whose songs have been recorded by the biggest stars in Country, and Blues music, appeared twice during our inaugural run. Heck, we were even paid a visit by Paula Nelson (yes, Willie's daughter) and her amazing band. Woody Russell also played the series twice, bringing with him a TV crew from the new hit show "Troubadour Tx", now you can see images of our show on nationwide television.

All in all, not a bad first year. If you were fortunate enough to make one, or more, of our shows, then you know what an amazing experience it was.We would really like to see you come back in 2012 for even more great shows. Many have told me they knew nothing of our series. They had no idea our theater even existed, and that's not surprising. You see, It cost a lot of money to keep live music alive in the suburbs. Money for advertising, and promotion is so very hard to come by for a small venue such as ours. 

That's where you can help. Your generous support is needed to allow this series to not only continue, but to thrive. The bottom line is we need your help to move forward in 2012. We are currently working on booking another series of amazing shows for season two, one about every six weeks or so. But we have to cover our expenses in order to continue bringing you this wonderful musical experience. Won't you help us get the word out to more and more people in the greater Dallas Ft. Worth area? Together, we can keep live music alive in the suburbs. 

Real Heart, Real Soul, Real Music at 166. 


The Impact

Gary Morris, world renowned singer/songwriter/actor, officially kicked off Real Music at 166 in April of 2011, with a stellar performance. Following that first show, a gentleman who was in the audience that night pulled me aside and told me he had seen Gary perform many times over the years, in many different venues, and this performance, in this venue, was "by far the best Gary Morris show I have ever witnessed." He went on to tell me how incredible the sound in the room was, and how intimate of a setting our venue was. 


That sentiment has been repeated over and over again with most every show we have produced in the series. The bottom line is that Real Music impacts the listener in ways most people don't expect, nor have they experienced before in a live music setting. Your generous support will help us continue to not only impact audiences in the future, but artists as well. Here are a few sentiments from just a couple of artists who have performed in our first season;


"Tonyâ€™s 'Real Music @ 166' concerts have been extraordinary performance experiences for me as an artist. Theatre 166 is clearly an outstanding concert setting; built and operated by the passionate, dedicated and professional crew behind the scenes at each show. Tony has a vision and a gift for presenting a live music experience that is simply top-notch for artist and audience alike." -Woody Russell


"I enjoyed the sound of the room more than any venue I've played in recent years, and I loved working with Tony Brown, Steve Garret and David Knight. It's not often I play a venue I am so impressed with that I make a mental note to catch someone elses show there. This venue did just that. Theater 166 is one of those venues that will change the dynamics of live music. They are bringing back the roots of music through live performances by enabling the artist and audience to interact in a perfect flow of energy. I thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience, and would recommend it to anyone in the Dallas area. If you haven't seen what Theater 166 is doing yet, You need to check it out- it's one of a kind."- Emily Grace Clark  


What We Need & What You Get

Doing this type of hi definition show, requires a significant financial investment. We do everything within our power to keep our costs to a minimum. We have an all volunteer staff who give freely of their time and talents, and some of the best production people in the Dallas area are on our team. Still, the truth of the matter is, it takes a lot of money to produce this caliber of show. 


We have set our goal at only $10,000. 


That is the minimum amount needed(of course we would love to raise even more) to cover expenses such as venue overhead, artists honorariums, and a small amount of advertising. The more we can raise, the more advertising we can afford, and subsequently the more folks will find out about us. Since we are a small venue, seating only 150 patrons, our goal is to keep ticket prices affordable for real people. Let's face it, in our current economic climate it is difficult for most people to find discretionary funds for entertainment. Our goal is to keep our shows within the reach of real people like you. Should we fail to completely meet our $10000 goal, we may be forced to do fewer shows, or quite possibly no shows at all. Regardless, any and all monies raised here will go directly to funding the shows we book for 2012.


We have set up some perks for you as well. Regardless if you are a corporation, business, group, or individual, you can give.  Depending on the amount you give, season tickets, All access passes, VIP seating, and VIP entrance to the venue are available as perks. Even limited access to the artists greenroom to meet them face to face are available. (see column on the right for more details on Perks). But don't be intimidated by the amounts, any amount you want to give will help, and small gifts can add up fast. Even if you can only do a few dollars right now, every little bit will help. Some of you may be able to give even more, so by all means feel free to do so.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends! Even if you are unable to contribute financially at this time, you can still help. By posting our link to all of your social media sites such as Facebook, Myspace, Twitter, and others, your websites, or by sending it to your email or business contacts, you will help spread the word about this exceptional musical experience, and in so doing increase our chances to continue on in 2012.
story_txt:
Our Story


Imagine if you will, you are seated front center, the show is about to begin, the stage lights come up and your favorite local, regional, even national band or singer is about to take the stage. You are not in a giant arena or outdoor sports complex or stadium, surrounded by thousands of loud, drunk people who don't seem interested in the music at all. No, you are seated in a beautiful theatre in the round, literally only a few feet from where the stars come out and play. It's almost like sitting in your living room at home. The music begins to play, and it's as if you're a part of the music, not merely listening to it. 
This is hi definition music. 
You are immersed in the musical experience, and  the quality of the sound is second to none. Whether it's Blues, Jazz, Country, Roots, Soul, Funk, Americana, Bluegrass, Country, or even World music, in this space, quite frankly, it all Rocks. It's right there in front of you. So close you could reach out and touch it. The heart of the artists, and their stories are the focus. Whether it is a world renowned, Grammy winning artist, or a relatively unknown up and comer, the art of the song is the star, and not merely the background noise. It's clarity. It's clean. It's hi definition.
This is "Real Music @ 166."
With a very successful nine show "Season one" under our belt, we are eagerly anticipating even better things for Season two. World renown singer/songwriter Gary Morris graced our stage for our debut performance in April. Nashville songwriting ace Gary Nicholson, whose songs have been recorded by the biggest stars in Country, and Blues music, appeared twice during our inaugural run. Heck, we were even paid a visit by Paula Nelson (yes, Willie's daughter) and her amazing band. Woody Russell also played the series twice, bringing with him a TV crew from the new hit show "Troubadour Tx", now you can see images of our show on nationwide television.
All in all, not a bad first year. If you were fortunate enough to make one, or more, of our shows, then you know what an amazing experience it was.We would really like to see you come back in 2012 for even more great shows. Many have told me they knew nothing of our series. They had no idea our theater even existed, and that's not surprising. You see, It cost a lot of money to keep live music alive in the suburbs. Money for advertising, and promotion is so very hard to come by for a small venue such as ours. 
That's where you can help. Your generous support is needed to allow this series to not only continue, but to thrive. The bottom line is we need your help to move forward in 2012. We are currently working on booking another series of amazing shows for season two, one about every six weeks or so. But we have to cover our expenses in order to continue bringing you this wonderful musical experience. Won't you help us get the word out to more and more people in the greater Dallas Ft. Worth area? Together, we can keep live music alive in the suburbs. 
Real Heart, Real Soul, Real Music at 166. 




The Impact
Gary Morris, world renowned singer/songwriter/actor, officially kicked off Real Music at 166 in April of 2011, with a stellar performance. Following that first show, a gentleman who was in the audience that night pulled me aside and told me he had seen Gary perform many times over the years, in many different venues, and this performance, in this venue, was "by far the best Gary Morris show I have ever witnessed." He went on to tell me how incredible the sound in the room was, and how intimate of a setting our venue was. 

That sentiment has been repeated over and over again with most every show we have produced in the series. The bottom line is that Real Music impacts the listener in ways most people don't expect, nor have they experienced before in a live music setting. Your generous support will help us continue to not only impact audiences in the future, but artists as well. Here are a few sentiments from just a couple of artists who have performed in our first season;

"Tonyâ€™s 'Real Music @ 166' concerts have been extraordinary performance experiences for me as an artist. Theatre 166 is clearly an outstanding concert setting; built and operated by the passionate, dedicated and professional crew behind the scenes at each show. Tony has a vision and a gift for presenting a live music experience that is simply top-notch for artist and audience alike." -Woody Russell

"I enjoyed the sound of the room more than any venue I've played in recent years, and I loved working with Tony Brown, Steve Garret and David Knight. It's not often I play a venue I am so impressed with that I make a mental note to catch someone elses show there. This venue did just that. Theater 166 is one of those venues that will change the dynamics of live music. They are bringing back the roots of music through live performances by enabling the artist and audience to interact in a perfect flow of energy. I thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience, and would recommend it to anyone in the Dallas area. If you haven't seen what Theater 166 is doing yet, You need to check it out- it's one of a kind."- Emily Grace Clark  


What We Need & What You Get
Doing this type of hi definition show, requires a significant financial investment. We do everything within our power to keep our costs to a minimum. We have an all volunteer staff who give freely of their time and talents, and some of the best production people in the Dallas area are on our team. Still, the truth of the matter is, it takes a lot of money to produce this caliber of show. 

We have set our goal at only $10,000. 

That is the minimum amount needed(of course we would love to raise even more) to cover expenses such as venue overhead, artists honorariums, and a small amount of advertising. The more we can raise, the more advertising we can afford, and subsequently the more folks will find out about us. Since we are a small venue, seating only 150 patrons, our goal is to keep ticket prices affordable for real people. Let's face it, in our current economic climate it is difficult for most people to find discretionary funds for entertainment. Our goal is to keep our shows within the reach of real people like you. Should we fail to completely meet our $10000 goal, we may be forced to do fewer shows, or quite possibly no shows at all. Regardless, any and all monies raised here will go directly to funding the shows we book for 2012.

We have set up some perks for you as well. Regardless if you are a corporation, business, group, or individual, you can give.  Depending on the amount you give, season tickets, All access passes, VIP seating, and VIP entrance to the venue are available as perks. Even limited access to the artists greenroom to meet them face to face are available. (see column on the right for more details on Perks). But don't be intimidated by the amounts, any amount you want to give will help, and small gifts can add up fast. Even if you can only do a few dollars right now, every little bit will help. Some of you may be able to give even more, so by all means feel free to do so.

Other Ways You Can Help
Tell your friends! Even if you are unable to contribute financially at this time, you can still help. By posting our link to all of your social media sites such as Facebook, Myspace, Twitter, and others, your websites, or by sending it to your email or business contacts, you will help spread the word about this exceptional musical experience, and in so doing increase our chances to continue on in 2012.

story:
Sung for the first time by the newly formed Ulali Project this Idle No More song is dedicated to the founding women of this powerful grassroots movement. It was performed at the UNC Givens Performing Arts Center in Pembroke, NC. Presented by the 4th Annual River People Music & Culture Fest. There was a specific request for this lyric video of Idle No More.

At the same concert some of the Deer Clan Singers joined  the Ulali Project.

In creating and recording a contemporary spin on traditional songs Ulali Project is honored to perform with the Deer Clan Singers. The Deer Clan Singers of the Tuscarora Nation are lead by Dave Locklear, Mark Deese, Pura Fé and Chad Locklear. Together, the Deer Clan Singers are educators. They travel to native community schools, centers, festivals and perform abroad singing Tutelo-Tuscarora and Iroquois Social Dance Songs.


DAY 16 of 60 UPDATE

Album and Tee Shirt Artwork

Album title and autographs to come

 

What We Want

In this digital age original languages and storytelling in Indian country is enjoying a tremendous revival. The success of the group Ulali many years ago as a cross over a capella phenomenon group is still being enjoyed today. There has never been a follow up album like the Ulali’s Mahk Jchi…until now. With Pura Fé’s formation of the Ulali Project we, Tâpwê Production Projects and Nueva Onda Records are announcing the crowdfunding campaign for a brand new ULALI PROJECT album!
 
How to produce an album and new videos with without any money? You don’t and we can’t either…but produce we must!  With your help we’ll have a new ULALI PROJECT album and music videos done in time to celebrate a new year… It’s been a long time coming!!!
 
What We Need
 
We are all involved in grass roots projects from Honor the Earth, Idle No More,  etc., to stop pipelines, to stop GMOs, to stop fracking and the list goes on. But this grass roots movement is for creating music. It is a grassroots way that supporters can help a band produce music uninfluenced by commercialism. We can also report exactly where those hard earned dollars are going. Currently Nueva Onda Records produced and markets Pura Fé’s Sacred Seed Album in Europe and we are extremely pleased to announce they will also promote and distribute Ulali Project’s new album.
 
Doing good work does cost. With the opportunity afforded by Indiegogo we can show you how every penny will be spent. We are using Indiegogo’s Flexible Funding which means if we don't reach our goal, we are still getting the money that is raised. Regardless, we are ready to deliver this thing however our funding plays out ‘cause…if at first…
 
Oh and remember, anything that is available in perks is exclusive to this funding campaign. The CD, tee shirt, tie dyed shirt and skirt are all designed for this funding campaign only. None of them will ever be printed again. It’s a prize celebrating the Ulali Project’s first album.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
 
Spread the word! Tell your family and friends. Not all of us have money we can spend easily and we know everyone can’t. But share our page and spread the word if you like Ulali Project’s music. We know how far social networking can take us…posting links will take us around the world.
 
SUMMARY BUDGET
 

ABLE TO GIVE MORE THAN $500? HANG IN THERE!

WE'RE COMING UP WITH MORE PERKS!

To enter amounts other than what's listed click "BACK IT" and Thank you for spending time with us..

story:
Our Story

My name is Fiona Hare, I am a singer songwriter from Cape Town, recording my first album.
I need to raise a total of R 30,000.00 in order to do this (US $ 4,200.00) The idea is that you help me raise the money by pre-ordering albums, by pledging money. Even if we don’t reach our target, the project will still go ahead and you will receive your album.

What We Need & What You Get

I am recording 10 songs. Each song costs R 3,000.00. This includes the:

  • Producer Fee
  • Studio Time
  • Mastering
  • Printing Costs

If you donate R 100.00 (US $ 15.00) then you will receive a copy of the album when it's done. If you are feeling philanthropic feel free to pledge more.

EFT OPTION

If Paypal or Credit Card Payment doesn't suit you can do an EFT bank transfer.
Please include your name and cell number in reference.

BANK DETAILS:

Fiona Jean Hare, Standard Bank, Branch no: 051001, Acc no: 271183225

Other Ways You Can Help

Unleash the speech! Tell your friends, spread the word, and make some noise about this campaign!

Listen to a demo here.

story:
Our Story

Based in Jacksonville, Florida and conducted by Dr. Cara Tasher, the UNF Chamber Singers' recent milestones include a concert tour to Italy (May 2010),  our "when i sing" CD  (May 2011), performance of the National Anthem live on CNN for the 2012 Florida Presidential Debate (January 2012), and then live on NPR First Coast Connect.

From 29 April-10 May 2012, we will be on tour in South Africa. The ensemble will sing with students from Jacksonville's sister city Nelson Mandela Metropolitan University which happens to have a stellar choral program led by Junita L. van Dijk. We will also perform alongside the University of Cape Town Choir, South Cape Children's Choir at St. George's Cathedral, The Frank Peterson School of Music Choir in Paarl and the Pro Cantu Youth Choir in Cape Town.

The Impact

This tour offers us a chance to cross cultural borders. For many of us, this is the first opportunity to travel internationally. We will perform concerts of diverse repertoire, including a commissioned work for SATB chorus and cello by renowned American composer Daniel Bernard Roumain commissioned by Dr. Nick Curry.

In addition to acting as singing ambassadors for both UNF and the USA, we hope to demonstrate a successful model of diversity in a country where the vestiges of apartheid are still prominent. Through our music-making, we hope to show that cultural boundaries can be overcome, while expanding our own perceptions of the world.

What WE Need & What YOU Get

The overall tour budget is $100,000 including airfare, lodging, food, performance venues, and on-land educational experiences. We are currently raising money through donations, selling our new CD, and booking concerts. Please help us make this trip a reality! This transformational learning experience will enrich our lives, edify us culturally while contributing to global peace and understanding.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please SHARE this page with your social network via email or on Facebook, Twitter, or Tumblr. We’ll be updating this page often with new information for our supporters.

For booking information or if you interested in making a gift of an even greater impact, please contact Dr. Cara Tasher at cara.tasher@unf.edu.

To donate directly to the choral program AND receive a tax deduction, visit: 

https://www.alumni.unf.edu/netcommunity/sslpage.aspx?pid=532

story:
Summary

We are Ricardo Cornelius and Cristi Garbo, we are professional clowns, and passionate about music. We have created a musical duo that combines comedy and music ...


We want to record our first album!

There are several people who, at the end of the function we wonder if we have a sound record, and we thought it could be a great idea. The disc will engrave cha-cha-cha, rock and roll, boleros, finally, a very varied format for everyone. We use musical instruments, but mostly sounds that can be linked with comic gags. We have the advice of a professional musician, who will play music producer, also we want to record with guest musicians, with whom we have always wanted to work.

We would love to be supporting our project, with your help we can realize this dream. We believe that music and humor are two elements of the arts that help make this a more harmonious world. All collaboration is good. We are sure to reach the goal with your help!
?
?

What we need, and what you get

?
We have numbers and we have seen that we need 2500 euros for the production of our album

We are a self-managed company. We know well the obstacles that has the artist to make your work a success. For all this it is that, in our project found another way to reach the public, a more affordable way to live our show.?

The money raised will go into the recording room, payment for services of music producer, layout and design of the disc.

We have very tempting rewards for supporting our project!
    ?
?

The impact

?
We love to support our project!

We believe that music and humor are two elements of the arts that help make this a more harmonious world.

All collaboration is good. They can help us from 10 euros, and also spreading the campaign.

Let's create echo, echo, echo, eeeecooooo!
Please, use the tools to share that will be in indiegogo, our blog, and Facebook page. We are sure to reach the goal with your help!

With your help we can realize this dream. :O)

story:
OUR STORY

LUX began at the end of 2012, just a few months after Jake was on Season 7 of the TV show America's Got Talent. After the show, we began playing with another band and also started a side project as a duo. Shortly after, the side project became the main project and LUX was born in the Summer of 2014. Since 2014, we have: 

  • Recorded and released a self-titled EP
  • Released two music videos 
  • Opened for a variety of artists such as Andy Grammar, Ingrid Michelson, Phillip Phillips and DEV

We like to describe our music as synth pop with indie rock flavors. Ivy sings and plays a full acoustic drum set, electric drum pad, while Jake sings and plays keyboards and a keytar. We aim to write honest lyrics that are always close to our heart and tell our real stories. In addition to writing our own lyrics, we also produce original synth tracks. 

WHERE WE ARE NOW

In August of 2015, Jake moved to Nashville to attend Belmont University for Songwriting and Music Business and just recently started writing for Sony/ATV Music Publishing. Ivy is currently in Springfield, MO playing drums for an awesome '90s cover band and working her "big kid job" at the bank. Despite being 400 miles apart, we decided that LUX could not be stopped by distance. Like any band with a dream and an internet connection, we downloaded Skype and began the process of writing our full-length album, PAX! 

Yes, you heard it right. We wrote an entire album over Skype and we LOVE how it turned out! 

WHY WE DO THIS

We are very dedicated to making music. We are especially passionate about making music that resonates with people and real life. We write music to inspire people! Sometimes writing real, heartfelt lyrics means bringing back memories of unhappy times--but we are always writing for the purpose of bringing ourselves and the world to a better place. 

Our album is called PAX for a reason--by definition it means, the kiss of peace. We wrote this album looking back at our youth, our mistakes, and what we've learned from them. It is retrospective of our past and also introspective of where we are now--a place of peace. 

OUR GOALS AND YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS

Recording and releasing an album comes with a quite a few line item expenses that are typically covered by a record label--but we're doing this independently! We've already managed to fund ourselves up until this point and now we need your help to reach the goals we want to achieve in the future! 

By pledging today, you are helping us make this dream a reality! In addition to the direct rewards you'll be getting, your contributions will be going towards: 

  • Paying for Mixing and Mastering
  • Music video and photoshoots
  • Ordering physical CDs
  • Merchandise (t-shirts, posters, etc)

Please remember that if you want to help but don't really care about the rewards you can always enter ANY dollar amount on the pledge page... even as little as $1! Every little bit helps and every single pledge is so appreciated!

Your contribution is VERY important to us--if we have any money that comes in over $4000 it will go to good use. We are asking for the lowest possible amount we need to complete this album. However, with any additional funds we can make even more will happen like funding our tour, radio campaign, and PR. 

We PROMISE to put your money to good use. LUX works hard, LUX wants to go far! But alone, we can only do so much. So we need YOU! 

PLEDGES + REWARDS

You can support the PAX album pressing and release by pledging to our project. In return, you’ll receive the incentive package of your choice as a special thank you! see rewards on the right >>>>

We are really excited to have you partner with us! Some of these rewards are very personalized with a special LUX touch.

HELP US SPREAD THE WORD

  • Sharing is caring: Share on your Facebook with friends! If you believe in us, ask your friends to believe in us too! 
  • Use the campaign hashtag: #LUXPAX 
  • Follow LUX on Instagram and Twitter @luxsucks

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

One of the bigger challenges of this project is getting the rewards to you, our amazing backers! We’ll work hard to get them shipped to you on time, but as you know, there’s always the possibility that things go a little slower than expected, which could cause a delay. We promise to do our best, and we’ll keep you in the loop with updates.

You guys are so amazing!! We literally have the BEST fans in the world and we are SO grateful for the support.

Let's DO THIS!! 

- Jake and Ivy // LUX 

xx

In August of 2015, Jake moved to Nashville to attend Belmont University for Songwriting and Music Business and just recently started writing for Sony/ATV Music Publishing. Ivy is currently in Springfield, MO playing drums for an awesome '90s cover band and working her "big kid job" at the bank. Despite being 400 miles apart, we decided that LUX could not be stopped by distance. Like any band with a dream and an internet connection, we downloaded Skype and began the process of writing our full-length album, PAX! 
Yes, you heard it right. We wrote an entire album over Skype and we LOVE how it turned out! 
WHY WE DO THIS
We are very dedicated to making music. We are especially passionate about making music that resonates with people and real life. We write music to inspire people! Sometimes writing real, heartfelt lyrics means bringing back memories of unhappy times--but we are always writing for the purpose of bringing ourselves and the world to a better place. 
Our album is called PAX for a reason--by definition it means, the kiss of peace. We wrote this album looking back at our youth, our mistakes, and what we've learned from them. It is retrospective of our past and also introspective of where we are now--a place of peace. 


OUR GOALS AND YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS
Recording and releasing an album comes with a quite a few line item expenses that are typically covered by a record label--but we're doing this independently! We've already managed to fund ourselves up until this point and now we need your help to reach the goals we want to achieve in the future! By pledging today, you are helping us make this dream a reality! In addition to the direct rewards you'll be getting, your contributions will be going towards: 
Paying for Mixing and Mastering
Music video and photoshoots
Ordering physical CDs
Merchandise (t-shirts, posters, etc)
Please remember that if you want to help but don't really care about the rewards you can always enter ANY dollar amount on the pledge page... even as little as $1! Every little bit helps and every single pledge is so appreciated!Your contribution is VERY important to us--if we have any money that comes in over $4000 it will go to good use. We are asking for the lowest possible amount we need to complete this album. However, with any additional funds we can make even more will happen like funding our tour, radio campaign, and PR. We PROMISE to put your money to good use. LUX works hard, LUX wants to go far! But alone, we can only do so much. So we need YOU! PLEDGES + REWARDSYou can support the PAX album pressing and release by pledging to our project. In return, you’ll receive the incentive package of your choice as a special thank you! see rewards on the right >>>>We are really excited to have you partner with us! Some of these rewards are very personalized with a special LUX touch.HELP US SPREAD THE WORD
Sharing is caring: Share on your Facebook with friends! If you believe in us, ask your friends to believe in us too! 
Use the campaign hashtag: #LUXPAX 
Follow LUX on Instagram and Twitter @luxsucks




RISKS AND CHALLENGES

One of the bigger challenges of this project is getting the rewards to you, our amazing backers! We’ll work hard to get them shipped to you on time, but as you know, there’s always the possibility that things go a little slower than expected, which could cause a delay. We promise to do our best, and we’ll keep you in the loop with updates.
You guys are so amazing!! We literally have the BEST fans in the world and we are SO grateful for the support.
Let's DO THIS!! 
- Jake and Ivy // LUX 
xx

story:
Hi, I’m Zave Nathan, and this is take 2 of my pitch video, since I didn’t seem to get the concept across in my first run, so here goes….

What is my goal in creating this next album?  I am not attempting to launch myself out into the world as the Next Big Artist.  I am not marketing myself as a Singer, since my  French accent is not an asset as an American performer.  I don’t have a band and I am not gigging.

My talent and my passion is writing songs, playing guitar, arranging and producing.  I have been blessed to be recognized by a couple of music companies who want to represent my songs for licensing, and compilation distribution.  I am also shopping songs to Big Name Artists to record.  I want this next album to showcase my songwriting talents, by using vocalists who have Star Quality voices, and expanding my production capabilities by utilizing a professional studio to add the richness of multiple layers of tracks beyond the limitations of my home studio. 

The reason I can produce songs at about $1,000 per song is that I can save money by producing many of the tracks in my home-studio before sending them out to a professional studio that can then take the songs to the next level.  Because of my friendships in the business, I can get a discounted rate on pro studio time.  I will work out deals with singers and other musicians—I’d like to add real drums to these tracks instead of using my drum program.

I will highlight both male and female singers on this album.  I may sing some harmonies myself here and there, but my goal is not to highlight my voice, but to produce a Compilation CD that is absolutely of Star Quality in every aspect: the story-telling of the song, the structure and arrangements, the instrumentation, and amazing vocals with top quality production value.  This gives me high quality product to put in the pipeline, and will open up the playing field for me exponentially!  (I may even inadvertently help a budding star singer get the exposure they need to get noticed.)

I realize that many of us, myself included, are feeling the pinch of our shrinking economy, and it isn’t easy to squeeze out a donation, even for a cause we believe in.  But without your help, I will not be able to enhance the production value beyond what I can accomplish in my home studio.  By pushing this project up to “the next octave” of quality, it will make all the difference in who will take the time to listen to these songs, who will place them, and where.

The songs I have chosen for this next album relate to the joys, the sorrows, and the wackiness of what it means to be a human being trying to navigate life on this beautiful planet of ours.  These songs are about life, love and the pursuit of happiness!  They are fun and uplifting with sexy bluesy overtones.  I can’t wait to share them with you.

While my goal is to raise $12,000, it seems unlikely at this late juncture in the campaign that I will reach anywhere near this level. I will be able to produce one song for each $1,200 increment received (which comes to about $1,000 after all the fees are deducted), and if the total received is less than $1,000, I will use the funds as best I can to maximize the production value of one song, probably by paying for singer and/or drummer’s services.

The perks are self-explanatory...and fairly "usual" other than a couple of chances to spend some time with me in the studio, to observe or to participate creatively on a song, or to go on a wine-tasting afternoon with me in my 'hood in the mountains.

I want to thank my early supporters for taking the plunge in helping me take my craft up one notch which can completely change the playing field for me.  If you are still on the fence thinking about possibly making a donation, now is the time...with less than 2 weeks left! 

Everyone who donates will be mentioned in the Thank Yous in the liner notes.
We’re all in this together!  Thanks from the bottom of my heart.

Much Love & Appreciation,

Zave

story:
KYAQ has a great space for its studio, and all of us who have volunteered for this project are really excited about being just weeks away from getting on the air. The transmitter and antenna are being installed even as you read this, but they need their studio partners to make local radio happen!

Not a lot of communities have the opportunity to build a full-power community-operated radio station. But by January 4, 2014, the Oregon central coast WILL have its own local public radio station at FM 91.7, thanks to all the support and enthusiasm from the community. Thanks to them, YOU will own the airwaves! However, until KYAQ has studio equipment, community members will not be able to create programs the community wants to hear!

Your tax-deductible gifts will purchase important equipment like CD players for music shows, microphones for Finding Your Voice, even a special box to put telephone calls on the air -- pretty important for local news and talk shows. And then there is the mixing board, microphones, wind screens, mic stands, cords, connectors...back-of-the-house necessities like distribution amplifiers, switchers and Anzo brushes (ok... that last item is made up, and we stole it from Dilbert).

We DO have a turntable, donated by a 50-something DJ wannabee who never quite made it on the music scene. But right now it is like the cheese. It stands alone.

The fundraising goal is $6,000, but we need to raise more than that to have a completely functional studio, so please be generous!

If the studio equipment is inadequate, we won't attract enough volunteers to train and create compelling local programming! But the reward of a successful fundraiser is that YOU will own the airwaves.

Please donate -- and then spread the word. Use the built-in IndieGoGo share tools to make this a smashing success!

KYAQ is: Central Oregon coast folks -- you and your friends and neighbors -- who understand the value in having locally controlled media from Lincoln County and for Lincoln County; volunteers who have given their time, their money, and nearly seven years of ceaseless effort to get KYAQ on the air; artists, musicians, teachers, retirees, students, talkers, and recluses; readers, writers, and raconteurs. You will hear us soon -- at FM 91.7!

story:
The Lady Comes First is the collaborative effort of Adrian Emberley and Shoney Lamar, two singer songwriters who have been honing their craft since adolescence. Forming in Boston but recently transplanted to North Carolina, the two are having a good year. They've crammed three separate tours in, and have finally finished their new full-length album, d'elinore. A big jump from their first recordings, this one is huge, with arrangements spanning from piano and ukulele to bleating horns and piles of chains. We're super excited for people to hear this thing. That's where you come in.


We're looking to raise 6,000 dollars to put out this album our way. Proceeds will go towards starting our own record label, printing vinyl, hiring a publicist and a booking agent. Your contributions also come with the perks listed over there, such as limited edition swag, hand-made voodoo dolls, and more!


If you don't have the extra dough to contribute, you can still help! Share our campaign via your social networking sites, tell your co-workers (even that guy you hate), and anyone you think would be interested in supporting the arts!


Check out our newest music video:

story:
Our Story

Happy Tuesday, January 18th! I'm Joy Valencia a singer and songwriter, my music is heavily inspired by my favorite artists of the 60s. You can hear my music at http://listn.to/JoyValenciaMusic. 

I'm currently in the process of recording my very first album and have not shopped to anyone nor am I backed by any label or company atm. We are trying to shoot my very FIRST music video for my song "Don't Wake the Lion" this weekend and could REALLY use your help in raising some funds to make sure that all costs are covered. Boy oh boy do we need your help to make this happen!


The Impact

First of all, the crew has donated their time and are all legit professionals in the film industry. Unfortunately, if we do not raise part of the funds by this weekend, all of our hard work, and even the opportunity to make this video will vanish.  It just so happen to be a perfect time of year when people in the film industry are not on major jobs yet, but we loose 80% of our talented crew after Monday when many of them start work on new jobs. I cannot stress to you how much your help will save our efforts and allow us to pull this video off.

Secondly, artists in today's music industry need a video and I feel as though It's an absolute essential piece of my puzzle. No one has seen me in this kind of format yet, they know I'm a singer/songwriter, but I have not had the opportunity to truly show myself as a performer and an artist. The concept by award winning director, Erin E. Cantelo, is so creative and really fun. Imagine me in the desert, a nomad, in search of the elusive "Glitterfoot" (imagine Bigfoot, but made of gold, sparkly tinsel) who may just be the key to a personal and emotional freedom that I've been searching for. It packs some interesting emotions, while still captures my very playful side - I mean dude, we have a 6'5" Gold Bigfoot! It's gonna be a blast.

To tell you a little about our killer team who are all donating their time, hard work, and talents. Our incredible Cinematographer, Christian Sprenger, just shot a video for the multi-Grammy nominated The Black Keys "Howlin' For You". You can check him out here: http://sprengerdp.com. Our amazing director, Erin E. Cantelo, has really pushed the creative bounds with the concept of the video while still remaining ultra-low budget. You can check out some of her work here: http://ecantelo.com. The Production Designer, Elvis Restaino is beyond talented and has had his work featured in Architectural Digest for his design of Gerard Buttler's NY loft among other things: http://elvisr.com. Our ENTIRE crew is working for free on this video.

I'll be posting behind the scenes videos in real time this weekend so you can see our progress. However, although part of the budget and the entire crew of amazing people are in place, we need your help to make the video actually happen! No donation is too small and any and ALL help is so greatly appreciated!


What We Need & What You Get

We're trying to raise money to cover food and lodging for 14 crew members for 2 nights (who by the way, will be sharing rooms, we're not being frivolous), gas and transportation to the desert, wardrobe, art department, makeup, and some equipment. The entire crew is donating their time, and the DP is donating a full Red MX camera package to the project. 

We are shooting the video at the strange and mesmerizing Salton Sea to give the video a really interesting and unique aesthetic.  You can check out some pictures of the locations here:

http://swittersb.files.wordpress.com/2009/11/salton-sea-3-small.jpg

http://parkerlab.bio.uci.edu/pictures/photography%20pictures/Salton%20Sea%20sunset.jpg

http://www.oceanlight.com/stock-photo/bombay-beach-salton-sea-photo-22488-357661.jp

If you've ever wanted to support me or indie music, this is the moment! The deadline is this Fri at 7pm PDT (3 days from now). Any amount truly helps! IF we raise any additional money, it will go towards finishing my album and towards paying my live band for the shows I'm gearing up to do.

I would love to have you as PART of my story. Every contributor will see their name in the credits under Thank You's. Other perks you can get are various levels of a credit as a producer on the video, signed photos and DVD's of the video, a skype serenade, and even a song written for you personally by moi!


Other Ways You Can Help

Simply posting this on your facebook or twitter helps greatly because you never know who would like to become a part of this process! Please pass this along!

Thank you again for any and all help!

Other Ways You Can HelpSimply posting this on your facebook or twitter helps greatly because you never know who would like to become a part of this process! Please pass this along!Thank you again for any and all help!

story:
exhAust: producing a big concert of new Australian music in New York City on October 18th, 2011 @ Galapagos!

Sure, Australia is full of deadly snakes, poisonous spiders, ferocious sharks and terrifying drop-bears. But it's also a nation bursting with talent and innovation in everything from agriculture to zoology and from film to music. The talents of Australian musicians and composers are recognized across the globe as being world-class...when they manage to travel beyond our sunny, sunburned shores! You see, it's a long commute from the Sydney Opera House to SoHo NY, making it tough for emerging Australian composers to gain much-deserved exposure overseas.

So....enter>

exhAust!  exhAust is bringing new Australian music across the seas into the bright, bright lights of New York City. We are a brand-new ensemble of top-notch Australian ex-pat musicians who call the Big Apple home. We're passionate about playing Australian music. We want to provide opportunities and exposure for talented emerging Australian composers to have their music heard in one of the biggest cultural hot-spots on the planet.

And...we are absolutely thrilled to announce our debut concert on October 18th 2011 at the Galapagos Arts Space in Dumbo, New York. Galapagos is a beautiful, intimate club and performance space filled nightly with stunning concerts - from new, experimental, contemporary genres, cabaret, and opera, to rock and jazz.

Our Galapagos debut program features an unbelievable cross section of the latest Australian-grown talent. The music has everything - it's got funk, lyricism, total chill vibes, drama, harmony, rhythm, texture, joy and sadness.

Here it is:

Teeth by Julian Day

Migration by Nadje Noordhuis

Reverie by William Gardiner

Bloodline by Kate Moore

Happy Deathday Mister Robot! by Michael Sollis

Exh-Aust-ed and Jet-Lagged by Fiona Fraser

Good Times! by Tim Hansen


What a night! What a line-up!!

(And by the way these Australian composers wrote and adapted these works especially for exhAust)


And now....here is the exhAust line-up of performers - featuring some of the most brilliant Australian (!) chamber musicians and three awesome New Yorker free-lancers:


Eileen Mack  - clarinet and bass clarinet

Nadje Noordhuis - trumpet and flugel horn

Peter Wise  - drum set and percussion

Nicole Brady - keyboard and piano

Lisa Moore  - keyboard, piano and acting artistic producer

Ezra Seltzer - cello

Lisa Dowling - double bass

Ted Hearne - conductor

Tim Hansen - artistic director, composer and conductor


Please check out our website for more information, photos, bios and artist links on ExhAust.


SO......to sum up:

We have a concert space.

We have musicians.

We have composers.

We have a large enough supply of Tim-Tams to get us through rehearsals.

And the press are invited.........


Now we need to raise the funds to make this happen!


Why we need the cash? Concerts are expensive to produce!

Seriously, we need money for two principal reasons:
1. to cover production costs for our debut concert on Oct 18th
2. and to put us on firm footing to approach other funding bodies for future funding.
We need to pay specifically for these things:
1. Rehearsal space (28 hrs)
2. Cartage/transport of instruments and equipment rental for rehearsals and concert
3. Musicians fees
4. Promotion and publicity of the group, including photography, a professional website, and documentation (both audio and video) of the concert.*

*Production and documentation of a professional concert will enable us to put our best foot forward when approaching future funding bodies like the Australia Council, AACP, and other American/Australian philanthropic organisations, allowing us to continue to offer young Australian composers opportunities to have their works heard in an international setting.

In short, the money you contribute to this fundraising campaign will provide us with the initial funds we need to ensure that exhAust gets off the ground, plays well and covers costs on October 18 and continues its mission to perform Australian music in NYC!

WE MUST RAISE $4000 BY OCTOBER 10TH 2011. PLEASE HELP US!


EVEN $5 or $10 HELPS! EVERY BIT COUNTS!!! PLEASE GIVE!


And please spread the word!

You've come this far, so if you like exhAust, why not share the love with friends and family? Use the "share" tools on this page, or email the URL to everyone in your address book!

And thank you, in advance, because we really appreciate your support.

Forever yours,
Tim Hansen and all of us at exhAust

exhAust: new concert music - out of Australia

We are a brand-new ensemble of top-notch Australian ex-pat musicians who call the Big Apple home. We're passionate about playing Australian music. We want to provide opportunities and exposure for talented emerging Australian composers to have their music heard in one of the biggest cultural hot-spots on the planet.
And...we are absolutely thrilled to announce our debut concert on October 18th 2011 at the Galapagos Arts Space in Dumbo, New York. Galapagos is a beautiful, intimate club and performance space filled nightly with stunning concerts - from new, experimental, contemporary genres, cabaret, and opera, to rock and jazz. 
Our Galapagos debut program features an unbelievable cross section of the latest Australian-grown talent. The music has everything - it's got funk, lyricism, total chill vibes, drama, harmony, rhythm, texture, joy and sadness. 
Here it is:
Teeth by Julian Day
Migration by Nadje Noordhuis
Reverie by William Gardiner
Bloodline by Kate Moore
Happy Deathday Mister Robot! by Michael Sollis
Exh-Aust-ed and Jet-Lagged by Fiona Fraser
Good Times! by Tim Hansen

What a night! What a line-up!!
(And by the way these Australian composers wrote and adapted these works especially for exhAust) 

And now....here is the exhAust line-up of performers - featuring some of the most brilliant Australian (!) chamber musicians and three awesome New Yorker free-lancers:

Eileen Mack  - clarinet and bass clarinet
Nadje Noordhuis - trumpet and flugel horn
Peter Wise  - drum set and percussion 
Nicole Brady - keyboard and piano
Lisa Moore  - keyboard, piano and acting artistic producer
Ezra Seltzer - cello
Lisa Dowling - double bass
Ted Hearne - conductor
Tim Hansen - artistic director, composer and conductor

Please check out our website for more information, photos, bios and artist links on ExhAust.

SO......to sum up:
We have a concert space. 
We have musicians. 
We have composers. 
We have a large enough supply of Tim-Tams to get us through rehearsals.
And the press are invited.........

Now we need to raise the funds to make this happen!
Why we need the cash? Concerts are expensive to produce!

Seriously, we need money for two principal reasons: 1. to cover production costs for our debut concert on Oct 18th2. and to put us on firm footing to approach other funding bodies for future funding. We need to pay specifically for these things:1. Rehearsal space (28 hrs)2. Cartage/transport of instruments and equipment rental for rehearsals and concert3. Musicians fees4. Promotion and publicity of the group, including photography, a professional website, and documentation (both audio and video) of the concert.**Production and documentation of a professional concert will enable us to put our best foot forward when approaching future funding bodies like the Australia Council, AACP, and other American/Australian philanthropic organisations, allowing us to continue to offer young Australian composers opportunities to have their works heard in an international setting.In short, the money you contribute to this fundraising campaign will provide us with the initial funds we need to ensure that exhAust gets off the ground, plays well and covers costs on October 18 and continues its mission to perform Australian music in NYC!WE MUST RAISE $4000 BY OCTOBER 10TH 2011. PLEASE HELP US! 

EVEN $5 or $10 HELPS! EVERY BIT COUNTS!!! PLEASE GIVE!

And please spread the word!
You've come this far, so if you like exhAust, why not share the love with friends and family? Use the "share" tools on this page, or email the URL to everyone in your address book!And thank you, in advance, because we really appreciate your support.Forever yours,Tim Hansen and all of us at exhAustexhAust: new concert music - out of Australia

story:
Quelques informations 

Après 7 ans de tournée, deux albums, des planchers de danse remplis, Misses Satchmo continue dans le répertoire de Louis Armstrong et entame la production de son troisième album "Is that all there is". Le titre fait référence à une pièce de Peggy Lee, où règne une ambiance de cirque, racontant une histoire aussi glauque que touchante. 



La formation s'est transformée depuis ses débuts en 2009, bien que Marton Maderspach (drums) et Lysandre Champagne (trompette et voix) demeurent au coeur du groupe. C'est maintenant Jeff Moseley qui assure le travail harmonique à la guitare alors que Blanche Baillargeon soutient le groupe à la contrebasse et qu'Yvan Belleau ajoute sa touche de virtuosité à la clarinette. 

Plusieurs instrumentistes viendront s'ajouter pour la production du troisième opus: vous entendrez du marimba, de la scie égoïne, du tuba et bien sûr quelques pièces au piano avec Maude Locat. 

En résumé, vos sous seront utilisés pour nous aider à payer la production de l'album. Parce que la musique, ça coûte de l'argent pour la faire!

Par exemple, payer le studio, s'entourer de personnes talentueuses, louer des locaux de répétition, louer des instruments rares et intéressants pour vos oreilles... 
Et puis là... on est pas rendu à se payer, ce serait un beau luxe!!! Mais on ne perd pas espoir. La pré-vente va nous permettre de consolider ce beau projet, parce que ce ne sont pas les idées qui manquent dans ce groupe.
... Et oh oui, pour le truc des bobettes! Si tu as vu notre show entre 2010 et 2014 tu te souviens probablement d'elles! Eh bien elles sont à vendre! On a sûrement quelques fans dans nos tiroirs prêts à faire une folie!

Pour les revoir en contexte, c'est par ici: Voyez ici (à partir de 2:00) l'extrait du spectacle de 2011 au très sérieux Festival International de Jazz de Montréal!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=te7q8qhMn-I

story:
My name is Sarah Summers and, after a year in the studio, I am almost finished recording my first album, titled "Lovely Little Things". With the artistry of producer/arranger Sean Carscadden and sound engineer Andy Saks, as well as contributions from local musicians Cliff Hugo, Mikey Cannon, and Michael Fesckes, the album has become a full-production storytelling of small town life and the characters within it. In order to finish mixing, mastering, and printing of the album and of an additional in-studio acoustic EP, in order to secure the Sebastiani Theater with full sound equipment for a release concert in the spring, and in order to get the album to you, we need your help. Please donate and help Lovely Little Things become a reality. Your support is greatly appreciated and essential to the success of this album. Thank you! xoxo

ALL DONATION AMOUNTS ARE ACCEPTED AND APPRECIATED!


IF WE RAISE $5500+... we will be able to successfully mix, master, and print Lovely Little Things and the additional acoustic EP, secure the historic Sebastiani Theater in Sonoma, CA for an album release concert, hire all the musicians featured on the album to play at the concert, and professionally record and mix the release concert for a live album.


IF WE RAISE $7000+ ...we will be able to secure the videographers of our choice to document the release concert and soundcheck and make a live performance film.


IF WE RAISE $12,000+ ...we will have the funds to take the band on TOUR!!, hitting music hotspots Nashville, Austin, and New Orleans.
